Though it was rather desirable that [Mr]1338-mr and [Mrs Musgrove]96-charles should be previously alarmed by some share of delay ; yet the time required by the Uppercross horses to take [them]1339-them back , would be a dreadful extension of suspense ; and [Captain Wentworth]117-captain wentworth proposed , and [Charles Musgrove]96-charles agreed , that it would be much better for [him]117-captain wentworth to take a chaise from [the inn]1158-the inn , and leave [[Mr Musgrove]120-mrs musgrove 's carriage]1341-mr musgrove 's carriage and horses to be sent [home]285-home the next morning early , when there would be the farther advantage of sending an account of [Louisa]124-louisa 's night .

[Captain Wentworth]117-captain wentworth now hurried off to get everything ready on [his]117-captain wentworth part , and to be soon followed by [the two ladies]1343-the two ladies . When the plan was made known to [Mary]94-mary , however , there was an end of all peace in it . [She]94-mary was so wretched and so vehement , complained so much of injustice in being expected to go away instead of [Anne]93-anne ; [Anne]93-anne , who was nothing to [Louisa]124-louisa , while [she]93-anne was [[her]93-anne sister]476-her sister , and had the best right to stay in [[Henrietta]123-henrietta 's stead]1345-henrietta 's stead ! Why was not [she]94-mary to be as useful as [Anne]93-anne ? And to go [home]285-home without [Charles]96-charles , too , without [[her]94-mary husband]2315-her husband ! No , it was too unkind . And in short , [she]94-mary said more than [[her]94-mary husband]2315-her husband could long withstand , and as [none of [the others]359-the others]1349-none of the others could oppose when [he]2315-her husband gave way , there was no help for it ; the change of [Mary]94-mary for [Anne]93-anne was inevitable .

[Anne]93-anne had never submitted more reluctantly to the jealous and ill - judging claims of [Mary]94-mary ; but so it must be , and [they]1351-they set off for [the town]1093-the town , [Charles]96-charles taking care of [[his]2315-her husband sister]799-his sister , and [Captain Benwick]155-captain benwick attending to [her]93-anne . [She]94-mary gave a moment 's recollection , as [they]1351-they hurried along , to the little circumstances which [the same spots]1354-the same spots had witnessed earlier in the morning . There [she]94-mary had listened to [Henrietta]123-henrietta 's schemes for [Dr Shirley]152-dr shirley 's leaving [Uppercross]4-uppercross ; farther on , [she]94-mary had first seen [Mr Elliot]102-mr elliot ; a moment seemed all that could now be given to [any one]1355-any one but [Louisa]124-louisa , or [those who were wrapt up in [her]124-louisa welfare]1356-those who were wrapt up in her welfare .

[Captain Benwick]155-captain benwick was most considerately attentive to [her]94-mary ; and , united as [they]1351-they all seemed by the distress of the day , [she]94-mary felt an increasing degree of good - will towards [him]155-captain benwick , and a pleasure even in thinking that it might , perhaps , be the occasion of continuing [their]1351-they acquaintance .

[Captain Wentworth]117-captain wentworth was on the watch for [them]1351-they , and a chaise and four in waiting , stationed for [their]1351-they convenience in [the lowest part of [the street]1268-the street]1357-the lowest part of the street ; but [his]155-captain benwick evident surprise and vexation at the substitution of [one sister]1292-one sister for [the other]254-the other , the change in [his]155-captain benwick countenance , the astonishment , the expressions begun and suppressed , with which [Charles]96-charles was listened to , made but a mortifying reception of [Anne]93-anne ; or must at least convince [her]93-anne that [she]93-anne was valued only as [she]93-anne could be useful to [Louisa]124-louisa .

[She]94-mary endeavoured to be composed , and to be just . Without emulating the feelings of [an Emma]1361-an emma towards [[her]94-mary Henry]1362-her henry , [she]94-mary would have attended on [Louisa]124-louisa with a zeal above the common claims of regard , for [his]1362-her henry sake ; and [she]94-mary hoped [he]1362-her henry would not long be so unjust as to suppose [she]94-mary would shrink unnecessarily from the office of [a friend]1363-a friend .

In the meanwhile [she]94-mary was in [the carriage]683-the carriage . [He]155-captain benwick had handed [them]1365-them both in , and placed [himself]155-captain benwick between [them]1365-them ; and in this manner , under these circumstances , full of astonishment and emotion to [Anne]93-anne , [she]94-mary quitted [Lyme]48-lyme . How the long stage would pass ; how it was to affect [their]1365-them manners ; what was to be [their]1365-them sort of intercourse , [she]94-mary could not foresee . It was all quite natural , however . [He]155-captain benwick was devoted to [Henrietta]123-henrietta ; always turning towards [her]123-henrietta ; and when [he]155-captain benwick spoke at all , always with the view of supporting [her]123-henrietta hopes and raising [her]123-henrietta spirits . In general , [his]155-captain benwick voice and manner were studiously calm . To spare [Henrietta]123-henrietta from agitation seemed the governing principle . Once only , when [she]94-mary had been grieving over the last ill - judged , ill - fated walk to [the Cobb]49-the cobb , bitterly lamenting that it ever had been thought of , [he]155-captain benwick burst forth , as if wholly overcome--

" Do n't talk of it , do n't talk of it , "[155-captain benwick] [he]155-captain benwick cried . " Oh God ! that [I]155-captain benwick had not given way to [her]123-henrietta at the fatal moment ! Had [I]155-captain benwick done as [I]155-captain benwick ought ! But so eager and so resolute ! Dear , [sweet Louisa]124-louisa ! "[155-captain benwick]

[Anne]93-anne wondered whether it ever occurred to [him]155-captain benwick now , to question the justness of [his]155-captain benwick own previous opinion as to the universal felicity and advantage of firmness of character ; and whether it might not strike [him]155-captain benwick that , like all other qualities of the mind , it should have its proportions and limits . [She]93-anne thought it could scarcely escape [him]155-captain benwick to feel that a persuadable temper might sometimes be as much in favour of happiness as a very resolute character .

[They]1366-they got on fast . [Anne]93-anne was astonished to recognise [the same hills]1367-the same hills and the same objects so soon . [Their]1366-they actual speed , heightened by some dread of the conclusion , made [the road]1368-the road appear but half as long as on the day before . It was growing quite dusk , however , before [they]1366-they were in [the neighbourhood of Uppercross]1369-the neighbourhood of uppercross , and there had been total silence among [them]1366-they for some time , [Henrietta]123-henrietta leaning back in the corner , with a shawl over [her]123-henrietta face , giving the hope of [her]123-henrietta having cried [herself]123-henrietta to sleep ; when , as [they]1366-they were going up [[their]1366-they last hill]1370-their last hill , [Anne]93-anne found [herself]93-anne all at once addressed by [Captain Wentworth]117-captain wentworth . In a low , cautious voice , [he]117-captain wentworth said:--

" [I]117-captain wentworth have been considering what [we]1366-they had best do . [She]123-henrietta must not appear at first . [She]123-henrietta could not stand it . [I]117-captain wentworth have been thinking whether [you]93-anne had not better remain in [the carriage]683-the carriage with [her]123-henrietta , while [I]117-captain wentworth go in and break it to [Mr and Mrs Musgrove]120-mrs musgrove . Do [you]117-captain wentworth think this is a good plan ? "[117-captain wentworth]

[She]93-anne did : [he]117-captain wentworth was satisfied , and said no more . But the remembrance of the appeal remained a pleasure to [her]93-anne , as a proof of friendship , and of deference for [her]93-anne judgement , a great pleasure ; and when it became a sort of parting proof , its value did not lessen .

When the distressing communication at [Uppercross]4-uppercross was over , and [he]117-captain wentworth had seen [the father]583-the father and [mother]473-mother quite as composed as could be hoped , and [the daughter]1373-the daughter all the better for being with [them]1374-them , [he]117-captain wentworth announced [his]117-captain wentworth intention of returning in [the same carriage]1375-the same carriage to [Lyme]48-lyme ; and when the horses were baited , [he]117-captain wentworth was off .

( End of volume one . )

Chapter 13

The remainder of [Anne]93-anne 's time at [Uppercross]4-uppercross , comprehending only two days , was spent entirely at [the Mansion House]1376-the mansion house ; and [she]93-anne had the satisfaction of knowing [herself]93-anne extremely useful [there]377-there , both as [an immediate companion]1378-an immediate companion , and as assisting in all those arrangements for the future , which , in [Mr]1379-mr and [Mrs Musgrove]120-mrs musgrove 's distressed state of spirits , would have been difficulties .

[They]1374-them had an early account from [Lyme]48-lyme the next morning . [Louisa]124-louisa was much the same . No symptoms worse than before had appeared . [Charles]96-charles came a few hours afterwards , to bring a later and more particular account . [He]117-captain wentworth was tolerably cheerful . A speedy cure must not be hoped , but everything was going on as well as the nature of the case admitted . In speaking of [the Harvilles]154-the harvilles , [he]117-captain wentworth seemed unable to satisfy [his]117-captain wentworth own sense of [their]154-the harvilles kindness , especially of [Mrs Harville]140-mrs harville 's exertions as [a nurse]1380-a nurse . " [She]140-mrs harville really left nothing for [Mary]94-mary to do . [He]117-captain wentworth and [Mary]94-mary had been persuaded to go early to [[their]1374-them inn]2770-their inn last night . [Mary]94-mary had been hysterical again this morning . When [he]117-captain wentworth came away , [she]140-mrs harville was going to walk out with [Captain Benwick]155-captain benwick , which , [he]117-captain wentworth hoped , would do [her]140-mrs harville good . [He]117-captain wentworth almost wished [she]140-mrs harville had been prevailed on to come [home]285-home the day before ; but the truth was , that [Mrs Harville]140-mrs harville left nothing for [anybody]2413-anybody to do . "[117-captain wentworth]

[Charles]96-charles was to return to [Lyme]48-lyme the same afternoon , and [[his]1381-his father]2282-his father had at first half a mind to go with [him]1381-his , but [the ladies]1179-the ladies could not consent . It would be going only to multiply trouble to [the others]359-the others , and increase [his]1381-his own distress ; and a much better scheme followed and was acted upon . A chaise was sent for from [Crewkherne]162-crewkherne , and [Charles]96-charles conveyed back [a far more useful person in [the old nursery - maid of [the family]312-the family]1386-the old nursery - maid of the family , one who having brought up [all the children]1388-all the children , and seen the very last , the lingering and long - petted Master Harry , sent to [school]380-school after [[his]1390-his brothers]1391-his brothers , was now living in [[her]1386-the old nursery - maid of the family deserted nursery]1392-her deserted nursery to mend stockings and dress all the blains and bruises [she]1386-the old nursery - maid of the family could get near [her]1386-the old nursery - maid of the family , and who , consequently , was only too happy in being allowed to go and help nurse dear [Miss Louisa]124-louisa]1385-a far more useful person in the old nursery - maid of the family , one who having brought up all the children , and seen the very last , the lingering and long - petted master harry , sent to school after his brothers , was now living in her deserted nursery to mend stockings and dress all the blains and bruises she could get near her , and who , consequently , was only too happy in being allowed to go and help nurse dear miss louisa . Vague wishes of getting [Sarah thither]168-sarah thither , had occurred before to [Mrs Musgrove]96-charles and [Henrietta]123-henrietta ; but without [Anne]93-anne , it would hardly have been resolved on , and found practicable so soon .

[They]1393-they were indebted , the next day , to [Charles Hayter]95-charles , for all the minute knowledge of [Louisa]124-louisa , which it was so essential to obtain every twenty - four hours . [He]95-charles made it [his]95-charles business to go to [Lyme]48-lyme , and [his]95-charles account was still encouraging . The intervals of sense and consciousness were believed to be stronger . Every report agreed in [Captain Wentworth]117-captain wentworth 's appearing fixed in [Lyme]48-lyme .

[Anne]93-anne was to leave [them]1393-they on the morrow , an event which [they]1393-they all dreaded . " What should [they]1393-they do without [her]124-louisa ? [They]1393-they were wretched comforters for [one another]808-one another . "[93-anne] And so much was said in this way , that [Anne]93-anne thought [she]93-anne could not do better than impart among [them]1393-they the general inclination to which [she]93-anne was privy , and persuaded [them]1393-they all to go to [Lyme]48-lyme at once . [She]93-anne had little difficulty ; it was soon determined that [they]1393-they would go ; go to - morrow , fix [themselves]1393-they at [the inn]1158-the inn , or get into [lodgings]1395-lodgings , as it suited , and there remain till [dear Louisa]124-louisa could be moved . [They]1393-they must be taking off some trouble from [the good people [she]93-anne was with]1396-the good people she was with ; [they]1393-they might at least relieve [Mrs Harville]140-mrs harville from the care of [[her]140-mrs harville own children]1397-her own children ; and in short , [they]1393-they were so happy in the decision , that [Anne]93-anne was delighted with what [she]93-anne had done , and felt that [she]93-anne could not spend [her]93-anne last morning at [Uppercross]4-uppercross better than in assisting [their]1393-they preparations , and sending [them]1393-they off at an early hour , though [her]93-anne being left to [the solitary range of [the house]310-the house]1398-the solitary range of the house was the consequence .

[She]93-anne was the last , excepting [the little boys at [the cottage]608-the cottage]1400-the little boys at the cottage , [she]93-anne was the very last , the only remaining one of all that had filled and animated [both houses]602-both houses , of all that had given [Uppercross]144-uppercross its cheerful character . A few days had made a change indeed !

If [Louisa]124-louisa recovered , it would all be well again . More than former happiness would be restored . There could not be a doubt , to [her]93-anne mind there was none , of what would follow [her]93-anne recovery . A few months hence , and [the room now so deserted]1403-the room now so deserted , occupied but by [her]93-anne silent , pensive self , might be filled again with all that was happy and gay , all that was glowing and bright in prosperous love , all that was most unlike [Anne Elliot]93-anne !

An hour 's complete leisure for such reflections as these , on a dark November day , a small thick rain almost blotting out the very few objects ever to be discerned from the windows , was enough to make the sound of [Lady Russell]101-lady russell 's carriage exceedingly welcome ; and yet , though desirous to be gone , [she]93-anne could not quit [the Mansion House]1376-the mansion house , or look an adieu to [the Cottage]608-the cottage , with [its]608-the cottage black , dripping and comfortless veranda , or even notice through the misty glasses [the last humble tenements of [the village]2401-the village]1406-the last humble tenements of the village , without a saddened heart . [Scenes]169-scenes had passed in [Uppercross]4-uppercross which made it precious . [It]1408-it stood the record of many sensations of pain , once severe , but now softened ; and of some instances of relenting feeling , some breathings of friendship and reconciliation , which could never be looked for again , and which could never cease to be dear . [She]93-anne left it all behind [her]93-anne , all but the recollection that such things had been .

[Anne]93-anne had never entered [Kellynch]6-kellynch since [her]93-anne quitting [[Lady Russell]101-lady russell 's house]1409-lady russell 's house in September . It had not been necessary , and the few occasions of its being possible for [her]93-anne to go to [the Hall [she]93-anne had contrived to evade and escape from]1410-the hall she had contrived to evade and escape from . [Her]93-anne first return was to resume [her]93-anne place in [the modern and elegant apartments of [the Lodge]545-the lodge]1411-the modern and elegant apartments of the lodge , and to gladden the eyes of [its mistress]1413-its mistress .

There was some anxiety mixed with [Lady Russell]101-lady russell 's joy in meeting [her]93-anne . [She]93-anne knew who had been frequenting [Uppercross]4-uppercross . But happily , either [Anne]93-anne was improved in plumpness and looks , or [Lady Russell]101-lady russell fancied [her]93-anne so ; and [Anne]93-anne , in receiving [her]93-anne compliments on the occasion , had the amusement of connecting [them]1414-them with the silent admiration of [[her]93-anne cousin]2558-her cousin , and of hoping that [she]93-anne was to be blessed with a second spring of youth and beauty .

When [they]1416-their came to converse , [she]93-anne was soon sensible of some mental change . The subjects of which [her]93-anne heart had been full on leaving [Kellynch]6-kellynch , and which [she]93-anne had felt slighted , and been compelled to smother among [the Musgroves]121-the miss musgroves , were now become but of secondary interest . [She]93-anne had lately lost sight even of [[her]93-anne father]274-her father and [sister]268-sister and [Bath]10-bath . [Their]1416-their concerns had been sunk under those of [Uppercross]144-uppercross ; and when [Lady Russell]101-lady russell reverted to [their]1416-their former hopes and fears , and spoke [her]101-lady russell satisfaction in [the house in [Camden Place]60-camden place]1419-the house in camden place , which had been taken , and [her]101-lady russell regret that [Mrs Clay]105-mrs clay should still be with [them]1416-their , [Anne]93-anne would have been ashamed to have it known how much more [she]93-anne was thinking of [Lyme]48-lyme and [Louisa Musgrove]124-louisa , and all [her]93-anne acquaintance [there]377-there ; how much more interesting to [her]93-anne was [the home and the friendship of [the Harvilles]154-the harvilles and [Captain Benwick]155-captain benwick]1421-the home and the friendship of the harvilles and captain benwick , than [[[her]93-anne own father]1422-her own father 's house in [Camden Place]60-camden place]1423-her own father 's house in camden place , or [[her]93-anne own sister]509-her own sister 's intimacy with [Mrs Clay]105-mrs clay . [She]93-anne was actually forced to exert [herself]93-anne to meet [Lady Russell]101-lady russell with anything like the appearance of equal solicitude , on topics which had by nature the first claim on [her]93-anne .

There was a little awkwardness at first in [their]1425-their discourse on another subject . [They]1425-their must speak of the accident at [Lyme]48-lyme . [Lady Russell]101-lady russell had not been arrived five minutes the day before , when a full account of the whole had burst on [her]101-lady russell ; but still it must be talked of , [she]101-lady russell must make enquiries , [she]101-lady russell must regret the imprudence , lament the result , and [Captain Wentworth]117-captain wentworth 's name must be mentioned by both . [Anne]93-anne was conscious of not doing it so well as [Lady Russell]101-lady russell . [She]93-anne could not speak the name , and look straight forward to [Lady Russell]101-lady russell 's eye , till [she]93-anne had adopted the expedient of telling [her]93-anne briefly what [she]93-anne thought of the attachment between [him]117-captain wentworth and [Louisa]124-louisa . When this was told , [his]117-captain wentworth name distressed [her]93-anne no longer .

[Lady Russell]101-lady russell had only to listen composedly , and wish [them]1425-their happy , but internally [her]93-anne heart revelled in angry pleasure , in pleased contempt , that [the man who at twenty - three]1426-the man who at twenty - three had seemed to understand somewhat of the value of an [Anne Elliot]93-anne , should , eight years afterwards , be charmed by [a Louisa Musgrove]124-louisa .

The first three or four days passed most quietly , with no circumstance to mark [them]1425-their excepting the receipt of a note or two from [Lyme]48-lyme , which found [their]1425-their way to [Anne]93-anne , [she]93-anne could not tell how , and brought a rather improving account of [Louisa]124-louisa . At the end of that period , [Lady Russell]101-lady russell 's politeness could repose no longer , and the fainter self - threatenings of the past became in a decided tone , " [I]93-anne must call on [Mrs Croft]112-mrs croft ; [I]93-anne really must call upon [her]112-mrs croft soon . [Anne]93-anne , have [you]93-anne courage to go with [me]93-anne , and pay a visit in [that house]445-that house ? It will be some trial to [us]2775-us both . "[93-anne]

[Anne]93-anne did not shrink from it ; on the contrary , [she]93-anne truly felt as [she]93-anne said , in observing--

" [I]93-anne think [you]93-anne are very likely to suffer the most of the two ; [your]93-anne feelings are less reconciled to the change than [mine]93-anne . By remaining in [the neighbourhood]281-the neighbourhood , [I]93-anne am become inured to it . "[93-anne]

[She]93-anne could have said more on the subject ; for [she]93-anne had in fact so high an opinion of [the Crofts]116-the crofts , and considered [[her]93-anne father]274-her father so very fortunate in [[his]274-her father tenants]1428-his tenants , felt [the parish]2367-the parish to be so sure of a good example , and the poor of the best attention and relief , that however sorry and ashamed for the necessity of the removal , [she]93-anne could not but in conscience feel that [they]116-the crofts were gone who deserved not to stay , and that [Kellynch Hall]1-kellynch hall had passed into better hands than [its owners]1430-its owners ' . These convictions must unquestionably have [their]116-the crofts own pain , and severe was its kind ; but [they]116-the crofts precluded that pain which [Lady Russell]101-lady russell would suffer in entering [the house]310-the house again , and returning through [the well - known apartments]1432-the well - known apartments .

In such moments [Anne]93-anne had no power of saying to [herself]93-anne , " [These rooms]2777-these rooms ought to belong only to [us]2778-us . Oh , how fallen in [their]116-the crofts destination ! How unworthily occupied ! [An ancient family]2779-an ancient family to be so driven away ! [Strangers]810-strangers filling [[their]116-the crofts place]2781-their place ! "[93-anne] No , except when [she]93-anne thought of [[her]93-anne mother]263-her mother , and remembered where [she]263-her mother had been used to sit and preside , [she]93-anne had no sigh of that description to heave .

[Mrs Croft]112-mrs croft always met [her]93-anne with a kindness which gave [her]93-anne the pleasure of fancying [herself]93-anne a favourite , and on the present occasion , receiving [her]93-anne in [that house]445-that house , there was particular attention .

The sad accident at [Lyme]48-lyme was soon the prevailing topic , and on comparing [their]1435-their latest accounts of [the invalid]1436-the invalid , it appeared that [each lady]515-each lady dated [her]515-each lady intelligence from the same hour of yestermorn ; that [Captain Wentworth]117-captain wentworth had been in [Kellynch]6-kellynch yesterday ( the first time since the accident ) , had brought [Anne]93-anne the last note , which [she]93-anne had not been able to trace the exact steps of ; had staid a few hours and then returned again to [Lyme]48-lyme , and without any present intention of quitting it any more . [He]117-captain wentworth had enquired after [her]93-anne , [she]93-anne found , particularly ; had expressed [his]117-captain wentworth hope of [Miss Elliot]93-anne 's not being the worse for [her]93-anne exertions , and had spoken of those exertions as great . This was handsome , and gave [her]93-anne more pleasure than almost anything else could have done .

As to the sad catastrophe itself , it could be canvassed only in one style by [a couple of [steady , sensible women , whose judgements had to work on ascertained events]1439-steady , sensible women , whose judgements had to work on ascertained events]1438-a couple of steady , sensible women , whose judgements had to work on ascertained events ; and it was perfectly decided that it had been the consequence of much thoughtlessness and much imprudence ; that its effects were most alarming , and that it was frightful to think , how long [Miss Musgrove]124-louisa 's recovery might yet be doubtful , and how liable [she]124-louisa would still remain to suffer from the concussion hereafter ! [The Admiral]411-the admiral wound it up summarily by exclaiming--

" Ay , a very bad business indeed . A new sort of way this , for [a young fellow]2782-a young fellow to be making love , by breaking [[his]2782-a young fellow mistress]2783-his mistress 's head , is not it , [Miss Elliot]93-anne ? This is breaking a head and giving a plaster , truly ! "[411-the admiral]

[Admiral Croft]111-admiral croft 's manners were not quite of the tone to suit [Lady Russell]101-lady russell , but they delighted [Anne]93-anne . [His]117-captain wentworth goodness of heart and simplicity of character were irresistible .

" Now , this must be very bad for [you]93-anne , "[117-captain wentworth] said [he]117-captain wentworth , suddenly rousing from a little reverie , " to be coming and finding [us]2784-we here . [I]117-captain wentworth had not recollected it before , [I]117-captain wentworth declare , but it must be very bad . But now , do not stand upon ceremony . Get up and go over [all the rooms in [the house]310-the house]2785-all the rooms in the house if [you]93-anne like it . "[117-captain wentworth]

" Another time , [Sir]2533-sir , [I]411-the admiral thank [you]2533-sir , not now . "[411-the admiral]

" Well , whenever it suits [you]93-anne . [You]93-anne can slip in from the shrubbery at any time ; and there [you]93-anne will find [we]2784-we keep [our]2784-we umbrellas hanging up by that door . A good place is not it ? But , "[117-captain wentworth] ( checking [himself]117-captain wentworth ) , " [you]93-anne will not think it a good place , for [yours]93-anne were always kept in [[the butler]2788-the butler 's room]2789-the butler 's room . Ay , so it always is , [I]117-captain wentworth believe . [One man]2790-one man 's ways may be as good as another 's , but [we]2784-we all like [our]2784-we own best . And so [you]93-anne must judge for [yourself]93-anne , whether it would be better for [you]93-anne to go about [the house]310-the house or not . "[117-captain wentworth]

[Anne]93-anne , finding [she]93-anne might decline it , did so , very gratefully .

" [We]2784-we have made very few changes either , "[411-the admiral] continued [the Admiral]411-the admiral , after thinking a moment . " Very few . [We]2784-we told [you]93-anne about the laundry - door , at [Uppercross]4-uppercross . That has been a very great improvement . The wonder was , how [any family upon earth]2792-any family upon earth could bear with the inconvenience of [its]2792-any family upon earth opening as it did , so long ! [You]93-anne will tell [Sir Walter]90-sir walter what [we]2784-we have done , and that [Mr Shepherd]103-mr shepherd thinks it the greatest improvement [the house]310-the house ever had . Indeed , [I]411-the admiral must do [ourselves]2784-we the justice to say , that the few alterations [we]2784-we have made have been all very much for the better . [[My]411-the admiral wife]2794-my wife should have the credit of them , however . [I]411-the admiral have done very little besides sending away some of the large looking - glasses from [[my]411-the admiral dressing - room]2795-my dressing - room , which was [[your]93-anne father]2212-your father 's . [A very good man]2797-a very good man , and very much [the gentleman]2219-the gentleman [I]411-the admiral am sure : but [I]411-the admiral should think , [Miss Elliot]93-anne , "[411-the admiral] ( looking with serious reflection ) , " [I]411-the admiral should think [he]2797-a very good man must be rather [a dressy man]2799-a dressy man for [his]2797-a very good man time of life . Such a number of looking - glasses ! oh Lord ! there was no getting away from [[one]252-one 's self]2801-one 's self . So [I]411-the admiral got [Sophy]135-sophy to lend [me]411-the admiral a hand , and [we]2802-we soon shifted [[their]2802-we quarters]2803-their quarters ; and now [I]411-the admiral am quite snug , with [my]411-the admiral little shaving glass in one corner , and another great thing that [I]411-the admiral never go near . "[411-the admiral]

[Anne]93-anne , amused in spite of [herself]93-anne , was rather distressed for an answer , and [the Admiral]411-the admiral , fearing [he]411-the admiral might not have been civil enough , took up the subject again , to say--

" The next time [you]93-anne write to [[your]93-anne good father]2804-your good father , [Miss Elliot]93-anne , pray give [him]2804-your good father [my]411-the admiral compliments and [Mrs Croft]112-mrs croft 's , and say that [we]2802-we are settled [here]2340-here quite to [our]2802-we liking , and have no fault at all to find with [the place]418-the place . [The breakfast - room chimney]2807-the breakfast - room chimney smokes a little , [I]411-the admiral grant [you]93-anne , but it is only when the wind is due north and blows hard , which may not happen three times a winter . And take it altogether , now that [we]2802-we have been into [most of [the houses hereabouts]2809-the houses hereabouts]2808-most of the houses hereabouts and can judge , there is not one that [we]2802-we like better than this . Pray say so , with [my]411-the admiral compliments . [He]411-the admiral will be glad to hear it . "[411-the admiral]

[Lady Russell]101-lady russell and [Mrs Croft]112-mrs croft were very well pleased with [each other]489-each other : but the acquaintance which this visit began was fated not to proceed far at present ; for when it was returned , [the Crofts]116-the crofts announced [themselves]116-the crofts to be going away for a few weeks , to visit [their]116-the crofts connexions in [the north of [the county]1445-the county]1444-the north of the county , and probably might not be at [home]285-home again before [Lady Russell]101-lady russell would be removing to [Bath]10-bath .

So ended all danger to [Anne]93-anne of meeting [Captain Wentworth]117-captain wentworth at [Kellynch Hall]1-kellynch hall , or of seeing [him]117-captain wentworth in company with [[her]93-anne friend]546-her friend . Everything was safe enough , and [she]93-anne smiled over the many anxious feelings [she]93-anne had wasted on the subject .

Chapter 14

Though [Charles]95-charles and [Mary]94-mary had remained at [Lyme]48-lyme much longer after [Mr and Mrs Musgrove]120-mrs musgrove 's going than [Anne]93-anne conceived [they]116-the crofts could have been at all wanted , [they]116-the crofts were yet [the first of [the family]312-the family]1448-the first of the family to be at [home]285-home again ; and as soon as possible after [their]116-the crofts return to [Uppercross]4-uppercross [they]116-the crofts drove over to [the Lodge]545-the lodge . [They]116-the crofts had left [Louisa]124-louisa beginning to sit up ; but [her]124-louisa head , though clear , was exceedingly weak , and [her]124-louisa nerves susceptible to the highest extreme of tenderness ; and though [she]124-louisa might be pronounced to be altogether doing very well , it was still impossible to say when [she]124-louisa might be able to bear the removal [home]285-home ; and [[her]124-louisa father]274-her father and [mother]473-mother , who must return in time to receive [[their]116-the crofts younger children]1455-their younger children for the Christmas holidays , had hardly a hope of being allowed to bring [her]124-louisa with [them]116-the crofts .

[They]116-the crofts had been all in [lodgings]1395-lodgings together . [Mrs Musgrove]120-mrs musgrove had got [[Mrs Harville]140-mrs harville 's children]1457-mrs harville 's children away as much as [she]140-mrs harville could , every possible supply from [Uppercross]4-uppercross had been furnished , to lighten the inconvenience to [the Harvilles]154-the harvilles , while [the Harvilles]154-the harvilles had been wanting [them]1457-mrs harville 's children to come to dinner every day ; and in short , it seemed to have been only a struggle on each side as to which should be most disinterested and hospitable .

[Mary]94-mary had had [her]94-mary evils ; but upon the whole , as was evident by [her]94-mary staying so long , [she]94-mary had found more to enjoy than to suffer . [Charles Hayter]95-charles had been at [Lyme]48-lyme oftener than suited [her]124-louisa ; and when [they]1458-they dined with [the Harvilles]154-the harvilles there had been only [a maid - servant]1459-a maid - servant to wait , and at first [Mrs Harville]140-mrs harville had always given [Mrs Musgrove]120-mrs musgrove precedence ; but then , [she]140-mrs harville had received so very handsome an apology from [her]140-mrs harville on finding out whose daughter [she]140-mrs harville was , and there had been so much going on every day , there had been so many walks between [[their]1458-they lodgings]1460-their lodgings and [the Harvilles]154-the harvilles , and [she]140-mrs harville had got books from [the library]1461-the library , and changed them so often , that the balance had certainly been much in favour of [Lyme]48-lyme . [She]140-mrs harville had been taken to [Charmouth]50-charmouth too , and [she]140-mrs harville had bathed , and [she]140-mrs harville had gone to [church]1462-church , and there were [a great many more people]1463-a great many more people to look at in [the church at [Lyme]48-lyme]1464-the church at lyme than at [Uppercross]4-uppercross ; and all this , joined to the sense of being so very useful , had made really an agreeable fortnight .

[Anne]93-anne enquired after [Captain Benwick]155-captain benwick . [Mary]94-mary 's face was clouded directly . [Charles]95-charles laughed .

" Oh ! [Captain Benwick]155-captain benwick is very well , [I]93-anne believe , but [he]155-captain benwick is [a very odd young man]2810-a very odd young man . [I]93-anne do not know what [he]155-captain benwick would be at . [We]2811-we asked [him]155-captain benwick to come [home]285-home with [us]2811-we for a day or two : [Charles]95-charles undertook to give [him]155-captain benwick some shooting , and [he]155-captain benwick seemed quite delighted , and , for [my]93-anne part , [I]93-anne thought it was all settled ; when behold ! on Tuesday night , [he]155-captain benwick made a very awkward sort of excuse ; ' [he]155-captain benwick never shot ' and [he]155-captain benwick had ' been quite misunderstood , ' and [he]155-captain benwick had promised this and [he]155-captain benwick had promised that , and the end of it was , [I]93-anne found , that [he]155-captain benwick did not mean to come . [I]93-anne suppose [he]155-captain benwick was afraid of finding it dull ; but upon [my]93-anne word [I]93-anne should have thought [we]2811-we were lively enough at [the Cottage]608-the cottage for [such a heart - broken man as [Captain Benwick]155-captain benwick]2814-such a heart - broken man as captain benwick . "[93-anne]

[Charles]95-charles laughed again and said , " Now [Mary]94-mary , [you]94-mary know very well how it really was . It was all [your]94-mary doing , "[95-charles] ( turning to [Anne]93-anne . ) " [He]155-captain benwick fancied that if [he]155-captain benwick went with [us]2811-we , [he]155-captain benwick should find [you]94-mary close by : [he]155-captain benwick fancied [everybody]651-everybody to be living in [Uppercross]4-uppercross ; and when [he]155-captain benwick discovered that [Lady Russell]101-lady russell lived three miles off , [his]155-captain benwick heart failed [him]155-captain benwick , and [he]155-captain benwick had not courage to come . That is the fact , upon [my]95-charles honour . [Mary]94-mary knows it is . "[95-charles]

But [Mary]94-mary did not give into it very graciously , whether from not considering [Captain Benwick]155-captain benwick entitled by birth and situation to be in love with [an Elliot]1465-an elliot , or from not wanting to believe [Anne]93-anne a greater attraction to [Uppercross]4-uppercross than [herself]93-anne , must be left to be guessed . [Anne]93-anne 's good - will , however , was not to be lessened by what [she]93-anne heard . [She]93-anne boldly acknowledged [herself]93-anne flattered , and continued [her]93-anne enquiries .

" Oh ! [he]155-captain benwick talks of [you]93-anne , "[95-charles] cried [Charles]95-charles , " in such terms-- "[95-charles] [Mary]94-mary interrupted [him]95-charles . " [I]95-charles declare , [Charles]95-charles , [I]95-charles never heard [him]155-captain benwick mention [Anne]93-anne twice all the time [I]95-charles was [there]377-there . [I]95-charles declare , [Anne]93-anne , [he]155-captain benwick never talks of [you]93-anne at all . "[95-charles]

" No , "[95-charles] admitted [Charles]95-charles , " [I]95-charles do not know that [he]155-captain benwick ever does , in a general way ; but however , it is a very clear thing that [he]155-captain benwick admires [you]93-anne exceedingly . [His]155-captain benwick head is full of some books that [he]155-captain benwick is reading upon [your]93-anne recommendation , and [he]155-captain benwick wants to talk to [you]93-anne about them ; [he]155-captain benwick has found out something or other in one of them which [he]155-captain benwick thinks -- oh ! [I]95-charles can not pretend to remember it , but it was something very fine -- [I]95-charles overheard [him]155-captain benwick telling [Henrietta]123-henrietta all about it ; and then ' [Miss Elliot]93-anne ' was spoken of in the highest terms ! Now [Mary]94-mary , [I]95-charles declare it was so , [I]95-charles heard it [myself]95-charles , and [you]94-mary were in [the other room]2817-the other room . ' Elegance , sweetness , beauty . ' Oh ! there was no end of [Miss Elliot]93-anne 's charms . "[95-charles]

" And [I]94-mary am sure , "[94-mary] cried [Mary]94-mary , warmly , " it was a very little to [his]155-captain benwick credit , if [he]155-captain benwick did . [Miss Harville]171-miss harville only died last June . Such a heart is very little worth having ; is it , [Lady Russell]101-lady russell ? [I]94-mary am sure [you]101-lady russell will agree with [me]94-mary . "[94-mary]

" [I]101-lady russell must see [Captain Benwick]155-captain benwick before [I]101-lady russell decide , "[101-lady russell] said [Lady Russell]101-lady russell , smiling .

" And that [you]101-lady russell are very likely to do very soon , [I]95-charles can tell [you]101-lady russell , [ma'am]2584-ma'am , "[95-charles] said [Charles]95-charles . " Though [he]155-captain benwick had not nerves for coming away with [us]2819-us , and setting off again afterwards to pay a formal visit here , [he]155-captain benwick will make [his]155-captain benwick way over to [Kellynch]6-kellynch one day by [himself]155-captain benwick , [you]101-lady russell may depend on it . [I]95-charles told [him]155-captain benwick the distance and [the road]1368-the road , and [I]95-charles told [him]155-captain benwick of [the church]2821-the church 's being so very well worth seeing ; for as [he]155-captain benwick has a taste for those sort of things , [I]95-charles thought that would be a good excuse , and [he]155-captain benwick listened with all [his]155-captain benwick understanding and soul ; and [I]95-charles am sure from [his]155-captain benwick manner that [you]101-lady russell will have [him]155-captain benwick calling [here]2340-here soon . So , [I]95-charles give [you]101-lady russell notice , [Lady Russell]101-lady russell . "[95-charles]

" [Any acquaintance of [Anne]93-anne 's]2823-any acquaintance of anne 's will always be welcome to [me]101-lady russell , "[101-lady russell] was [Lady Russell]101-lady russell 's kind answer .

" Oh ! as to being [Anne]93-anne 's acquaintance , "[94-mary] said [Mary]94-mary , " [I]94-mary think [he]155-captain benwick is rather [my]94-mary acquaintance , for [I]94-mary have been seeing [him]155-captain benwick every day this last fortnight . "[94-mary]

" Well , as [your]101-lady russell joint acquaintance , then , [I]101-lady russell shall be very happy to see [Captain Benwick]155-captain benwick . "[101-lady russell]

" [You]101-lady russell will not find anything very agreeable in [him]155-captain benwick , [I]94-mary assure [you]101-lady russell , [ma'am]2584-ma'am . [He]155-captain benwick is [one of the dullest young men that ever lived]2825-one of the dullest young men that ever lived . [He]155-captain benwick has walked with [me]94-mary , sometimes , from one end of [the sands]1200-the sands to the other , without saying a word . [He]155-captain benwick is not at all [a well - bred young man]2827-a well - bred young man . [I]94-mary am sure [you]101-lady russell will not like [him]155-captain benwick . "[94-mary]

" There [we]2828-we differ , [Mary]94-mary , "[93-anne] said [Anne]93-anne . " [I]93-anne think [Lady Russell]101-lady russell would like [him]155-captain benwick . [I]93-anne think [she]101-lady russell would be so much pleased with [his]155-captain benwick mind , that [she]101-lady russell would very soon see no deficiency in [his]155-captain benwick manner . "[93-anne]

" So do [I]95-charles , [Anne]93-anne , "[95-charles] said [Charles]95-charles . " [I]95-charles am sure [Lady Russell]101-lady russell would like [him]155-captain benwick . [He]155-captain benwick is just [Lady Russell]101-lady russell 's sort . Give [him]155-captain benwick a book , and [he]155-captain benwick will read all day long . "[95-charles]

" Yes , that [he]155-captain benwick will ! "[94-mary] exclaimed [Mary]94-mary , tauntingly . " [He]155-captain benwick will sit poring over [his]155-captain benwick book , and not know when [a person]2702-a person speaks to [him]155-captain benwick , or when one drops [one]252-one 's scissors , or anything that happens . Do [you]101-lady russell think [Lady Russell]101-lady russell would like that ? "[94-mary]

[Lady Russell]101-lady russell could not help laughing . " Upon [my]101-lady russell word , "[101-lady russell] said [she]101-lady russell , " [I]101-lady russell should not have supposed that [my]101-lady russell opinion of [any one]1355-any one could have admitted of such difference of conjecture , steady and matter of fact as [I]101-lady russell may call [myself]101-lady russell . [I]101-lady russell have really a curiosity to see [the person who can give occasion to such directly opposite notions]2832-the person who can give occasion to such directly opposite notions . [I]101-lady russell wish [he]155-captain benwick may be induced to call here . And when [he]155-captain benwick does , [Mary]94-mary , [you]94-mary may depend upon hearing [my]101-lady russell opinion ; but [I]101-lady russell am determined not to judge [him]155-captain benwick beforehand . "[101-lady russell]

" [You]94-mary will not like [him]155-captain benwick , [I]94-mary will answer for it . "[94-mary]

[Lady Russell]101-lady russell began talking of something else . [Mary]94-mary spoke with animation of [their]1466-their meeting with , or rather missing , [Mr Elliot]102-mr elliot so extraordinarily .

" [He]155-captain benwick is [a man]2277-a man , "[101-lady russell] said [Lady Russell]101-lady russell , " whom [I]101-lady russell have no wish to see . [His]117-captain wentworth declining to be on cordial terms with [the head of [[his]117-captain wentworth family]221-his family]2834-the head of his family , has left a very strong impression in [his]117-captain wentworth disfavour with [me]101-lady russell . "[101-lady russell]

This decision checked [Mary]94-mary 's eagerness , and stopped [her]94-mary short in the midst of the Elliot countenance .

With regard to [Captain Wentworth]117-captain wentworth , though [Anne]93-anne hazarded no enquiries , there was voluntary communication sufficient . [His]117-captain wentworth spirits had been greatly recovering lately as might be expected . As [Louisa]124-louisa improved , [he]117-captain wentworth had improved , and [he]117-captain wentworth was now quite a different creature from what [he]117-captain wentworth had been the first week . [He]117-captain wentworth had not seen [Louisa]124-louisa ; and was so extremely fearful of any ill consequence to [her]124-louisa from an interview , that [he]117-captain wentworth did not press for it at all ; and , on the contrary , seemed to have a plan of going away for a week or ten days , till [her]124-louisa head was stronger . [He]117-captain wentworth had talked of going down to [Plymouth]28-plymouth for a week , and wanted to persuade [Captain Benwick]155-captain benwick to go with [him]117-captain wentworth ; but , as [Charles]95-charles maintained to the last , [Captain Benwick]155-captain benwick seemed much more disposed to ride over to [Kellynch]6-kellynch .

There can be no doubt that [Lady Russell]101-lady russell and [Anne]93-anne were both occasionally thinking of [Captain Benwick]155-captain benwick , from this time . [Lady Russell]101-lady russell could not hear the door - bell without feeling that it might be [[his]117-captain wentworth herald]1467-his herald ; nor could [Anne]93-anne return from any stroll of solitary indulgence in [[[her]93-anne father]274-her father 's grounds]1469-her father 's grounds , or any visit of charity in [the village]2401-the village , without wondering whether [she]93-anne might see [him]117-captain wentworth or hear of [him]117-captain wentworth . [Captain Benwick]155-captain benwick came not , however . [He]155-captain benwick was either less disposed for it than [Charles]95-charles had imagined , or [he]155-captain benwick was too shy ; and after giving [him]155-captain benwick a week 's indulgence , [Lady Russell]101-lady russell determined [him]155-captain benwick to be unworthy of the interest which [he]155-captain benwick had been beginning to excite .

[The Musgroves]121-the miss musgroves came back to receive [[their]1471-their happy boys]1472-their happy boys and [girls]1473-girls from [school]380-school , bringing with [them]1471-their [[Mrs Harville]140-mrs harville 's little children]1475-mrs harville 's little children , to improve the noise of [Uppercross]4-uppercross , and lessen that of [Lyme]48-lyme . [Henrietta]123-henrietta remained with [Louisa]124-louisa ; but [all the rest of [the family]312-the family]1476-all the rest of the family were again in [[their]1476-all the rest of the family usual quarters]1478-their usual quarters .

[Lady Russell]101-lady russell and [Anne]93-anne paid [their]1471-their compliments to [them]1475-mrs harville 's little children once , when [Anne]93-anne could not but feel that [Uppercross]4-uppercross was already quite alive again . Though neither [Henrietta]123-henrietta , nor [Louisa]124-louisa , nor [Charles Hayter]95-charles , nor [Captain Wentworth]117-captain wentworth were [there]377-there , [the room]406-the room presented as strong a contrast as could be wished to [the last state [she]93-anne had seen [it]406-the room in]1481-the last state she had seen it in .

Immediately surrounding [Mrs Musgrove]120-mrs musgrove were [the little Harvilles , whom [she]93-anne was sedulously guarding from the tyranny of [the two children from [the Cottage]608-the cottage]1483-the two children from the cottage]1482-the little harvilles , whom she was sedulously guarding from the tyranny of the two children from the cottage , expressly arrived to amuse [them]1482-the little harvilles , whom she was sedulously guarding from the tyranny of the two children from the cottage . On one side was a table occupied by [some chattering girls , cutting up silk and gold paper]1485-some chattering girls , cutting up silk and gold paper ; and on the other were tressels and trays , bending under the weight of brawn and cold pies , where [riotous boys]1486-riotous boys were holding high revel ; the whole completed by a roaring Christmas fire , which seemed determined to be heard , in spite of all the noise of [the others]359-the others . [Charles]95-charles and [Mary]94-mary also came in , of course , during [their]1482-the little harvilles , whom she was sedulously guarding from the tyranny of the two children from the cottage visit , and [Mr Musgrove]120-mrs musgrove made a point of paying [his]120-mrs musgrove respects to [Lady Russell]101-lady russell , and sat down close to [her]101-lady russell for ten minutes , talking with a very raised voice , but from the clamour of [the children]610-the children on [his]120-mrs musgrove knees , generally in vain . It was a fine family - piece .

[Anne]93-anne , judging from [her]93-anne own temperament , would have deemed such a domestic hurricane a bad restorative of the nerves , which [Louisa]124-louisa 's illness must have so greatly shaken . But [Mrs Musgrove]120-mrs musgrove , who got [Anne]93-anne near [her]93-anne on purpose to thank [her]93-anne most cordially , again and again , for all [her]93-anne attentions to [them]610-the children , concluded a short recapitulation of what [she]93-anne had suffered [herself]93-anne by observing , with a happy glance round [the room]406-the room , that after all [she]93-anne had gone through , nothing was so likely to do [her]93-anne good as a little quiet cheerfulness at [home]285-home .

[Louisa]124-louisa was now recovering apace . [[Her]124-louisa mother]263-her mother could even think of [her]124-louisa being able to join [their]610-the children party at [home]285-home , before [[her]124-louisa brothers]1493-her brothers and [sisters]888-sisters went to [school]380-school again . [The Harvilles]154-the harvilles had promised to come with [her]124-louisa and stay at [Uppercross]4-uppercross , whenever [she]124-louisa returned . [Captain Wentworth]117-captain wentworth was gone , for the present , to see [[his]117-captain wentworth brother]1496-his brother in [Shropshire]43-shropshire .

" [I]101-lady russell hope [I]101-lady russell shall remember , in future , "[101-lady russell] said [Lady Russell]101-lady russell , as soon as [they]610-the children were reseated in [the carriage]683-the carriage , " not to call at [Uppercross]4-uppercross in the Christmas holidays . "[101-lady russell]

[Everybody]651-everybody has [their]651-everybody taste in noises as well as in other matters ; and sounds are quite innoxious , or most distressing , by [their]651-everybody sort rather than [their]651-everybody quantity . When [Lady Russell]101-lady russell not long afterwards , was entering [Bath]10-bath on a wet afternoon , and driving through the long course of [streets]1499-streets from [the Old Bridge]1500-the old bridge to [Camden Place]60-camden place , amidst the dash of [other carriages]1501-other carriages , the heavy rumble of carts and drays , the bawling of [newspapermen]1502-newspapermen , [muffin - men]1503-muffin - men and [milkmen]1504-milkmen , and the ceaseless clink of pattens , [she]101-lady russell made no complaint . No , these were noises which belonged to the winter pleasures ; [her]101-lady russell spirits rose under [their]610-the children influence ; and like [Mrs Musgrove]120-mrs musgrove , [she]101-lady russell was feeling , though not saying , that after being long in [the country]287-the country , nothing could be so good for [her]101-lady russell as a little quiet cheerfulness .

[Anne]93-anne did not share these feelings . [She]93-anne persisted in a very determined , though very silent disinclination for [Bath]10-bath ; caught the first dim view of [the extensive buildings]1506-the extensive buildings , smoking in rain , without any wish of seeing [them]1506-the extensive buildings better ; felt [their]1506-the extensive buildings progress through [the streets]1507-the streets to be , however disagreeable , yet too rapid ; for who would be glad to see [her]93-anne when [she]93-anne arrived ? And looked back , with fond regret , to the bustles of [Uppercross]4-uppercross and the seclusion of [Kellynch]6-kellynch .

[Elizabeth]91-elizabeth 's last letter had communicated a piece of news of some interest . [Mr Elliot]102-mr elliot was in [Bath]10-bath . [He]102-mr elliot had called in [Camden Place]60-camden place ; had called a second time , a third ; had been pointedly attentive . If [Elizabeth]91-elizabeth and [[her]91-elizabeth father]274-her father did not deceive [themselves]1509-themselves , had been taking much pains to seek the acquaintance , and proclaim the value of the connection , as [he]102-mr elliot had formerly taken pains to shew neglect . This was very wonderful if it were true ; and [Lady Russell]101-lady russell was in a state of very agreeable curiosity and perplexity about [Mr Elliot]102-mr elliot , already recanting the sentiment [she]101-lady russell had so lately expressed to [Mary]94-mary , of [his]102-mr elliot being " [a man whom [she]101-lady russell had no wish to see]2836-a man whom she had no wish to see . "[93-anne] [She]93-anne had a great wish to see [him]102-mr elliot . If [he]102-mr elliot really sought to reconcile [himself]102-mr elliot like a dutiful branch , [he]102-mr elliot must be forgiven for having dismembered [himself]102-mr elliot from the paternal tree .

[Anne]93-anne was not animated to an equal pitch by the circumstance , but [she]93-anne felt that [she]93-anne would rather see [Mr Elliot]102-mr elliot again than not , which was more than [she]93-anne could say for [many other persons in [Bath]10-bath]1510-many other persons in bath .

[She]93-anne was put down in [Camden Place]60-camden place ; and [Lady Russell]101-lady russell then drove to [[her]101-lady russell own lodgings]1511-her own lodgings , in [Rivers Street]62-rivers street .

Chapter 15

[Sir Walter]90-sir walter had taken [a very good house in [Camden Place]60-camden place]1512-a very good house in camden place , a lofty dignified situation , such as becomes [a man of consequence]1513-a man of consequence ; and both [he]90-sir walter and [Elizabeth]91-elizabeth were settled [there]377-there , much to [their]1515-their satisfaction .

[Anne]93-anne entered [it]377-there with a sinking heart , anticipating an imprisonment of many months , and anxiously saying to [herself]93-anne , " Oh ! when shall [I]93-anne leave [you]90-sir walter again ? "[93-anne] A degree of unexpected cordiality , however , in the welcome [she]93-anne received , did [her]93-anne good . [[Her]93-anne father]274-her father and [sister]268-sister were glad to see [her]93-anne , for the sake of shewing [her]93-anne [the house]310-the house and furniture , and met [her]93-anne with kindness . [Her]93-anne making a fourth , when [they]1519-they sat down to dinner , was noticed as an advantage .

[Mrs Clay]105-mrs clay was very pleasant , and very smiling , but [her]105-mrs clay courtesies and smiles were more a matter of course . [Anne]93-anne had always felt that [she]93-anne would pretend what was proper on [her]93-anne arrival , but the complaisance of [the others]359-the others was unlooked for . [They]1519-they were evidently in excellent spirits , and [she]93-anne was soon to listen to the causes . [They]1519-they had no inclination to listen to [her]93-anne . After laying out for some compliments of being deeply regretted in [[their]1519-they old neighbourhood]1521-their old neighbourhood , which [Anne]93-anne could not pay , [they]1519-they had only a few faint enquiries to make , before the talk must be all [their]1519-they own . [Uppercross]144-uppercross excited no interest , [Kellynch]6-kellynch very little : it was all [Bath]10-bath .

[They]1519-they had the pleasure of assuring [her]93-anne that [Bath]10-bath more than answered [their]1519-they expectations in every respect . [[Their]1519-they house]1306-their house was undoubtedly the best in [Camden Place]60-camden place ; [[their]1519-they drawing - rooms]1523-their drawing - rooms had many decided advantages over all the others which [they]1519-they had either seen or heard of , and the superiority was not less in the style of the fitting - up , or the taste of the furniture . [Their]1519-they acquaintance was exceedingly sought after . [Everybody]651-everybody was wanting to visit [them]1519-they . [They]1519-they had drawn back from many introductions , and still were perpetually having cards left by [people of whom [they]1519-they knew nothing]1525-people of whom they knew nothing .

Here were funds of enjoyment . Could [Anne]93-anne wonder that [[her]93-anne father]274-her father and [sister]268-sister were happy ? [She]93-anne might not wonder , but [she]93-anne must sigh that [[her]93-anne father]274-her father should feel no degradation in [his]274-her father change , should see nothing to regret in the duties and dignity of [the resident landholder]1529-the resident landholder , should find so much to be vain of in [the littlenesses of [a town]1531-a town]1530-the littlenesses of a town ; and [she]93-anne must sigh , and smile , and wonder too , as [Elizabeth]91-elizabeth threw open the folding - doors and walked with exultation from [one drawing - room]1532-one drawing - room to the other , boasting of [[their]1519-they space]1533-their space ; at the possibility of [that woman , who had been mistress of [Kellynch Hall]1-kellynch hall]1534-that woman , who had been mistress of kellynch hall , finding extent to be proud of between two walls , perhaps thirty feet asunder .

But this was not all which [they]1519-they had to make [them]1519-they happy . [They]1519-they had [Mr Elliot]102-mr elliot too . [Anne]93-anne had a great deal to hear of [Mr Elliot]102-mr elliot . [He]102-mr elliot was not only pardoned , [they]1519-they were delighted with [him]102-mr elliot . [He]102-mr elliot had been in [Bath]10-bath about a fortnight ; ( [he]102-mr elliot had passed through [Bath]10-bath in November , in [his]102-mr elliot way to [London]7-london , when the intelligence of [Sir Walter]90-sir walter 's being settled [there]377-there had of course reached [him]102-mr elliot , though only twenty - four hours in [the place]418-the place , but [he]102-mr elliot had not been able to avail [himself]102-mr elliot of it ;) but [he]102-mr elliot had now been a fortnight in [Bath]10-bath , and [his]102-mr elliot first object on arriving , had been to leave [his]102-mr elliot card in [Camden Place]60-camden place , following it up by such assiduous endeavours to meet , and when [they]1519-they did meet , by such great openness of conduct , such readiness to apologize for the past , such solicitude to be received as a relation again , that [their]1519-they former good understanding was completely re - established .

[They]1519-they had not a fault to find in [him]102-mr elliot . [He]102-mr elliot had explained away all the appearance of neglect on [his]102-mr elliot own side . It had originated in misapprehension entirely . [He]102-mr elliot had never had an idea of throwing [himself]102-mr elliot off ; [he]102-mr elliot had feared that [he]102-mr elliot was thrown off , but knew not why , and delicacy had kept [him]102-mr elliot silent . Upon the hint of having spoken disrespectfully or carelessly of [the family]312-the family and [the family honours]1538-the family honours , [he]102-mr elliot was quite indignant . [He]102-mr elliot , who had ever boasted of being [an Elliot , and whose feelings , as to connection , were only too strict to suit the unfeudal tone of the present day]1539-an elliot , and whose feelings , as to connection , were only too strict to suit the unfeudal tone of the present day . [He]102-mr elliot was astonished , indeed , but [his]102-mr elliot character and general conduct must refute it . [He]102-mr elliot could refer [Sir Walter]90-sir walter to [all who knew [him]102-mr elliot]1540-all who knew him ; and certainly , the pains [he]102-mr elliot had been taking on this , the first opportunity of reconciliation , to be restored to the footing of [a relation and heir - presumptive]1541-a relation and heir - presumptive , was a strong proof of [his]102-mr elliot opinions on the subject .

The circumstances of [his]102-mr elliot marriage , too , were found to admit of much extenuation . This was an article not to be entered on by [himself]102-mr elliot ; but [a very intimate friend of [his]102-mr elliot]1542-a very intimate friend of his , [a Colonel Wallis]172-colonel wallis , [a highly respectable man]1543-a highly respectable man , perfectly [the gentleman]2219-the gentleman , ( and not [an ill - looking man]1545-an ill - looking man , [Sir Walter]90-sir walter added ) , who was living in very good style in [Marlborough Buildings]63-marlborough buildings , and had , at [his]172-colonel wallis own particular request , been admitted to [their]1546-their acquaintance through [Mr Elliot]102-mr elliot , had mentioned one or two things relative to the marriage , which made a material difference in the discredit of it .

[Colonel Wallis]172-colonel wallis had known [Mr Elliot]102-mr elliot long , had been well acquainted also with [[his]172-colonel wallis wife]222-his wife , had perfectly understood the whole story . [She]222-his wife was certainly not [a woman of [family]1549-family , but well educated , accomplished , rich , and excessively in love with [[his]172-colonel wallis friend]1073-his friend]1548-a woman of family , but well educated , accomplished , rich , and excessively in love with his friend . There had been the charm . [She]222-his wife had sought [him]102-mr elliot . Without that attraction , not all [her]222-his wife money would have tempted [Elliot]102-mr elliot , and [Sir Walter]90-sir walter was , moreover , assured of [her]222-his wife having been [a very fine woman]1551-a very fine woman . Here was a great deal to soften the business . [A very fine woman with a large fortune , in love with [him]102-mr elliot]1552-a very fine woman with a large fortune , in love with him ! [Sir Walter]90-sir walter seemed to admit it as complete apology ; and though [Elizabeth]91-elizabeth could not see the circumstance in quite so favourable a light , [she]91-elizabeth allowed it be a great extenuation .

[Mr Elliot]102-mr elliot had called repeatedly , had dined with [them]1553-them once , evidently delighted by the distinction of being asked , for [they]1553-them gave no dinners in general ; delighted , in short , by every proof of cousinly notice , and placing [his]102-mr elliot whole happiness in being on intimate terms in [Camden Place]60-camden place .

[Anne]93-anne listened , but without quite understanding it . Allowances , large allowances , [she]93-anne knew , must be made for the ideas of [those who spoke]1554-those who spoke . [She]93-anne heard it all under embellishment . All that sounded extravagant or irrational in the progress of the reconciliation might have no origin but in the language of [the relators]1555-the relators . Still , however , [she]93-anne had the sensation of there being something more than immediately appeared , in [Mr Elliot]102-mr elliot 's wishing , after an interval of so many years , to be well received by [them]1553-them . In a worldly view , [he]102-mr elliot had nothing to gain by being on terms with [Sir Walter]90-sir walter ; nothing to risk by a state of variance . In all probability [he]102-mr elliot was already [the richer of [the two]1557-the two]1556-the richer of the two , and [the Kellynch estate]336-the kellynch estate would as surely be [his]102-mr elliot hereafter as the title . [A sensible man]503-a sensible man , and [he]102-mr elliot had looked like [a very sensible man]1560-a very sensible man , why should it be an object to [him]102-mr elliot ? [She]93-anne could only offer one solution ; it was , perhaps , for [Elizabeth]91-elizabeth 's sake . There might really have been a liking formerly , though convenience and accident had drawn [him]102-mr elliot a different way ; and now that [he]102-mr elliot could afford to please [himself]102-mr elliot , [he]102-mr elliot might mean to pay [his]102-mr elliot addresses to [her]91-elizabeth . [Elizabeth]91-elizabeth was certainly very handsome , with well - bred , elegant manners , and [her]91-elizabeth character might never have been penetrated by [Mr Elliot]102-mr elliot , knowing [her]91-elizabeth but in public , and when very young [himself]102-mr elliot . How [her]91-elizabeth temper and understanding might bear the investigation of [his]102-mr elliot present keener time of life was another concern and rather a fearful one . Most earnestly did [she]93-anne wish that [he]102-mr elliot might not be too nice , or too observant if [Elizabeth]91-elizabeth were [his]102-mr elliot object ; and that [Elizabeth]91-elizabeth was disposed to believe [herself]91-elizabeth so , and that [[her]91-elizabeth friend]546-her friend [Mrs Clay]105-mrs clay was encouraging the idea , seemed apparent by a glance or two between [them]1562-them , while [Mr Elliot]102-mr elliot 's frequent visits were talked of .

[Anne]93-anne mentioned the glimpses [she]93-anne had had of [him]102-mr elliot at [Lyme]48-lyme , but without being much attended to . " Oh ! yes , perhaps , it had been [Mr Elliot]102-mr elliot . [They]1563-they did not know . It might be [him]102-mr elliot , perhaps . "[1563-they] [They]1563-they could not listen to [her]93-anne description of [him]102-mr elliot . [They]1563-they were describing [him]102-mr elliot [themselves]1563-they ; [Sir Walter]90-sir walter especially . [He]102-mr elliot did justice to [his]102-mr elliot very gentlemanlike appearance , [his]102-mr elliot air of elegance and fashion , [his]102-mr elliot good shaped face , [his]102-mr elliot sensible eye ; but , at the same time , " must lament [his]102-mr elliot being very much under - hung , a defect which time seemed to have increased ; nor could [he]102-mr elliot pretend to say that ten years had not altered almost every feature for the worse . [Mr Elliot]102-mr elliot appeared to think that [he]90-sir walter ( [Sir Walter]90-sir walter ) was looking exactly as [he]90-sir walter had done when [they]2837-they last parted ; "[90-sir walter] but [Sir Walter]90-sir walter had " not been able to return the compliment entirely , which had embarrassed [him]102-mr elliot . [He]102-mr elliot did not mean to complain , however . [Mr Elliot]102-mr elliot was better to look at than [most men]2490-most men , and [he]102-mr elliot had no objection to being seen with [him]102-mr elliot anywhere . "[90-sir walter]

[Mr Elliot]102-mr elliot , and [[his]102-mr elliot friends in [Marlborough Buildings]63-marlborough buildings]1564-his friends in marlborough buildings , were talked of the whole evening . " [Colonel Wallis]172-colonel wallis had been so impatient to be introduced to [them]1565-them ! and [Mr Elliot]102-mr elliot so anxious that [he]102-mr elliot should ! "[173-mrs wallis] and there was [a Mrs Wallis]173-mrs wallis , at present known only to [them]1565-them by description , as [she]173-mrs wallis was in daily expectation of [her]173-mrs wallis confinement ; but [Mr Elliot]102-mr elliot spoke of [her]173-mrs wallis as " [a most charming woman]2839-a most charming woman , quite worthy of being known in [Camden Place]2840-camden place , "[102-mr elliot] and as soon as [she]173-mrs wallis recovered [they]1566-they were to be acquainted . [Sir Walter]90-sir walter thought much of [Mrs Wallis]173-mrs wallis ; [she]173-mrs wallis was said to be [an excessively pretty woman]1567-an excessively pretty woman , beautiful . " [He]102-mr elliot longed to see [her]173-mrs wallis . [He]102-mr elliot hoped [she]173-mrs wallis might make some amends for the many very plain faces [he]102-mr elliot was continually passing in [the streets]1507-the streets . The worst of [Bath]10-bath was the number of [its plain women]2842-its plain women . [He]102-mr elliot did not mean to say that there were [no pretty women]2843-no pretty women , but the number of the plain was out of all proportion . [He]102-mr elliot had frequently observed , as [he]102-mr elliot walked , that [one handsome face]2844-one handsome face would be followed by thirty , or five - and - thirty frights ; and once , as [he]102-mr elliot had stood in [a shop on [Bond Street]64-bond street]2845-a shop on bond street , [he]102-mr elliot had counted [eighty - seven women]2846-eighty - seven women go by , [one after another]2847-one after another , without there being a tolerable face among [them]2846-eighty - seven women . It had been a frosty morning , to be sure , a sharp frost , which [hardly one woman in a thousand]2848-hardly one woman in a thousand could stand the test of . But still , there certainly were a dreadful multitude of [ugly women in [Bath]10-bath]2849-ugly women in bath ; and as for [the men]2850-the men ! [they]2850-the men were infinitely worse . [Such scarecrows as [the streets]1507-the streets]2851-such scarecrows as the streets were full of ! It was evident how little [the women]2853-the women were used to the sight of anything tolerable , by the effect which [a man of decent appearance]2854-a man of decent appearance produced . [He]102-mr elliot had never walked anywhere arm - in - arm with [Colonel Wallis]172-colonel wallis ( who was a fine military figure , though sandy - haired ) without observing that [every woman]2855-every woman 's eye was upon [him]102-mr elliot ; [every woman]2855-every woman 's eye was sure to be upon [Colonel Wallis]172-colonel wallis . "[174-sir walter] [Modest Sir Walter]174-sir walter ! [He]174-sir walter was not allowed to escape , however . [[His]174-sir walter daughter]329-his daughter and [Mrs Clay]105-mrs clay united in hinting that [[Colonel Wallis]172-colonel wallis 's companion]1569-colonel wallis 's companion might have as good a figure as [Colonel Wallis]172-colonel wallis , and certainly was not sandy - haired .

" How is [Mary]94-mary looking ? "[174-sir walter] said [Sir Walter]174-sir walter , in the height of [his]174-sir walter good humour . " The last time [I]174-sir walter saw [her]94-mary [she]94-mary had a red nose , but [I]174-sir walter hope that may not happen every day . "[174-sir walter]

" Oh ! no , that must have been quite accidental . In general [she]94-mary has been in very good health and very good looks since [Michaelmas]127-michaelmas . "[174-sir walter]

" If [I]174-sir walter thought it would not tempt [her]94-mary to go out in sharp winds , and grow coarse , [I]174-sir walter would send [her]94-mary a new hat and pelisse . "[174-sir walter]

[Anne]93-anne was considering whether [she]93-anne should venture to suggest that a gown , or a cap , would not be liable to any such misuse , when a knock at the door suspended everything . " A knock at the door ! and so late ! It was ten o'clock . Could it be [Mr Elliot]102-mr elliot ? [They]2857-they knew [he]102-mr elliot was to dine in [Lansdown Crescent]65-lansdown crescent . It was possible that [he]102-mr elliot might stop in [his]102-mr elliot way [home]285-home to ask [them]2857-they how [they]2857-they did . [They]2857-they could think of [no one else]2859-no one else . [Mrs Clay]105-mrs clay decidedly thought it [Mr Elliot]102-mr elliot 's knock . "[105-mrs clay] [Mrs Clay]105-mrs clay was right . With all the state which [a butler and foot - boy]1570-a butler and foot - boy could give , [Mr Elliot]102-mr elliot was ushered into [the room]406-the room .

It was the same , [the very same man , with no difference but of dress]1572-the very same man , with no difference but of dress . [Anne]93-anne drew a little back , while [the others]359-the others received [his]102-mr elliot compliments , and [[her]93-anne sister]476-her sister [his]102-mr elliot apologies for calling at so unusual an hour , but " [he]102-mr elliot could not be so near without wishing to know that neither [she]93-anne nor [[her]93-anne friend]546-her friend had taken cold the day before , "[476-her sister] & c. & c ; which was all as politely done , and as politely taken , as possible , but [her]93-anne part must follow then . [Sir Walter]174-sir walter talked of [[his]174-sir walter youngest daughter]1575-his youngest daughter ; " [Mr Elliot]102-mr elliot must give [him]102-mr elliot leave to present [him]102-mr elliot to [[his]174-sir walter youngest daughter]1575-his youngest daughter "[174-sir walter] ( there was no occasion for remembering [Mary]94-mary ) ; and [Anne]93-anne , smiling and blushing , very becomingly [shewed]1576-shewed to [Mr Elliot]102-mr elliot the pretty features which [he]102-mr elliot had by no means forgotten , and instantly saw , with amusement at [his]102-mr elliot little start of surprise , that [he]102-mr elliot had not been at all aware of who [she]93-anne was . [He]102-mr elliot looked completely astonished , but not more astonished than pleased ; [his]102-mr elliot eyes brightened ! and with the most perfect alacrity [he]102-mr elliot welcomed the relationship , alluded to the past , and entreated to be received as [an acquaintance]1577-an acquaintance already . [He]102-mr elliot was quite as good - looking as [he]102-mr elliot had appeared at [Lyme]48-lyme , [his]102-mr elliot countenance improved by speaking , and [his]102-mr elliot manners were so exactly what they ought to be , so polished , so easy , so particularly agreeable , that [she]93-anne could compare [them]1578-them in excellence to only [one person]1579-one person 's manners . They were not the same , but [they]1578-them were , perhaps , equally good .

[He]102-mr elliot sat down with [them]1578-them , and improved [their]1578-them conversation very much . There could be no doubt of [his]102-mr elliot being [a sensible man]503-a sensible man . Ten minutes were enough to certify that . [His]102-mr elliot tone , [his]102-mr elliot expressions , [his]102-mr elliot choice of subject , [his]102-mr elliot knowing where to stop ; it was all the operation of [a sensible , discerning mind]1581-a sensible , discerning mind . As soon as [he]102-mr elliot could , [he]102-mr elliot began to talk to [her]93-anne of [Lyme]48-lyme , wanting to compare opinions respecting [the place]418-the place , but especially wanting to speak of the circumstance of [their]1578-them happening to be [guests]1583-guests in [the same inn]1234-the same inn at the same time ; to give [his]102-mr elliot own route , understand something of [hers]93-anne , and regret that [he]102-mr elliot should have lost such an opportunity of paying [his]102-mr elliot respects to [her]93-anne . [She]93-anne gave [him]102-mr elliot a short account of [her]93-anne party and business at [Lyme]48-lyme . [His]102-mr elliot regret increased as [he]102-mr elliot listened . [He]102-mr elliot had spent [his]102-mr elliot whole solitary evening in [the room adjoining [theirs]1578-them]1585-the room adjoining theirs ; had heard voices , mirth continually ; thought [they]1578-them must be [a most delightful set of people]1586-a most delightful set of people , longed to be with [them]1578-them , but certainly without the smallest suspicion of [his]102-mr elliot possessing the shadow of a right to introduce [himself]102-mr elliot . If [he]102-mr elliot had but asked who [the party were]1587-the party were ! The name of [Musgrove]144-uppercross would have told [him]102-mr elliot enough . " Well , it would serve to cure [him]102-mr elliot of an absurd practice of never asking a question at [an inn]2862-an inn , which [he]102-mr elliot had adopted , when quite [a young man]468-a young man , on the principal of its being very ungenteel to be curious . "[144-uppercross]

" The notions of [a young man of one or two and twenty]2864-a young man of one or two and twenty , "[102-mr elliot] said [he]102-mr elliot , " as to what is necessary in manners to make [him]102-mr elliot quite the thing , are more absurd , [I]102-mr elliot believe , than those of [any other set of beings in [the world]237-the world]2865-any other set of beings in the world . The folly of the means [they]2867-they often employ is only to be equalled by the folly of what [they]2867-they have in view . "[102-mr elliot]

But [he]102-mr elliot must not be addressing [his]102-mr elliot reflections to [Anne]93-anne alone : [he]102-mr elliot knew it ; [he]102-mr elliot was soon diffused again among [the others]359-the others , and it was only at intervals that [he]102-mr elliot could return to [Lyme]48-lyme .

[His]102-mr elliot enquiries , however , produced at length an account of the scene [she]93-anne had been engaged in [there]377-there , soon after [his]102-mr elliot leaving [the place]418-the place . Having alluded to " an accident , "[102-mr elliot] [he]102-mr elliot must hear the whole . When [he]102-mr elliot questioned , [Sir Walter]174-sir walter and [Elizabeth]91-elizabeth began to question also , but the difference in [their]1591-them manner of doing it could not be unfelt . [She]93-anne could only compare [Mr Elliot]102-mr elliot to [Lady Russell]101-lady russell , in the wish of really comprehending what had passed , and in the degree of concern for what [she]93-anne must have suffered in witnessing it .

[He]102-mr elliot staid an hour with [them]1591-them . The elegant little clock on the mantel - piece had struck " eleven with its silver sounds , "[1592-the watchman] and [the watchman]1592-the watchman was beginning to be heard at a distance telling the same tale , before [Mr Elliot]102-mr elliot or [any of [them]1591-them]1593-any of them seemed to feel that [he]102-mr elliot had been [there]377-there long .

[Anne]93-anne could not have supposed it possible that [her]93-anne first evening in [Camden Place]60-camden place could have passed so well !

Chapter 16

There was one point which [Anne]93-anne , on returning to [[her]93-anne family]2573-her family , would have been more thankful to ascertain even than [Mr Elliot]102-mr elliot 's being in love with [Elizabeth]91-elizabeth , which was , [[her]93-anne father]274-her father 's not being in love with [Mrs Clay]105-mrs clay ; and [she]93-anne was very far from easy about it , when [she]93-anne had been at [home]285-home a few hours . On going down to breakfast the next morning , [she]93-anne found there had just been a decent pretence on [the lady]1007-the lady 's side of meaning to leave [them]1591-them .
