[Miss Carteret]177-miss carteret was with [[her]177-miss carteret mother]263-her mother ; consequently it was not reasonable to expect accommodation for [all the three Camden Place ladies]1798-all the three camden place ladies . There could be no doubt as to [Miss Elliot]93-anne . Whoever suffered inconvenience , [she]1799-she must suffer none , but it occupied a little time to settle the point of civility between [the other two]1337-the other two . The rain was a mere trifle , and [Anne]93-anne was most sincere in preferring a walk with [Mr Elliot]102-mr elliot . But the rain was also a mere trifle to [Mrs Clay]105-mrs clay ; [she]105-mrs clay would hardly allow it even to drop at all , and [her]105-mrs clay boots were so thick ! much thicker than [Miss Anne]93-anne 's ; and , in short , [her]105-mrs clay civility rendered [her]105-mrs clay quite as anxious to be left to walk with [Mr Elliot]102-mr elliot as [Anne]93-anne could be , and it was discussed between [them]1337-the other two with a generosity so polite and so determined , that [the others]359-the others were obliged to settle it for [them]1337-the other two ; [Miss Elliot]93-anne maintaining that [Mrs Clay]105-mrs clay had a little cold already , and [Mr Elliot]102-mr elliot deciding on appeal , that [[his]102-mr elliot cousin]914-his cousin [Anne]93-anne 's boots were rather the thickest .

It was fixed accordingly , that [Mrs Clay]105-mrs clay should be of [the party in [the carriage]683-the carriage]1803-the party in the carriage ; and [they]1337-the other two had just reached this point , when [Anne]93-anne , as [she]93-anne sat near the window , descried , most decidedly and distinctly , [Captain Wentworth]117-captain wentworth walking down [the street]1268-the street .

[Her]93-anne start was perceptible only to [herself]93-anne ; but [she]93-anne instantly felt that [she]93-anne was [the greatest simpleton in [the world]237-the world]1806-the greatest simpleton in the world , the most unaccountable and absurd ! For a few minutes [she]93-anne saw nothing before [her]93-anne ; it was all confusion . [She]93-anne was lost , and when [she]93-anne had scolded back [her]93-anne senses , [she]93-anne found [the others]359-the others still waiting for [the carriage]683-the carriage , and [Mr Elliot]102-mr elliot ( always obliging ) just setting off for [Union Street]79-union street on a commission of [Mrs Clay]105-mrs clay 's .

[She]93-anne now felt a great inclination to go to the outer door ; [she]93-anne wanted to see if it rained . Why was [she]93-anne to suspect [herself]93-anne of another motive ? [Captain Wentworth]117-captain wentworth must be out of sight . [She]93-anne left [her]93-anne seat , [she]93-anne would go ; one half of [her]93-anne should not be always so much wiser than the other half , or always suspecting the other of being worse than it was . [She]93-anne would see if it rained . [She]93-anne was sent back , however , in a moment by the entrance of [Captain Wentworth]117-captain wentworth [himself]117-captain wentworth , among [a party of [gentlemen]1811-gentlemen and [ladies]3043-ladies]1810-a party of gentlemen and ladies , evidently [his]117-captain wentworth acquaintance , and whom [he]117-captain wentworth must have joined a little below [Milsom Street]76-milsom street . [He]117-captain wentworth was more obviously struck and confused by the sight of [her]93-anne than [she]93-anne had ever observed before ; [he]117-captain wentworth looked quite red . For the first time , since [their]1813-they renewed acquaintance , [she]93-anne felt that [she]93-anne was betraying the least sensibility of [the two]1557-the two . [She]93-anne had the advantage of [him]117-captain wentworth in the preparation of the last few moments . All the overpowering , blinding , bewildering , first effects of strong surprise were over with [her]93-anne . Still , however , [she]93-anne had enough to feel ! It was agitation , pain , pleasure , a something between delight and misery .

[He]117-captain wentworth spoke to [her]93-anne , and then turned away . The character of [his]117-captain wentworth manner was embarrassment . [She]93-anne could not have called it either cold or friendly , or anything so certainly as embarrassed .

After a short interval , however , [he]117-captain wentworth came towards [her]93-anne , and spoke again . Mutual enquiries on [common subjects]1815-common subjects passed : neither of [them]1813-they , probably , much the wiser for what [they]1813-they heard , and [Anne]93-anne continuing fully sensible of [his]117-captain wentworth being less at ease than formerly . [They]1813-they had by dint of being so very much together , got to speak to [each other]489-each other with a considerable portion of apparent indifference and calmness ; but [he]117-captain wentworth could not do it now . Time had changed [him]117-captain wentworth , or [Louisa]124-louisa had changed [him]117-captain wentworth . There was consciousness of some sort or other . [He]117-captain wentworth looked very well , not as if [he]117-captain wentworth had been suffering in health or spirits , and [he]117-captain wentworth talked of [Uppercross]144-uppercross , of [the Musgroves]121-the miss musgroves , nay , even of [Louisa]124-louisa , and had even a momentary look of [his]117-captain wentworth own arch significance as [he]117-captain wentworth named [her]124-louisa ; but yet it was [Captain Wentworth]117-captain wentworth not comfortable , not easy , not able to feign that [he]117-captain wentworth was .

It did not surprise , but it grieved [Anne]93-anne to observe that [Elizabeth]91-elizabeth would not know [him]117-captain wentworth . [She]93-anne saw that [he]117-captain wentworth saw [Elizabeth]91-elizabeth , that [Elizabeth]91-elizabeth saw [him]117-captain wentworth , that there was complete internal recognition on each side ; [she]93-anne was convinced that [he]117-captain wentworth was ready to be acknowledged as [an acquaintance]1577-an acquaintance , expecting it , and [she]93-anne had the pain of seeing [[her]93-anne sister]476-her sister turn away with unalterable coldness .

[[Lady Dalrymple]180-lady dalrymple 's carriage]1819-lady dalrymple 's carriage , for which [Miss Elliot]93-anne was growing very impatient , now drew up ; [the servant]2730-the servant came in to announce it . It was beginning to rain again , and altogether there was a delay , and a bustle , and a talking , which must make [all the little crowd]1821-all the little crowd in [the shop]1822-the shop understand that [Lady Dalrymple]180-lady dalrymple was calling to convey [Miss Elliot]93-anne . At last [Miss Elliot]93-anne and [[her]93-anne friend]546-her friend , unattended but by [the servant]2730-the servant , ( for there was [no cousin returned )]1825-no cousin returned ) , were walking off ; and [Captain Wentworth]117-captain wentworth , watching [them]1826-them , turned again to [Anne]93-anne , and by manner , rather than words , was offering [his]117-captain wentworth services to [her]93-anne .

" [I]93-anne am much obliged to [you]117-captain wentworth , "[93-anne] was [her]93-anne answer , " but [I]93-anne am not going with [them]1826-them . [The carriage]683-the carriage would not accommodate so many . [I]93-anne walk : [I]93-anne prefer walking . "[93-anne]

" But it rains . "[117-captain wentworth]

" Oh ! very little , Nothing that [I]93-anne regard . "[93-anne]

After a moment 's pause [he]117-captain wentworth said : " Though [I]117-captain wentworth came only yesterday , [I]117-captain wentworth have equipped [myself]117-captain wentworth properly for Bath already , [you]117-captain wentworth see , "[117-captain wentworth] ( pointing to a new umbrella ) ; " [I]117-captain wentworth wish [you]117-captain wentworth would make use of it , if [you]117-captain wentworth are determined to walk ; though [I]117-captain wentworth think it would be more prudent to let [me]117-captain wentworth get [you]117-captain wentworth a chair . "[117-captain wentworth]

[She]93-anne was very much obliged to [him]117-captain wentworth , but declined it all , repeating [her]93-anne conviction , that the rain would come to nothing at present , and adding , " [I]93-anne am only waiting for [Mr Elliot]102-mr elliot . [He]102-mr elliot will be [here]2340-here in a moment , [I]93-anne am sure . "[93-anne]

[She]93-anne had hardly spoken the words when [Mr Elliot]102-mr elliot walked in . [Captain Wentworth]117-captain wentworth recollected [him]102-mr elliot perfectly . There was no difference between [him]102-mr elliot and [the man who had stood on the steps at [Lyme]48-lyme]1827-the man who had stood on the steps at lyme , admiring [Anne]93-anne as [she]93-anne passed , except in the air and look and manner of [the privileged relation]1828-the privileged relation and [friend]270-friend . [He]117-captain wentworth came in with eagerness , appeared to see and think only of [her]93-anne , apologised for [his]117-captain wentworth stay , was grieved to have kept [her]93-anne waiting , and anxious to get [her]93-anne away without further loss of time and before the rain increased ; and in another moment [they]1830-they walked off together , [her]93-anne arm under [his]117-captain wentworth , a gentle and embarrassed glance , and a " Good morning to [you]117-captain wentworth ! "[93-anne] being all that [she]93-anne had time for , as [she]93-anne passed away .

As soon as [they]1830-they were out of sight , [the ladies of [Captain Wentworth]117-captain wentworth 's party]1831-the ladies of captain wentworth 's party began talking of [them]1830-they .

" [Mr Elliot]102-mr elliot does not dislike [[his]102-mr elliot cousin]914-his cousin , [I]93-anne fancy ? "[93-anne]

" Oh ! no , that is clear enough . [One]252-one can guess what will happen there . [He]102-mr elliot is always with [them]1830-they ; half lives in [the family]312-the family , [I]93-anne believe . What [a very good - looking man]3066-a very good - looking man ! "[93-anne]

" Yes , and [Miss Atkinson]195-miss atkinson , who dined with [him]102-mr elliot once at [the Wallises]80-the wallises , says [he]102-mr elliot is [the most agreeable man [she]195-miss atkinson ever was in company with]3067-the most agreeable man she ever was in company with . "[93-anne]

" [She]914-his cousin is pretty , [I]93-anne think ; [Anne Elliot]93-anne ; very pretty , when one comes to look at [her]914-his cousin . It is not the fashion to say so , but [I]93-anne confess [I]93-anne admire [her]914-his cousin more than [[her]914-his cousin sister]476-her sister . "[93-anne]

" Oh ! so do [I.]93-anne "[93-anne]

" And so do [I.]93-anne No comparison . But [the men]2850-the men are all wild after [Miss Elliot]93-anne . [Anne]93-anne is too delicate for [them]2850-the men . "[93-anne]

[Anne]93-anne would have been particularly obliged to [[her]93-anne cousin]2558-her cousin , if [he]2558-her cousin would have walked by [her]93-anne side all the way to [Camden Place]60-camden place , without saying a word . [She]93-anne had never found it so difficult to listen to [him]2558-her cousin , though nothing could exceed [his]2558-her cousin solicitude and care , and though [[his]2558-her cousin subjects]1833-his subjects were principally such as were wo nt to be always interesting : praise , warm , just , and discriminating , of [Lady Russell]101-lady russell , and insinuations highly rational against [Mrs Clay]105-mrs clay . But just now [she]93-anne could think only of [Captain Wentworth]117-captain wentworth . [She]93-anne could not understand [his]117-captain wentworth present feelings , whether [he]117-captain wentworth were really suffering much from disappointment or not ; and till that point were settled , [she]93-anne could not be quite [herself]93-anne .

[She]93-anne hoped to be wise and reasonable in time ; but alas ! alas ! [she]93-anne must confess to [herself]93-anne that [she]93-anne was not wise yet .

Another circumstance very essential for [her]93-anne to know , was how long [he]117-captain wentworth meant to be in [Bath]10-bath ; [he]117-captain wentworth had not mentioned it , or [she]93-anne could not recollect it . [He]117-captain wentworth might be only passing through . But it was more probable that [he]117-captain wentworth should be come to stay . In that case , so liable as every body was to meet every body in [Bath]10-bath , [Lady Russell]101-lady russell would in all likelihood see [him]117-captain wentworth somewhere . Would [she]93-anne recollect [him]117-captain wentworth ? How would it all be ?

[She]93-anne had already been obliged to tell [Lady Russell]101-lady russell that [Louisa Musgrove]124-louisa was to marry [Captain Benwick]155-captain benwick . It had cost [her]93-anne something to encounter [Lady Russell]101-lady russell 's surprise ; and now , if [she]93-anne were by any chance to be thrown into company with [Captain Wentworth]117-captain wentworth , [her]93-anne imperfect knowledge of the matter might add another shade of prejudice against [him]117-captain wentworth .

The following morning [Anne]93-anne was out with [[her]93-anne friend]546-her friend , and for the first hour , in an incessant and fearful sort of watch for [him]117-captain wentworth in vain ; but at last , in returning down [Pulteney Street]81-pulteney street , [she]93-anne distinguished [him]117-captain wentworth on the right hand pavement at such a distance as to have [him]117-captain wentworth in view the greater part of [the street]1268-the street . There were [many other men about [him]117-captain wentworth]1836-many other men about him , [many groups walking the same way]1837-many groups walking the same way , but there was no mistaking [him]117-captain wentworth . [She]93-anne looked instinctively at [Lady Russell]101-lady russell ; but not from any mad idea of [her]93-anne recognising [him]117-captain wentworth so soon as [she]93-anne did [herself]93-anne . No , it was not to be supposed that [Lady Russell]101-lady russell would perceive [him]117-captain wentworth till [they]1838-they were nearly opposite . [She]93-anne looked at [her]93-anne however , from time to time , anxiously ; and when the moment approached which must point [him]117-captain wentworth out , though not daring to look again ( for [her]93-anne own countenance [she]93-anne knew was unfit to be seen ) , [she]93-anne was yet perfectly conscious of [Lady Russell]101-lady russell 's eyes being turned exactly in the direction for [him]117-captain wentworth -- of [her]93-anne being , in short , intently observing [him]117-captain wentworth . [She]93-anne could thoroughly comprehend the sort of fascination [he]117-captain wentworth must possess over [Lady Russell]101-lady russell 's mind , the difficulty it must be for [her]93-anne to withdraw [her]93-anne eyes , the astonishment [she]93-anne must be feeling that eight or nine years should have passed over [him]117-captain wentworth , and in foreign climes and in active service too , without robbing [him]117-captain wentworth of one personal grace !

At last , [Lady Russell]101-lady russell drew back [her]101-lady russell head . " Now , how would [she]101-lady russell speak of [him]117-captain wentworth ? "[101-lady russell]

" [You]3070-you will wonder , "[93-anne] said [she]93-anne , " what has been fixing [my]93-anne eye so long ; but [I]93-anne was looking after some window - curtains , which [Lady Alicia]196-lady alicia and [Mrs Frankland]197-mrs frankland were telling [me]93-anne of last night . [They]3071-they described the drawing - room window - curtains of [one of [the houses]3073-the houses on this side of the way]3072-one of the houses on this side of the way , and [this part of [the street]1268-the street]3074-this part of the street , as being the handsomest and best hung of any in [Bath]10-bath , but could not recollect the exact number , and [I]93-anne have been trying to find out which it could be ; but [I]93-anne confess [I]93-anne can see no curtains hereabouts that answer [their]3071-they description . "[93-anne]

[Anne]93-anne sighed and blushed and smiled , in pity and disdain , either at [[her]93-anne friend]546-her friend or [herself]93-anne . The part which provoked [her]93-anne most , was that in all this waste of foresight and caution , [she]93-anne should have lost the right moment for seeing whether [he]546-her friend saw [them]1840-them .

A day or two passed without producing anything . [The theatre]1841-the theatre or [the rooms]1098-the rooms , where [he]546-her friend was most likely to be , were not fashionable enough for [the Elliots , whose evening amusements were solely in the elegant stupidity of private parties]1843-the elliots , whose evening amusements were solely in the elegant stupidity of private parties , in which [they]1843-the elliots , whose evening amusements were solely in the elegant stupidity of private parties were getting more and more engaged ; and [Anne]93-anne , wearied of such a state of stagnation , sick of knowing nothing , and fancying [herself]93-anne stronger because [her]93-anne strength was not tried , was quite impatient for the concert evening . It was a concert for the benefit of [a person patronised by [Lady Dalrymple]180-lady dalrymple]1844-a person patronised by lady dalrymple . Of course [they]1845-they must attend . It was really expected to be a good one , and [Captain Wentworth]117-captain wentworth was very fond of music . If [she]93-anne could only have a few minutes conversation with [him]546-her friend again , [she]93-anne fancied [she]93-anne should be satisfied ; and as to the power of addressing [him]546-her friend , [she]93-anne felt all over courage if the opportunity occurred . [Elizabeth]91-elizabeth had turned from [him]546-her friend , [Lady Russell]101-lady russell overlooked [him]546-her friend ; [her]101-lady russell nerves were strengthened by these circumstances ; [she]101-lady russell felt that [she]101-lady russell owed [him]546-her friend attention .

[She]101-lady russell had once partly promised [Mrs Smith]182-mrs smith to spend the evening with [her]101-lady russell ; but in a short hurried call [she]101-lady russell excused [herself]101-lady russell and put it off , with the more decided promise of a longer visit on the morrow . [Mrs Smith]182-mrs smith gave a most good - humoured acquiescence .

" By all means , "[182-mrs smith] said [she]182-mrs smith ; " only tell [me]182-mrs smith all about it , when [you]182-mrs smith do come . Who is [[your]182-mrs smith party]3076-your party ? "[182-mrs smith]

[Anne]93-anne named [them]1846-their all . [Mrs Smith]182-mrs smith made no reply ; but when [she]182-mrs smith was leaving [her]182-mrs smith said , and with an expression half serious , half arch , " Well , [I]182-mrs smith heartily wish [your]182-mrs smith concert may answer ; and do not fail [me]182-mrs smith to - morrow if [you]182-mrs smith can come ; for [I]182-mrs smith begin to have a foreboding that [I]182-mrs smith may not have many more visits from [you]182-mrs smith . "[182-mrs smith]

[Anne]93-anne was startled and confused ; but after standing in a moment 's suspense , was obliged , and not sorry to be obliged , to hurry away .

Chapter 20

[Sir Walter]90-sir walter , [[his]90-sir walter two daughters]1847-his two daughters , and [Mrs Clay]105-mrs clay , were the earliest of all [their]1846-their party at [the rooms]1098-the rooms in the evening ; and as [Lady Dalrymple]180-lady dalrymple must be waited for , [they]1846-their took [their]1846-their station by one of the fires in [the Octagon Room]1849-the octagon room . But hardly were [they]1846-their so settled , when the door opened again , and [Captain Wentworth]117-captain wentworth walked in alone . [Anne]93-anne was the nearest to [him]117-captain wentworth , and making yet a little advance , [she]93-anne instantly spoke . [He]117-captain wentworth was preparing only to bow and pass on , but [her]93-anne gentle " How do [you]117-captain wentworth do ? "[93-anne] brought [him]117-captain wentworth out of the straight line to stand near [her]93-anne , and make enquiries in return , in spite of [the formidable father]1850-the formidable father and [sister in the back ground]1851-sister in the back ground . [Their]1846-their being in [the back ground]1852-the back ground was a support to [Anne]93-anne ; [she]93-anne knew nothing of [their]1846-their looks , and felt equal to everything which [she]93-anne believed right to be done .

While [they]1846-their were speaking , a whispering between [[her]93-anne father]274-her father and [Elizabeth]91-elizabeth caught [her]93-anne ear . [She]93-anne could not distinguish , but [she]93-anne must guess the subject ; and on [Captain Wentworth]117-captain wentworth 's making a distant bow , [she]93-anne comprehended that [[her]93-anne father]274-her father had judged so well as to give [him]117-captain wentworth that simple acknowledgement of acquaintance , and [she]93-anne was just in time by a side glance to see a slight curtsey from [Elizabeth]91-elizabeth [herself]91-elizabeth . This , though late , and reluctant , and ungracious , was yet better than nothing , and [her]93-anne spirits improved .

After talking , however , of the weather , and Bath , and the concert , [their]1846-their conversation began to flag , and so little was said at last , that [she]93-anne was expecting [him]117-captain wentworth to go every moment , but [he]117-captain wentworth did not ; [he]117-captain wentworth seemed in no hurry to leave [her]93-anne ; and presently with renewed spirit , with a little smile , a little glow , [he]117-captain wentworth said--

" [I]117-captain wentworth have hardly seen [you]93-anne since [our]1846-their day at [Lyme]48-lyme . [I]117-captain wentworth am afraid [you]93-anne must have suffered from the shock , and the more from its not overpowering [you]93-anne at the time . "[117-captain wentworth]

[She]93-anne assured [him]117-captain wentworth that [she]93-anne had not .

" It was a frightful hour , "[117-captain wentworth] said [he]117-captain wentworth , " a frightful day ! "[117-captain wentworth] and [he]117-captain wentworth passed [his]117-captain wentworth hand across [his]117-captain wentworth eyes , as if the remembrance were still too painful , but in a moment , half smiling again , added , " The day has produced some effects however ; has had some consequences which must be considered as the very reverse of frightful . When [you]93-anne had the presence of mind to suggest that [Benwick]155-captain benwick would be [the properest person to fetch [a surgeon]2750-a surgeon]3077-the properest person to fetch a surgeon , [you]93-anne could have little idea of [his]155-captain benwick being eventually [one of those most concerned in [her]2750-a surgeon recovery]3079-one of those most concerned in her recovery . "[117-captain wentworth]

" Certainly [I]93-anne could have none . But it appears -- [I]93-anne should hope it would be a very happy match . There are on both sides good principles and good temper . "[93-anne]

" Yes , "[117-captain wentworth] said [he]117-captain wentworth , looking not exactly forward ; " but there , [I]117-captain wentworth think , ends the resemblance . With all [my]117-captain wentworth soul [I]117-captain wentworth wish [them]3080-their happy , and rejoice over every circumstance in favour of it . [They]3080-their have no difficulties to contend with at [home]285-home , no opposition , no caprice , no delays . [The Musgroves]121-the miss musgroves are behaving like [themselves]121-the miss musgroves , most honourably and kindly , only anxious with true parental hearts to promote [[their]3080-their daughter]3082-their daughter 's comfort . All this is much , very much in favour of [their]3080-their happiness ; more than perhaps-- "[117-captain wentworth]

[He]117-captain wentworth stopped . A sudden recollection seemed to occur , and to give [him]117-captain wentworth some taste of that emotion which was reddening [Anne]93-anne 's cheeks and fixing [her]93-anne eyes on the ground . After clearing [his]117-captain wentworth throat , however , [he]117-captain wentworth proceeded thus--

" [I]117-captain wentworth confess that [I]117-captain wentworth do think there is a disparity , too great a disparity , and in a point no less essential than mind . [I]117-captain wentworth regard [Louisa Musgrove]124-louisa as [a very amiable , sweet - tempered girl]3083-a very amiable , sweet - tempered girl , and not deficient in understanding , but [Benwick]155-captain benwick is something more . [He]155-captain benwick is [a clever man]3084-a clever man , [a reading man]3085-a reading man ; and [I]117-captain wentworth confess , that [I]117-captain wentworth do consider [his]155-captain benwick attaching [himself]155-captain benwick to [her]124-louisa with some surprise . Had it been the effect of gratitude , had [he]155-captain benwick learnt to love [her]124-louisa , because [he]155-captain benwick believed [her]124-louisa to be preferring [him]155-captain benwick , it would have been another thing . But [I]117-captain wentworth have no reason to suppose it so . It seems , on the contrary , to have been a perfectly spontaneous , untaught feeling on [his]155-captain benwick side , and this surprises [me]117-captain wentworth . [A man like [him]155-captain benwick]3086-a man like him , in [his]155-captain benwick situation ! with a heart pierced , wounded , almost broken ! [Fanny Harville]157-fanny harville was [a very superior creature]3087-a very superior creature , and [his]155-captain benwick attachment to [her]124-louisa was indeed attachment . [A man]2277-a man does not recover from such a devotion of the heart to [such a woman]3089-such a woman . [He]2277-a man ought not ; [he]2277-a man does not . "[117-captain wentworth]

Either from the consciousness , however , that [[his]1855-his friend]1073-his friend had recovered , or from other consciousness , [he]1855-his went no farther ; and [Anne]93-anne who , in spite of the agitated voice in which the latter part had been uttered , and in spite of all the various noises of [the room]406-the room , the almost ceaseless slam of the door , and ceaseless buzz of [persons walking through]1858-persons walking through , had distinguished every word , was struck , gratified , confused , and beginning to breathe very quick , and feel an hundred things in a moment . It was impossible for [her]93-anne to enter on such a subject ; and yet , after a pause , feeling the necessity of speaking , and having not the smallest wish for a total change , [she]93-anne only deviated so far as to say--

" [You]155-captain benwick were a good while at [Lyme]48-lyme , [I]93-anne think ? "[93-anne]

" About a fortnight . [I]93-anne could not leave it till [Louisa]124-louisa 's doing well was quite ascertained . [I]93-anne had been too deeply concerned in the mischief to be soon at peace . It had been [my]93-anne doing , solely mine . [She]124-louisa would not have been obstinate if [I]93-anne had not been weak . [The country round [Lyme]48-lyme]3090-the country round lyme is very fine . [I]93-anne walked and rode a great deal ; and the more [I]93-anne saw , the more [I]93-anne found to admire . "[93-anne]

" [I]93-anne should very much like to see [Lyme]48-lyme again , "[93-anne] said [Anne]93-anne .

" Indeed ! [I]93-anne should not have supposed that [you]155-captain benwick could have found anything in [Lyme]48-lyme to inspire such a feeling . The horror and distress [you]155-captain benwick were involved in , the stretch of mind , the wear of spirits ! [I]93-anne should have thought [your]155-captain benwick last impressions of [Lyme]48-lyme must have been strong disgust . "[93-anne]

" The last hours were certainly very painful , "[93-anne] replied [Anne]93-anne ; " but when pain is over , the remembrance of it often becomes a pleasure . [One]252-one does not love a place the less for having suffered in it , unless it has been all suffering , nothing but suffering , which was by no means the case at [Lyme]48-lyme . [We]3092-we were only in anxiety and distress during the last two hours , and previously there had been a great deal of enjoyment . So much novelty and beauty ! [I]93-anne have travelled so little , that [every fresh place]3093-every fresh place would be interesting to [me]93-anne ; but there is real beauty at [Lyme]48-lyme ; and in short "[93-anne] ( with a faint blush at some recollections ) , " altogether [my]93-anne impressions of [the place]418-the place are very agreeable . "[93-anne]

As [she]93-anne ceased , the entrance door opened again , and [the very party]1859-the very party appeared for whom [they]1859-the very party were waiting . " [Lady Dalrymple]180-lady dalrymple , [Lady Dalrymple]180-lady dalrymple , "[93-anne] was the rejoicing sound ; and with all the eagerness compatible with anxious elegance , [Sir Walter]90-sir walter and [[his]90-sir walter two ladies]1860-his two ladies stepped forward to meet [her]93-anne . [Lady Dalrymple]180-lady dalrymple and [Miss Carteret]177-miss carteret , escorted by [Mr Elliot]102-mr elliot and [Colonel Wallis , who had happened to arrive nearly at the same instant]1861-colonel wallis , who had happened to arrive nearly at the same instant , advanced into [the room]406-the room . [The others]359-the others joined [them]1859-the very party , and it was a group in which [Anne]93-anne found [herself]93-anne also necessarily included . [She]93-anne was divided from [Captain Wentworth]117-captain wentworth . [Their]1864-their interesting , almost too interesting conversation must be broken up for a time , but slight was the penance compared with the happiness which brought it on ! [She]93-anne had learnt , in the last ten minutes , more of [his]117-captain wentworth feelings towards [Louisa]124-louisa , more of all [his]117-captain wentworth feelings than [she]93-anne dared to think of ; and [she]93-anne gave [herself]93-anne up to the demands of the party , to the needful civilities of the moment , with exquisite , though agitated sensations . [She]93-anne was in good humour with all . [She]93-anne had received ideas which disposed [her]93-anne to be courteous and kind to [all]1125-all , and to pity [every one]1866-every one , as being less happy than [herself]93-anne .

The delightful emotions were a little subdued , when on stepping back from [the group]1867-the group , to be joined again by [Captain Wentworth]117-captain wentworth , [she]93-anne saw that [he]117-captain wentworth was gone . [She]93-anne was just in time to see [him]117-captain wentworth turn into [the Concert Room]1868-the concert room . [He]117-captain wentworth was gone ; [he]117-captain wentworth had disappeared , [she]93-anne felt a moment 's regret . But " [they]3095-they should meet again . [He]117-captain wentworth would look for [her]93-anne , [he]117-captain wentworth would find [her]93-anne out before the evening were over , and at present , perhaps , it was as well to be asunder . [She]93-anne was in need of a little interval for recollection . "[117-captain wentworth]

Upon [Lady Russell]101-lady russell 's appearance soon afterwards , [the whole party]1869-the whole party was collected , and all that remained was to marshal [themselves]1869-the whole party , and proceed into [the Concert Room]1868-the concert room ; and be of all the consequence in [their]1869-the whole party power , draw as many eyes , excite as many whispers , and disturb as many people as [they]1869-the whole party could .

Very , very happy were both [Elizabeth]91-elizabeth and [Anne Elliot]93-anne as [they]1869-the whole party walked in . [Elizabeth]91-elizabeth arm in arm with [Miss Carteret]177-miss carteret , and looking on the broad back of [the dowager Viscountess Dalrymple before [her]91-elizabeth]176-the dowager viscountess dalrymple , had nothing to wish for which did not seem within [her]91-elizabeth reach ; and [Anne]93-anne -- but it would be an insult to the nature of [Anne]93-anne 's felicity , to draw any comparison between it and [[her]93-anne sister]476-her sister 's ; the origin of one all selfish vanity , of the other all generous attachment .

[Anne]93-anne saw nothing , thought nothing of the brilliancy of [the room]406-the room . [Her]93-anne happiness was from within . [Her]93-anne eyes were bright and [her]93-anne cheeks glowed ; but [she]93-anne knew nothing about it . [She]93-anne was thinking only of the last half hour , and as [they]1869-the whole party passed to [their]1869-the whole party seats , [her]93-anne mind took a hasty range over it . [His]1873-his choice of subjects , [his]1873-his expressions , and still more [his]1873-his manner and look , had been such as [she]93-anne could see in only one light . [His]1873-his opinion of [Louisa Musgrove]124-louisa 's inferiority , an opinion which [he]1873-his had seemed solicitous to give , [his]1873-his wonder at [Captain Benwick]155-captain benwick , [his]1873-his feelings as to a first , strong attachment ; sentences begun which [he]1873-his could not finish , [his]1873-his half averted eyes and more than half expressive glance , all , all declared that [he]1873-his had a heart returning to [her]93-anne at least ; that anger , resentment , avoidance , were no more ; and that [they]1869-the whole party were succeeded , not merely by friendship and regard , but by the tenderness of the past . Yes , some share of the tenderness of the past . [She]93-anne could not contemplate the change as implying less . [He]1873-his must love [her]93-anne .

These were thoughts , with [their]1869-the whole party attendant visions , which occupied and flurried [her]93-anne too much to leave [her]93-anne any power of observation ; and [she]93-anne passed along [the room]406-the room without having a glimpse of [him]1873-his , without even trying to discern [him]1873-his . When [their]1869-the whole party places were determined on , and they were all properly arranged , [she]93-anne looked round to see if [he]1873-his should happen to be in the same part of [the room]406-the room , but [he]1873-his was not ; [her]93-anne eye could not reach [him]1873-his ; and the concert being just opening , [she]93-anne must consent for a time to be happy in a humbler way .

[The party]542-the party was divided and disposed of on two contiguous benches : [Anne]93-anne was among those on the foremost , and [Mr Elliot]102-mr elliot had manoeuvred so well , with the assistance of [[his]102-mr elliot friend]1073-his friend [Colonel Wallis]172-colonel wallis , as to have a seat by [her]93-anne . [Miss Elliot]93-anne , surrounded by [[her]93-anne cousins]1878-her cousins , and the principal object of [Colonel Wallis]172-colonel wallis 's gallantry , was quite contented .

[Anne]93-anne 's mind was in a most favourable state for the entertainment of the evening ; it was just occupation enough : [she]93-anne had feelings for [the tender]1879-the tender , spirits for the gay , attention for the scientific , and patience for the wearisome ; and had never liked a concert better , at least during the first act . Towards the close of it , in the interval succeeding an Italian song , [she]93-anne explained the words of the song to [Mr Elliot]102-mr elliot . [They]1880-they had a concert bill between [them]1880-they .

" This , "[93-anne] said [she]93-anne , " is nearly the sense , or rather the meaning of the words , for certainly the sense of an Italian love - song must not be talked of , but it is as nearly the meaning as [I]93-anne can give ; for [I]93-anne do not pretend to understand the language . [I]93-anne am [a very poor Italian scholar]3096-a very poor italian scholar . "[93-anne]

" Yes , yes , [I]93-anne see [you]102-mr elliot are . [I]93-anne see [you]102-mr elliot know nothing of the matter . [You]102-mr elliot have only knowledge enough of the language to translate at sight these inverted , transposed , curtailed Italian lines , into clear , comprehensible , elegant English . [You]102-mr elliot need not say anything more of [your]102-mr elliot ignorance . Here is complete proof . "[93-anne]

" [I]93-anne will not oppose such kind politeness ; but [I]93-anne should be sorry to be examined by [a real proficient]3097-a real proficient . "[93-anne]

" [I]102-mr elliot have not had the pleasure of visiting in [Camden Place]60-camden place so long , "[102-mr elliot] replied [he]102-mr elliot , " without knowing something of [Miss Anne Elliot]93-anne ; and [I]102-mr elliot do regard [her]93-anne as one who is too modest for [the world]237-the world in general to be aware of half [her]93-anne accomplishments , and too highly accomplished for modesty to be natural in [any other woman]3099-any other woman . "[102-mr elliot]

" For shame ! for shame ! this is too much flattery . [I]93-anne forget what [we]3100-we are to have next , "[93-anne] turning to the bill .

" Perhaps , "[102-mr elliot] said [Mr Elliot]102-mr elliot , speaking low , " [I]102-mr elliot have had a longer acquaintance with [your]102-mr elliot character than [you]102-mr elliot are aware of . "[102-mr elliot]

" Indeed ! How so ? [You]102-mr elliot can have been acquainted with it only since [I]102-mr elliot came to [Bath]10-bath , excepting as [you]102-mr elliot might hear [me]102-mr elliot previously spoken of in [[my]102-mr elliot own family]3101-my own family . "[102-mr elliot]

" [I]102-mr elliot knew [you]102-mr elliot by report long before [you]102-mr elliot came to [Bath]10-bath . [I]102-mr elliot had heard [you]102-mr elliot described by [those who knew [you]102-mr elliot intimately]3102-those who knew you intimately . [I]102-mr elliot have been acquainted with [you]102-mr elliot by character many years . [Your]102-mr elliot person , [your]102-mr elliot disposition , accomplishments , manner ; they were all present to [me]102-mr elliot . "[102-mr elliot]

[Mr Elliot]102-mr elliot was not disappointed in the interest [he]102-mr elliot hoped to raise . [No one]479-no one can withstand the charm of such a mystery . To have been described long ago to a recent acquaintance , by [nameless people]1882-nameless people , is irresistible ; and [Anne]93-anne was all curiosity . [She]93-anne wondered , and questioned [him]102-mr elliot eagerly ; but in vain . [He]102-mr elliot delighted in being asked , but [he]102-mr elliot would not tell .

" No , no , some time or other , perhaps , but not now . [He]102-mr elliot would mention no names now ; but such , [he]102-mr elliot could assure [her]93-anne , had been the fact . [He]102-mr elliot had many years ago received such a description of [Miss Anne Elliot]93-anne as had inspired [him]102-mr elliot with the highest idea of [her]93-anne merit , and excited the warmest curiosity to know [her]93-anne . "[479-no one]

[Anne]93-anne could think of [no one]479-no one so likely to have spoken with partiality of [her]93-anne many years ago as [the Mr Wentworth of [Monkford]14-monkford]115-mr wentworth , [[Captain Wentworth]117-captain wentworth 's brother]1884-captain wentworth 's brother . [He]115-mr wentworth might have been in [[Mr Elliot]102-mr elliot 's company]1885-mr elliot 's company , but [she]93-anne had not courage to ask the question .

" The name of [Anne Elliot]93-anne , "[102-mr elliot] said [he]102-mr elliot , " has long had an interesting sound to [me]102-mr elliot . Very long has it possessed a charm over [my]102-mr elliot fancy ; and , if [I]102-mr elliot dared , [I]102-mr elliot would breathe [my]102-mr elliot wishes that the name might never change . "[102-mr elliot]

Such , [she]93-anne believed , were [his]102-mr elliot words ; but scarcely had [she]93-anne received their sound , than [her]93-anne attention was caught by other sounds immediately behind [her]93-anne , which rendered every thing else trivial . [[Her]93-anne father]274-her father and [Lady Dalrymple]180-lady dalrymple were speaking .

" [A well - looking man]3103-a well - looking man , "[90-sir walter] said [Sir Walter]90-sir walter , " [a very well - looking man]3104-a very well - looking man . "[90-sir walter]

" [A very fine young man]704-a very fine young man indeed ! "[180-lady dalrymple] said [Lady Dalrymple]180-lady dalrymple . " More air than one often sees in [Bath]10-bath . [Irish]3106-irish , [I]180-lady dalrymple dare say . "[180-lady dalrymple]

" No , [I]90-sir walter just know [his]102-mr elliot name . [A bowing acquaintance]3107-a bowing acquaintance . [Wentworth]117-captain wentworth ; [Captain Wentworth of [the navy]2245-the navy]3108-captain wentworth of the navy . [[His]117-captain wentworth sister]799-his sister married [[my]90-sir walter tenant in [Somersetshire]2-somersetshire]3111-my tenant in somersetshire , [the Croft]3112-the croft , who rents [Kellynch]6-kellynch . "[90-sir walter]

Before [Sir Walter]90-sir walter had reached this point , [Anne]93-anne 's eyes had caught the right direction , and distinguished [Captain Wentworth]117-captain wentworth standing among a cluster of men at a little distance . As [her]93-anne eyes fell on [him]117-captain wentworth , [his]117-captain wentworth seemed to be withdrawn from [her]93-anne . It had that appearance . It seemed as if [she]93-anne had been one moment too late ; and as long as [she]93-anne dared observe , [he]117-captain wentworth did not look again : but the performance was recommencing , and [she]93-anne was forced to seem to restore [her]93-anne attention to the orchestra and look straight forward .

When [she]93-anne could give another glance , [he]117-captain wentworth had moved away . [He]117-captain wentworth could not have come nearer to [her]93-anne if [he]117-captain wentworth would ; [she]93-anne was so surrounded and shut in : but [she]93-anne would rather have caught [his]117-captain wentworth eye .

[Mr Elliot]102-mr elliot 's speech , too , distressed [her]93-anne . [She]93-anne had no longer any inclination to talk to [him]102-mr elliot . [She]93-anne wished [him]102-mr elliot not so near [her]93-anne .

The first act was over . Now [she]93-anne hoped for some beneficial change ; and , after a period of nothing - saying amongst [the party]542-the party , [some of [them]542-the party]1888-some of them did decide on going in quest of tea . [Anne]93-anne was one of the few who did not choose to move . [She]93-anne remained in [her]93-anne seat , and so did [Lady Russell]101-lady russell ; but [she]93-anne had the pleasure of getting rid of [Mr Elliot]102-mr elliot ; and [she]93-anne did not mean , whatever [she]93-anne might feel on [Lady Russell]101-lady russell 's account , to shrink from conversation with [Captain Wentworth]117-captain wentworth , if [he]117-captain wentworth gave [her]93-anne the opportunity . [She]93-anne was persuaded by [Lady Russell]101-lady russell 's countenance that [she]93-anne had seen [him]117-captain wentworth .

[He]117-captain wentworth did not come however . [Anne]93-anne sometimes fancied [she]93-anne discerned [him]117-captain wentworth at a distance , but [he]117-captain wentworth never came . The anxious interval wore away unproductively . [The others]359-the others returned , [the room]406-the room filled again , benches were reclaimed and repossessed , and another hour of pleasure or of penance was to be sat out , another hour of music was to give delight or the gapes , as real or affected taste for it prevailed . To [Anne]93-anne , it chiefly wore the prospect of an hour of agitation . [She]93-anne could not quit [that room]1891-that room in peace without seeing [Captain Wentworth]117-captain wentworth once more , without the interchange of one friendly look .

In re - settling [themselves]1892-themselves there were now many changes , the result of which was favourable for [her]93-anne . [Colonel Wallis]172-colonel wallis declined sitting down again , and [Mr Elliot]102-mr elliot was invited by [Elizabeth]91-elizabeth and [Miss Carteret]177-miss carteret , in a manner not to be refused , to sit between [them]1892-themselves ; and by some other removals , and a little scheming of [her]93-anne own , [Anne]93-anne was enabled to place [herself]93-anne much nearer the end of the bench than [she]93-anne had been before , much more within reach of [a passer - by]1893-a passer - by . [She]93-anne could not do so , without comparing [herself]93-anne with [Miss Larolles]198-miss larolles , [the inimitable Miss Larolles]198-miss larolles ; but still [she]93-anne did it , and not with much happier effect ; though by what seemed prosperity in the shape of an early abdication in [[her]93-anne next neighbours]1894-her next neighbours , [she]93-anne found [herself]93-anne at the very end of the bench before the concert closed .

Such was [her]93-anne situation , with a vacant space at hand , when [Captain Wentworth]117-captain wentworth was again in sight . [She]93-anne saw [him]117-captain wentworth not far off . [He]117-captain wentworth saw [her]93-anne too ; yet [he]117-captain wentworth looked grave , and seemed irresolute , and only by very slow degrees came at last near enough to speak to [her]93-anne . [She]93-anne felt that something must be the matter . The change was indubitable . The difference between [his]117-captain wentworth present air and what it had been in [the Octagon Room]1849-the octagon room was strikingly great . Why was it ? [She]93-anne thought of [[her]93-anne father]274-her father , of [Lady Russell]101-lady russell . Could there have been any unpleasant glances ? [He]117-captain wentworth began by speaking of the concert gravely , more like [the Captain Wentworth of [Uppercross]4-uppercross]117-captain wentworth ; owned [himself]117-captain wentworth disappointed , had expected singing ; and in short , must confess that [he]117-captain wentworth should not be sorry when it was over . [Anne]93-anne replied , and spoke in defence of the performance so well , and yet in allowance for [his]117-captain wentworth feelings so pleasantly , that [his]117-captain wentworth countenance improved , and [he]117-captain wentworth replied again with almost a smile . [They]1897-they talked for a few minutes more ; the improvement held ; [he]117-captain wentworth even looked down towards the bench , as if [he]117-captain wentworth saw a place on [it]1898-it well worth occupying ; when at that moment a touch on [her]93-anne shoulder obliged [Anne]93-anne to turn round . It came from [Mr Elliot]102-mr elliot . [He]102-mr elliot begged [her]93-anne pardon , but [she]93-anne must be applied to , to explain [Italian]1899-italian again . [Miss Carteret]177-miss carteret was very anxious to have a general idea of what was next to be sung . [Anne]93-anne could not refuse ; but never had [she]93-anne sacrificed to politeness with a more suffering spirit .

A few minutes , though as few as possible , were inevitably consumed ; and when [[her]93-anne own mistress]1900-her own mistress again , when able to turn and look as [she]1900-her own mistress had done before , [she]1900-her own mistress found [herself]1900-her own mistress accosted by [Captain Wentworth]117-captain wentworth , in a reserved yet hurried sort of farewell . " [He]117-captain wentworth must wish [her]1900-her own mistress good night ; [he]117-captain wentworth was going ; [he]117-captain wentworth should get [home]285-home as fast as [he]117-captain wentworth could . "[117-captain wentworth]

" Is not this song worth staying for ? "[93-anne] said [Anne]93-anne , suddenly struck by an idea which made [her]93-anne yet more anxious to be encouraging .

" No ! "[117-captain wentworth] [he]117-captain wentworth replied impressively , " there is nothing worth [my]117-captain wentworth staying for ; "[117-captain wentworth] and [he]117-captain wentworth was gone directly .

Jealousy of [Mr Elliot]102-mr elliot ! It was the only intelligible motive . [Captain Wentworth]117-captain wentworth jealous of [her]93-anne affection ! Could [she]93-anne have believed it a week ago ; three hours ago ! For a moment the gratification was exquisite . But , alas ! there were very different thoughts to succeed . How was such jealousy to be quieted ? How was the truth to reach [him]117-captain wentworth ? How , in all the peculiar disadvantages of [their]1901-their respective situations , would [he]117-captain wentworth ever learn of [her]93-anne real sentiments ? It was misery to think of [Mr Elliot]102-mr elliot 's attentions . [Their]1901-their evil was incalculable .

Chapter 21

[Anne]93-anne recollected with pleasure the next morning [her]93-anne promise of going to [Mrs Smith]182-mrs smith , meaning that it should engage [her]93-anne from [home]285-home at the time when [Mr Elliot]102-mr elliot would be most likely to call ; for to avoid [Mr Elliot]102-mr elliot was almost a first object .

[She]93-anne felt a great deal of good - will towards [him]102-mr elliot . In spite of the mischief of [his]102-mr elliot attentions , [she]93-anne owed [him]102-mr elliot gratitude and regard , perhaps compassion . [She]93-anne could not help thinking much of the extraordinary circumstances attending [their]1901-their acquaintance , of the right which [he]102-mr elliot seemed to have to interest [her]93-anne , by everything in situation , by [his]102-mr elliot own sentiments , by [his]102-mr elliot early prepossession . It was altogether very extraordinary ; flattering , but painful . There was much to regret . How [she]93-anne might have felt had there been no [Captain Wentworth]117-captain wentworth in the case , was not worth enquiry ; for there was a [Captain Wentworth]117-captain wentworth ; and be the conclusion of the present suspense good or bad , [her]93-anne affection would be [his]102-mr elliot for ever . [Their]1901-their union , [she]93-anne believed , could not divide [her]93-anne more from [other men]1903-other men , than [their]1901-their final separation .

Prettier musings of high - wrought love and eternal constancy , could never have passed along [the streets of [Bath]10-bath]1904-the streets of bath , than [Anne]93-anne was sporting with from [Camden Place]60-camden place to [Westgate Buildings]72-westgate buildings . It was almost enough to spread purification and perfume all the way .

[She]93-anne was sure of a pleasant reception ; and [[her]93-anne friend]546-her friend seemed this morning particularly obliged to [her]93-anne for coming , seemed hardly to have expected [her]93-anne , though it had been an appointment .

An account of the concert was immediately claimed ; and [Anne]93-anne 's recollections of the concert were quite happy enough to animate [her]93-anne features and make [her]93-anne rejoice to talk of it . All that [she]93-anne could tell [she]93-anne told most gladly , but the all was little for [one who had been [there]377-there , and unsatisfactory for such an enquirer as [Mrs Smith]182-mrs smith , who had already heard , through the short cut of [a laundress]1908-a laundress and [a waiter]1255-a waiter , rather more of the general success and produce of the evening than [Anne]93-anne could relate , and who now asked in vain for several particulars of [the company]1910-the company]1906-one who had been there , and unsatisfactory for such an enquirer as mrs smith , who had already heard , through the short cut of a laundress and a waiter , rather more of the general success and produce of the evening than anne could relate , and who now asked in vain for several particulars of the company . [Everybody of any consequence or notoriety in Bath]1911-everybody of any consequence or notoriety in bath was well know by name to [Mrs Smith]182-mrs smith .

" [The little Durands]200-the little durands were [there]377-there , [I]93-anne conclude , "[93-anne] said [she]93-anne , " with [their]200-the little durands mouths open to catch the music , like unfledged sparrows ready to be fed . [They]200-the little durands never miss a concert . "[93-anne]

" Yes ; [I]93-anne did not see [them]200-the little durands [myself]93-anne , but [I]93-anne heard [Mr Elliot]102-mr elliot say [they]200-the little durands were in [the room]406-the room . "[93-anne]

" [The Ibbotsons]201-the ibbotsons , were [they]200-the little durands [there]377-there ? and [the two new beauties]3117-the two new beauties , with [the tall Irish officer , who is talked of for one of [them]200-the little durands]3118-the tall irish officer , who is talked of for one of them . "[93-anne]

" [I]93-anne do not know . [I]93-anne do not think [they]3117-the two new beauties were . "[93-anne]

" [Old Lady Mary Maclean]94-mary ? [I]93-anne need not ask after [her]94-mary . [She]94-mary never misses , [I]93-anne know ; and [you]93-anne must have seen [her]94-mary . [She]94-mary must have been in [[your]93-anne own circle]3119-your own circle ; for as [you]93-anne went with [Lady Dalrymple]180-lady dalrymple , [you]93-anne were in the seats of grandeur , round the orchestra , of course . "[93-anne]

" No , that was what [I]93-anne dreaded . It would have been very unpleasant to [me]93-anne in every respect . But happily [Lady Dalrymple]180-lady dalrymple always chooses to be farther off ; and [we]3120-we were exceedingly well placed , that is , for hearing ; [I]93-anne must not say for seeing , because [I]93-anne appear to have seen very little . "[93-anne]

" Oh ! [you]93-anne saw enough for [your]93-anne own amusement . [I]93-anne can understand . There is a sort of domestic enjoyment to be known even in [a crowd]3121-a crowd , and this [you]93-anne had . [You]93-anne were a large party in [yourselves]93-anne , and [you]93-anne wanted nothing beyond . "[93-anne]

" But [I]93-anne ought to have looked about [me]93-anne more , "[93-anne] said [Anne]93-anne , conscious while [she]93-anne spoke that there had in fact been no want of looking about , that the object only had been deficient .

" No , no ; [you]93-anne were better employed . [You]93-anne need not tell [me]93-anne that [you]93-anne had a pleasant evening . [I]93-anne see it in [your]93-anne eye . [I]93-anne perfectly see how the hours passed : that [you]93-anne had always something agreeable to listen to . In the intervals of the concert it was conversation . "[93-anne]

[Anne]93-anne half smiled and said , " Do [you]93-anne see that in [my]93-anne eye ? "[93-anne]

" Yes , [I]93-anne do . [Your]93-anne countenance perfectly informs [me]93-anne that [you]93-anne were in company last night with [the person whom [you]93-anne think the most agreeable in [the world]237-the world]3122-the person whom you think the most agreeable in the world , [the person who interests [you]93-anne at this present time more than all the rest of [the world]237-the world put together]3124-the person who interests you at this present time more than all the rest of the world put together . "[93-anne]

A blush overspread [Anne]93-anne 's cheeks . [She]93-anne could say nothing .

" And such being the case , "[182-mrs smith] continued [Mrs Smith]182-mrs smith , after a short pause , " [I]182-mrs smith hope [you]93-anne believe that [I]182-mrs smith do know how to value [your]93-anne kindness in coming to [me]182-mrs smith this morning . [Anne]93-anne heard nothing of this . [She]93-anne was still in the astonishment and confusion excited by [[her]93-anne friend]546-her friend 's penetration , unable to imagine how any report of [Captain Wentworth]117-captain wentworth could have reached [her]93-anne . After another short silence--

" Pray , "[182-mrs smith] said [Mrs Smith]182-mrs smith , " is [Mr Elliot]102-mr elliot aware of [your]93-anne acquaintance with [me]182-mrs smith ? Does [he]102-mr elliot know that [I]182-mrs smith am in [Bath]10-bath ? "[182-mrs smith]

" [Mr Elliot]102-mr elliot ! "[93-anne] repeated [Anne]93-anne , looking up surprised . A moment 's reflection shewed [her]93-anne the mistake [she]93-anne had been under . [She]93-anne caught it instantaneously ; and recovering [her]93-anne courage with the feeling of safety , soon added , more composedly , " Are [you]102-mr elliot acquainted with [Mr Elliot]102-mr elliot ? "[93-anne]

" [I]182-mrs smith have been a good deal acquainted with [him]102-mr elliot , "[182-mrs smith] replied [Mrs Smith]182-mrs smith , gravely , " but it seems worn out now . It is a great while since [we]3126-we met . "[182-mrs smith]

" [I]93-anne was not at all aware of this . [You]93-anne never mentioned it before . Had [I]93-anne known it , [I]93-anne would have had the pleasure of talking to [him]102-mr elliot about [you]93-anne . "[93-anne]

" To confess the truth , "[182-mrs smith] said [Mrs Smith]182-mrs smith , assuming [her]182-mrs smith usual air of cheerfulness , " that is exactly the pleasure [I]182-mrs smith want [you]93-anne to have . "[182-mrs smith]

" [I]93-anne should be extremely happy ; [I]93-anne hope [you]93-anne can not doubt [my]93-anne willingness to be of even the slightest use to [you]93-anne , "[93-anne] replied [Anne]93-anne ; " but [I]93-anne suspect that [you]93-anne are considering [me]93-anne as having a higher claim on [Mr Elliot]102-mr elliot , a greater right to influence [him]102-mr elliot , than is really the case . [I]93-anne am sure [you]93-anne have , somehow or other , imbibed such a notion . [You]93-anne must consider [me]93-anne only as [[Mr Elliot]102-mr elliot 's relation]3128-mr elliot 's relation . If in that light there is anything which [you]93-anne suppose [[his]102-mr elliot cousin]914-his cousin might fairly ask of [him]102-mr elliot , [I]93-anne beg [you]93-anne would not hesitate to employ [me]93-anne . "[93-anne]

[Mrs Smith]182-mrs smith gave [her]93-anne a penetrating glance , and then , smiling , said--

" [I]182-mrs smith have been a little premature , [I]182-mrs smith perceive ; [I]182-mrs smith beg [your]93-anne pardon . [I]182-mrs smith ought to have waited for official information . But now , [[my]182-mrs smith dear]2319-my dear [Miss Elliot]93-anne , as [an old friend]676-an old friend , do give [me]182-mrs smith a hint as to when [I]182-mrs smith may speak . Next week ? To be sure by next week [I]182-mrs smith may be allowed to think it all settled , and build [my]182-mrs smith own selfish schemes on [Mr Elliot]102-mr elliot 's good fortune . "[182-mrs smith]

" No , "[93-anne] replied [Anne]93-anne , " nor next week , nor next , nor next . [I]93-anne assure [you]93-anne that nothing of the sort [you]93-anne are thinking of will be settled any week . [I]93-anne am not going to marry [Mr Elliot]102-mr elliot . [I]93-anne should like to know why [you]93-anne imagine [I]93-anne am ? "[93-anne]

[Mrs Smith]182-mrs smith looked at [her]93-anne again , looked earnestly , smiled , shook [her]182-mrs smith head , and exclaimed--

" Now , how [I]182-mrs smith do wish [I]182-mrs smith understood [you]93-anne ! How [I]182-mrs smith do wish [I]182-mrs smith knew what [you]93-anne were at ! [I]182-mrs smith have a great idea that [you]93-anne do not design to be cruel , when the right moment occurs . Till it does come , [you]93-anne know , [[we]3132-we [women]2486-women]3133-we women never mean to have [anybody]2413-anybody . It is a thing of course among [us]3132-we , that [every man]3136-every man is refused , till [he]3136-every man offers . But why should [you]93-anne be cruel ? Let [me]182-mrs smith plead for [[my]182-mrs smith -- present friend]3137-my -- present friend [I]182-mrs smith can not call [him]3137-my -- present friend , but for [[my]182-mrs smith former friend]3138-my former friend . Where can [you]93-anne look for a more suitable match ? Where could [you]93-anne expect [a more gentlemanlike , agreeable man]3139-a more gentlemanlike , agreeable man ? Let [me]182-mrs smith recommend [Mr Elliot]102-mr elliot . [I]182-mrs smith am sure [you]93-anne hear nothing but good of [him]102-mr elliot from [Colonel Wallis]172-colonel wallis ; and who can know [him]102-mr elliot better than [Colonel Wallis]172-colonel wallis ? "[182-mrs smith]

" [[My]182-mrs smith dear]2319-my dear [Mrs Smith]182-mrs smith , [[Mr Elliot]102-mr elliot 's wife]3141-mr elliot 's wife has not been dead much above half a year . [He]102-mr elliot ought not to be supposed to be paying [his]102-mr elliot addresses to [any one]1355-any one . "[182-mrs smith]

" Oh ! if these are [your]93-anne only objections , "[182-mrs smith] cried [Mrs Smith]182-mrs smith , archly , " [Mr Elliot]102-mr elliot is safe , and [I]182-mrs smith shall give [myself]182-mrs smith no more trouble about [him]102-mr elliot . Do not forget [me]182-mrs smith when [you]93-anne are married , that 's all . Let [him]102-mr elliot know [me]182-mrs smith to be [a friend of [yours]93-anne]3143-a friend of yours , and then [he]102-mr elliot will think little of the trouble required , which it is very natural for [him]102-mr elliot now , with so many affairs and engagements of [his]102-mr elliot own , to avoid and get rid of as [he]102-mr elliot can ; very natural , perhaps . [Ninety - nine out of a hundred]3144-ninety - nine out of a hundred would do the same . Of course , [he]102-mr elliot can not be aware of the importance to [me]182-mrs smith . Well , [[my]182-mrs smith dear]2319-my dear [Miss Elliot]93-anne , [I]182-mrs smith hope and trust [you]93-anne will be very happy . [Mr Elliot]102-mr elliot has sense to understand the value of [such a woman]3089-such a woman . [Your]93-anne peace will not be shipwrecked as [mine]182-mrs smith has been . [You]93-anne are safe in all worldly matters , and safe in [his]102-mr elliot character . [He]102-mr elliot will not be led astray ; [he]102-mr elliot will not be misled by [others]391-others to [his]102-mr elliot ruin . "[182-mrs smith]

" No , "[93-anne] said [Anne]93-anne , " [I]93-anne can readily believe all that of [[my]93-anne cousin]2880-my cousin . [He]102-mr elliot seems to have a calm decided temper , not at all open to dangerous impressions . [I]93-anne consider [him]102-mr elliot with great respect . [I]93-anne have no reason , from any thing that has fallen within [my]93-anne observation , to do otherwise . But [I]93-anne have not known [him]102-mr elliot long ; and [he]102-mr elliot is not a man , [I]93-anne think , to be known intimately soon . Will not this manner of speaking of [him]102-mr elliot , [Mrs Smith]182-mrs smith , convince [you]182-mrs smith that [he]102-mr elliot is nothing to [me]93-anne ? Surely this must be calm enough . And , upon [my]93-anne word , [he]102-mr elliot is nothing to [me]93-anne . Should [he]102-mr elliot ever propose to [me]93-anne ( which [I]93-anne have very little reason to imagine [he]102-mr elliot has any thought of doing ) , [I]93-anne shall not accept [him]102-mr elliot . [I]93-anne assure [you]182-mrs smith [I]93-anne shall not . [I]93-anne assure [you]182-mrs smith , [Mr Elliot]102-mr elliot had not the share which [you]182-mrs smith have been supposing , in whatever pleasure the concert of last night might afford : not [Mr Elliot]102-mr elliot ; it is not [Mr Elliot]102-mr elliot that-- "[93-anne]

[She]1913-she stopped , regretting with a deep blush that [she]1913-she had implied so much ; but less would hardly have been sufficient . [Mrs Smith]182-mrs smith would hardly have believed so soon in [Mr Elliot]102-mr elliot 's failure , but from the perception of there being [a somebody else]1914-a somebody else . " Do tell [me]1913-she how it first came into [your]182-mrs smith head . "[1913-she]

[Mrs Smith]182-mrs smith said nothing .

" [I]182-mrs smith beg [your]102-mr elliot pardon , [[my]182-mrs smith dear]2319-my dear [Miss Elliot]93-anne , "[182-mrs smith] [she]182-mrs smith cried , in [her]182-mrs smith natural tone of cordiality , " [I]182-mrs smith beg [your]102-mr elliot pardon for the short answers [I]182-mrs smith have been giving [you]102-mr elliot , but [I]182-mrs smith have been uncertain what [I]182-mrs smith ought to do . " [Mr Elliot]102-mr elliot , "[182-mrs smith] replied [Mrs Smith]182-mrs smith , " at that period of [his]102-mr elliot life , had one object in view : to make [his]102-mr elliot fortune , and by a rather quicker process than the law . [He]102-mr elliot was determined to make it by marriage . [Mrs Smith]182-mrs smith hesitated a little here . " Oh ! those things are too common . " But was not [she]182-mrs smith [a very low woman]3211-a very low woman ? "[182-mrs smith]

" Yes ; which [I]182-mrs smith objected to , but [he]102-mr elliot would not regard . Money , money , was all that [he]102-mr elliot wanted . " But for [my]93-anne satisfaction , if [you]3223-you will have the goodness to ring for [Mary]94-mary ; stay : [I]93-anne am sure [you]3223-you will have the still greater goodness of going [yourself]3223-you into [[my]93-anne bedroom]3226-my bedroom , and bringing [me]93-anne the small inlaid box which [you]3223-you will find on the upper shelf of [the closet]3227-the closet . "[93-anne]
