" This is full of papers belonging to [him]102-mr elliot , to [[my]182-mrs smith husband]3228-my husband ; a small portion only of what [I]182-mrs smith had to look over when [I]182-mrs smith lost [him]102-mr elliot . The letter [I]182-mrs smith am looking for was one written by [Mr Elliot]102-mr elliot to [him]102-mr elliot before [our]3229-our marriage , and happened to be saved ; why , [one]252-one can hardly imagine . But [he]102-mr elliot was careless and immethodical , like [other men]1903-other men , about those things ; and when [I]182-mrs smith came to examine [his]102-mr elliot papers , [I]182-mrs smith found it with others still more trivial , from [different people scattered here and there]3232-different people scattered here and there , while many letters and memorandums of real importance had been destroyed . Here it is ; [I]182-mrs smith would not burn it , because being even then very little satisfied with [Mr Elliot]102-mr elliot , [I]182-mrs smith was determined to preserve every document of former intimacy . [I]182-mrs smith have now another motive for being glad that [I]182-mrs smith can produce it . "[182-mrs smith]

This was the letter , directed to " [Charles Smith]204-charles smith , Esq . [Tunbridge Wells]82-tunbridge wells , "[182-mrs smith] and dated from [London]7-london , as far back as July , 1803:--

" [Dear Smith,--I]205-dear smith,--i have received [yours]205-dear smith,--i . [Your]205-dear smith,--i kindness almost overpowers [me]182-mrs smith . [I]182-mrs smith wish nature had made such hearts as [yours]205-dear smith,--i more common , but [I]182-mrs smith have lived three - and - twenty years in [the world]237-the world , and have seen none like it . At present , believe [me]182-mrs smith , [I]182-mrs smith have no need of [your]205-dear smith,--i services , being in cash again . Give [me]182-mrs smith joy : [I]182-mrs smith have got rid of [Sir Walter]90-sir walter and [Miss.]3234-miss. [They]3235-they are gone back to [Kellynch]6-kellynch , and almost made [me]182-mrs smith swear to visit [them]3235-they this summer ; but [my]182-mrs smith first visit to [Kellynch]6-kellynch will be with [a surveyor]3236-a surveyor , to tell [me]182-mrs smith how to bring it with best advantage to the hammer . [The baronet]2342-the baronet , nevertheless , is not unlikely to marry again ; [he]2342-the baronet is quite fool enough . If [he]2342-the baronet does , however , [they]3235-they will leave [me]182-mrs smith in peace , which may be a decent equivalent for the reversion . [He]2342-the baronet is worse than last year . "[182-mrs smith]

" [I]182-mrs smith wish [I]182-mrs smith had any name but [Elliot]102-mr elliot . [I]182-mrs smith am sick of it . The name of [Walter]90-sir walter [I]182-mrs smith can drop , thank [God]141-god ! and [I]182-mrs smith desire [you]182-mrs smith will never insult [me]182-mrs smith with [my]182-mrs smith second W. again , meaning , for the rest of [my]182-mrs smith life , to be only [yours]182-mrs smith truly,--Wm . [Elliot]102-mr elliot . "[182-mrs smith]

Such a letter could not be read without putting [Anne]93-anne in a glow ; and [Mrs Smith]182-mrs smith , observing the high colour in [her]93-anne face , said--

" The language , [I]182-mrs smith know , is highly disrespectful . Though [I]182-mrs smith have forgot the exact terms , [I]182-mrs smith have a perfect impression of the general meaning . But it shows [you]182-mrs smith [the man]313-the man . Mark [his]313-the man professions to [[my]182-mrs smith poor husband]3239-my poor husband . Can any thing be stronger ? "[182-mrs smith]

[Anne]93-anne could not immediately get over the shock and mortification of finding such words applied to [[her]93-anne father]274-her father . [She]93-anne was obliged to recollect that [her]93-anne seeing the letter was a violation of the laws of honour , that [no one]479-no one ought to be judged or to be known by such testimonies , that no private correspondence could bear the eye of [others]391-others , before [she]93-anne could recover calmness enough to return the letter which [she]93-anne had been meditating over , and say--

" Thank [you]182-mrs smith . This is full proof undoubtedly ; proof of every thing [you]182-mrs smith were saying . But why be acquainted with [us]3240-us now ? "[93-anne]

" [I]182-mrs smith can explain this too , "[182-mrs smith] cried [Mrs Smith]182-mrs smith , smiling .

" Can [you]182-mrs smith really ? "[93-anne]

" Yes . [I]93-anne have shewn [you]93-anne [Mr Elliot]102-mr elliot as [he]102-mr elliot was a dozen years ago , and [I]93-anne will shew [him]102-mr elliot as [he]102-mr elliot is now . [I]93-anne can not produce written proof again , but [I]93-anne can give as authentic oral testimony as [you]93-anne can desire , of what [he]102-mr elliot is now wanting , and what [he]102-mr elliot is now doing . [He]102-mr elliot is [no hypocrite]3241-no hypocrite now . [He]102-mr elliot truly wants to marry [you]93-anne . [His]102-mr elliot present attentions to [[your]93-anne family]2885-your family are very sincere : quite from the heart . [I]93-anne will give [you]93-anne [my]93-anne authority : [[his]102-mr elliot friend]1073-his friend [Colonel Wallis]172-colonel wallis . "[93-anne]

" [Colonel Wallis]172-colonel wallis ! [you]93-anne are acquainted with [him]102-mr elliot ? "[93-anne]

" No . It does not come to [me]93-anne in quite so direct a line as that ; it takes a bend or two , but nothing of consequence . [The stream]3244-the stream is as good as at first ; the little rubbish it collects in the turnings is easily moved away . [Mr Elliot]102-mr elliot talks unreservedly to [Colonel Wallis]172-colonel wallis of [his]102-mr elliot views on [you]93-anne , which said [Colonel Wallis]172-colonel wallis , [I]93-anne imagine to be , in [himself]102-mr elliot , a sensible , careful , discerning sort of character ; but [Colonel Wallis]172-colonel wallis has [a very pretty silly wife]3245-a very pretty silly wife , to whom [he]172-colonel wallis tells things which [he]172-colonel wallis had better not , and [he]172-colonel wallis repeats it all to [her]3245-a very pretty silly wife . [She]3245-a very pretty silly wife in the overflowing spirits of [her]3245-a very pretty silly wife recovery , repeats it all to [[her]3245-a very pretty silly wife nurse]1694-her nurse ; and [the nurse]3247-the nurse knowing [my]93-anne acquaintance with [you]93-anne , very naturally brings it all to [me]93-anne . On Monday evening , [[my]93-anne good friend]3248-my good friend [Mrs Rooke]184-mrs rooke let [me]93-anne thus much into the secrets of [Marlborough Buildings]63-marlborough buildings . When [I]93-anne talked of a whole history , therefore , [you]93-anne see [I]93-anne was not romancing so much as [you]93-anne supposed . "[93-anne]

" [[My]93-anne dear]2319-my dear [Mrs Smith]182-mrs smith , [your]93-anne authority is deficient . This will not do . [Mr Elliot]102-mr elliot 's having any views on [me]93-anne will not in the least account for the efforts [he]102-mr elliot made towards a reconciliation with [[my]93-anne father]2247-my father . That was all prior to [my]93-anne coming to [Bath]10-bath . [I]93-anne found [them]3251-them on the most friendly terms when [I]93-anne arrived . "[93-anne]

" [I]93-anne know [you]93-anne did ; [I]93-anne know it all perfectly , but-- "[93-anne]

" Indeed , [Mrs Smith]182-mrs smith , [we]3252-we must not expect to get real information in such a line . Facts or opinions which are to pass through the hands of so many , to be misconceived by folly in one , and ignorance in another , can hardly have much truth left . "[93-anne]

" Only give [me]93-anne a hearing . [You]93-anne will soon be able to judge of the general credit due , by listening to some particulars which [you]93-anne can [yourself]93-anne immediately contradict or confirm . [Nobody]2242-nobody supposes that [you]93-anne were [his]102-mr elliot first inducement . [He]102-mr elliot had seen [you]93-anne indeed , before [he]102-mr elliot came to [Bath]10-bath , and admired [you]93-anne , but without knowing it to be [you]93-anne . So says [[my]93-anne historian]3254-my historian , at least . Is this true ? Did [he]102-mr elliot see [you]93-anne last summer or autumn , ' somewhere down in [the west]3255-the west , ' to use [her]3254-my historian own words , without knowing it to be [you]93-anne ? "[93-anne]

" [He]102-mr elliot certainly did . So far it is very true . At [Lyme]48-lyme . [I]93-anne happened to be at [Lyme]48-lyme . "[93-anne]

" Well , "[182-mrs smith] continued [Mrs Smith]182-mrs smith , triumphantly , " grant [[my]182-mrs smith friend]2915-my friend the credit due to the establishment of the first point asserted . [He]102-mr elliot saw [you]93-anne then at [Lyme]48-lyme , and liked [you]93-anne so well as to be exceedingly pleased to meet with [you]93-anne again in [Camden Place]60-camden place , as [Miss Anne Elliot]93-anne , and from that moment , [I]182-mrs smith have no doubt , had a double motive in [his]102-mr elliot visits [there]377-there . But there was another , and an earlier , which [I]182-mrs smith will now explain . If there is anything in [my]182-mrs smith story which [you]93-anne know to be either false or improbable , stop [me]182-mrs smith . [My]182-mrs smith account states , that [[[your]93-anne sister]2380-your sister 's friend]3259-your sister 's friend , [the lady now staying with [you]93-anne , whom [I]182-mrs smith have heard [you]93-anne mention]3260-the lady now staying with you , whom i have heard you mention , came to [Bath]10-bath with [Miss Elliot]93-anne and [Sir Walter]90-sir walter as long ago as [September]207-september ( in short when [they]3261-they first came [themselves]3261-they ) , and has been staying [there]377-there ever since ; that [she]3259-your sister 's friend is [a clever , insinuating , handsome woman]3263-a clever , insinuating , handsome woman , poor and plausible , and altogether such in situation and manner , as to give a general idea , among [Sir Walter]90-sir walter 's acquaintance , of [her]3259-your sister 's friend meaning to be [Lady Elliot]100-lady elliot , and as general a surprise that [Miss Elliot]93-anne should be apparently , blind to the danger . "[182-mrs smith]

Here [Mrs Smith]182-mrs smith paused a moment ; but [Anne]93-anne had not a word to say , and [she]182-mrs smith continued--

" This was the light in which it appeared to [those who knew [the family]312-the family , long before [you]93-anne returned to it]3264-those who knew the family , long before you returned to it ; and [Colonel Wallis]172-colonel wallis had [his]172-colonel wallis eye upon [[your]93-anne father]2212-your father enough to be sensible of it , though [he]172-colonel wallis did not then visit in [Camden Place]60-camden place ; but [his]172-colonel wallis regard for [Mr Elliot]102-mr elliot gave [him]172-colonel wallis an interest in watching all that was going on [there]377-there , and when [Mr Elliot]102-mr elliot came to [Bath]10-bath for a day or two , as [he]102-mr elliot happened to do a little before Christmas , [Colonel Wallis]172-colonel wallis made [him]102-mr elliot acquainted with the appearance of things , and the reports beginning to prevail . Now [you]93-anne are to understand , that time had worked a very material change in [Mr Elliot]102-mr elliot 's opinions as to the value of a baronetcy . Upon all points of blood and connexion [he]102-mr elliot is [a completely altered man]3268-a completely altered man . Having long had as much money as [he]102-mr elliot could spend , nothing to wish for on the side of avarice or indulgence , [he]102-mr elliot has been gradually learning to pin [his]102-mr elliot happiness upon the consequence [he]102-mr elliot is heir to . [I]182-mrs smith thought it coming on before [our]3269-our acquaintance ceased , but it is now a confirmed feeling . [He]102-mr elliot can not bear the idea of not being [Sir William]208-sir william . [You]93-anne may guess , therefore , that the news [he]102-mr elliot heard from [[his]102-mr elliot friend]1073-his friend could not be very agreeable , and [you]93-anne may guess what it produced ; the resolution of coming back to [Bath]10-bath as soon as possible , and of fixing [himself]102-mr elliot [here]2340-here for a time , with the view of renewing [his]102-mr elliot former acquaintance , and recovering such a footing in [the family]312-the family as might give [him]102-mr elliot the means of ascertaining the degree of [his]102-mr elliot danger , and of circumventing [the lady]1007-the lady if [he]102-mr elliot found it material . This was agreed upon between [the two friends]3046-the two friends as the only thing to be done ; and [Colonel Wallis]172-colonel wallis was to assist in every way that [he]172-colonel wallis could . [He]102-mr elliot was to be introduced , and [Mrs Wallis]173-mrs wallis was to be introduced , and [everybody]651-everybody was to be introduced . [Mr Elliot]102-mr elliot came back accordingly ; and on application was forgiven , as [you]93-anne know , and re - admitted into [the family]312-the family ; and there it was [his]102-mr elliot constant object , and [his]102-mr elliot only object ( till [your]93-anne arrival added another motive ) , to watch [Sir Walter]90-sir walter and [Mrs Clay]105-mrs clay . [He]102-mr elliot omitted no opportunity of being with [them]3046-the two friends , threw [himself]102-mr elliot in [their]3046-the two friends way , called at all hours ; but [I]182-mrs smith need not be particular on this subject . [You]93-anne can imagine what [an artful man]3277-an artful man would do ; and with this guide , perhaps , may recollect what [you]93-anne have seen [him]102-mr elliot do . "[182-mrs smith]

" Yes , "[93-anne] said [Anne]93-anne , " [you]93-anne tell [me]93-anne nothing which does not accord with what [I]93-anne have known , or could imagine . There is always something offensive in the details of cunning . The manoeuvres of selfishness and duplicity must ever be revolting , but [I]93-anne have heard nothing which really surprises [me]93-anne . [I]93-anne know those who would be shocked by such a representation of [Mr Elliot]102-mr elliot , who would have difficulty in believing it ; but [I]93-anne have never been satisfied . [I]93-anne have always wanted some other motive for [his]102-mr elliot conduct than appeared . [I]93-anne should like to know [his]102-mr elliot present opinion , as to the probability of the event [he]102-mr elliot has been in dread of ; whether [he]102-mr elliot considers the danger to be lessening or not . "[93-anne]

" Lessening , [I]182-mrs smith understand , "[182-mrs smith] replied [Mrs Smith]182-mrs smith . " [He]102-mr elliot thinks [Mrs Clay]105-mrs clay afraid of [him]102-mr elliot , aware that [he]102-mr elliot sees through [her]105-mrs clay , and not daring to proceed as [she]105-mrs clay might do in [his]102-mr elliot absence . But since [he]102-mr elliot must be absent some time or other , [I]182-mrs smith do not perceive how [he]102-mr elliot can ever be secure while [she]105-mrs clay holds [her]105-mrs clay present influence . [Mrs Wallis]173-mrs wallis has an amusing idea , as [nurse]3278-nurse tells [me]182-mrs smith , that it is to be put into the marriage articles when [you]3279-you and [Mr Elliot]102-mr elliot marry , that [[your]3279-you father]2212-your father is not to marry [Mrs Clay]105-mrs clay . A scheme , worthy of [Mrs Wallis]173-mrs wallis 's understanding , by all accounts ; but [my]182-mrs smith sensible nurse [Rooke]184-mrs rooke sees the absurdity of it . ' Why , to be sure , [ma'am]2584-ma'am , ' said [she]184-mrs rooke , ' it would not prevent [his]102-mr elliot marrying [anybody else]342-anybody else . ' And , indeed , to own the truth , [I]182-mrs smith do not think [nurse]3278-nurse , in [her]3278-nurse heart , is a very strenuous opposer of [Sir Walter]90-sir walter 's making a second match . [She]3278-nurse must be allowed to be [a favourer of matrimony]3284-a favourer of matrimony , [you]3279-you know ; and ( since [self]3285-self will intrude ) who can say that [she]3278-nurse may not have some flying visions of attending the next [Lady Elliot]100-lady elliot , through [Mrs Wallis]173-mrs wallis 's recommendation ? "[182-mrs smith]

" [I]93-anne am very glad to know all this , "[93-anne] said [Anne]93-anne , after a little thoughtfulness . " It will be more painful to [me]93-anne in some respects to be in company with [him]102-mr elliot , but [I]93-anne shall know better what to do . [My]93-anne line of conduct will be more direct . [Mr Elliot]102-mr elliot is evidently [a disingenuous , artificial , worldly man , who has never had any better principle to guide [him]102-mr elliot than selfishness]3286-a disingenuous , artificial , worldly man , who has never had any better principle to guide him than selfishness . "[93-anne]

But [Mr Elliot]102-mr elliot was not done with . [Mrs Smith]182-mrs smith had been carried away from [her]182-mrs smith first direction , and [Anne]93-anne had forgotten , in the interest of [her]93-anne own family concerns , how much had been originally implied against [him]102-mr elliot ; but [her]93-anne attention was now called to the explanation of those first hints , and [she]93-anne listened to a recital which , if it did not perfectly justify the unqualified bitterness of [Mrs Smith]182-mrs smith , proved [him]102-mr elliot to have been very unfeeling in [his]102-mr elliot conduct towards [her]182-mrs smith ; very deficient both in justice and compassion .

[She]93-anne learned that ( the intimacy between [them]1920-their continuing unimpaired by [Mr Elliot]102-mr elliot 's marriage ) [they]1920-their had been as before always together , and [Mr Elliot]102-mr elliot had led [[his]102-mr elliot friend]1073-his friend into expenses much beyond [his]102-mr elliot fortune . [Mrs Smith]182-mrs smith did not want to take blame to [herself]182-mrs smith , and was most tender of throwing any on [[her]182-mrs smith husband]2315-her husband ; but [Anne]93-anne could collect that [their]1920-their income had never been equal to [their]1920-their style of living , and that from the first there had been a great deal of general and joint extravagance . From [[his]102-mr elliot wife]222-his wife 's account of [him]102-mr elliot [she]93-anne could discern [Mr Smith]209-mr smith to have been [a man of warm feelings , easy temper , careless habits]1924-a man of warm feelings , easy temper , careless habits , and not strong understanding , much more amiable than [[his]102-mr elliot friend]1073-his friend , and very unlike [him]209-mr smith , led by [him]209-mr smith , and probably despised by [him]209-mr smith . [Mr Elliot]102-mr elliot , raised by [his]102-mr elliot marriage to great affluence , and disposed to every gratification of pleasure and vanity which could be commanded without involving [himself]102-mr elliot , ( for with all [his]102-mr elliot self - indulgence [he]102-mr elliot had become [a prudent man]1926-a prudent man ) , and beginning to be rich , just as [[his]102-mr elliot friend]1073-his friend ought to have found [himself]102-mr elliot to be poor , seemed to have had no concern at all for [that friend]1928-that friend 's probable finances , but , on the contrary , had been prompting and encouraging expenses which could end only in ruin ; and [the Smiths]210-the smiths accordingly had been ruined .

[The husband]1700-the husband had died just in time to be spared the full knowledge of it . [They]210-the smiths had previously known embarrassments enough to try the friendship of [[their]210-the smiths friends]1930-their friends , and to prove that [Mr Elliot]102-mr elliot 's had better not be tried ; but it was not till [his]102-mr elliot death that the wretched state of [his]102-mr elliot affairs was fully known . With a confidence in [Mr Elliot]102-mr elliot 's regard , more creditable to [his]102-mr elliot feelings than [his]102-mr elliot judgement , [Mr Smith]209-mr smith had appointed [him]102-mr elliot the executor of [his]102-mr elliot will ; but [Mr Elliot]102-mr elliot would not act , and the difficulties and distress which this refusal had heaped on [her]1931-her , in addition to the inevitable sufferings of [her]1931-her situation , had been such as could not be related without anguish of spirit , or listened to without corresponding indignation .

[Anne]93-anne was shewn some letters of [his]102-mr elliot on the occasion , answers to urgent applications from [Mrs Smith]182-mrs smith , which all breathed the same stern resolution of not engaging in a fruitless trouble , and , under a cold civility , the same hard - hearted indifference to any of the evils it might bring on [her]1931-her . It was a dreadful picture of ingratitude and inhumanity ; and [Anne]93-anne felt , at some moments , that no flagrant open crime could have been worse . [She]93-anne had a great deal to listen to ; all the particulars of past sad scenes , all the minutiae of distress upon distress , which in former conversations had been merely hinted at , were dwelt on now with a natural indulgence . [Anne]93-anne could perfectly comprehend the exquisite relief , and was only the more inclined to wonder at the composure of [[her]93-anne friend]546-her friend 's usual state of mind .

There was one circumstance in the history of [her]93-anne grievances of particular irritation . [She]93-anne had good reason to believe that some property of [[her]93-anne husband]2315-her husband in [the West Indies]1934-the west indies , which had been for many years under a sort of sequestration for the payment of [its]1935-its own incumbrances , might be recoverable by proper measures ; and this property , though not large , would be enough to make [her]93-anne comparatively rich . But there was [nobody to stir in]1936-nobody to stir in [it]1935-its . [Mr Elliot]102-mr elliot would do nothing , and [she]93-anne could do nothing [herself]93-anne , equally disabled from personal exertion by [her]93-anne state of bodily weakness , and from employing [others]391-others by [her]93-anne want of money . [She]93-anne had no natural connexions to assist [her]93-anne even with [their]1938-their counsel , and [she]93-anne could not afford to purchase the assistance of the law . This was a cruel aggravation of actually straitened means . To feel that [she]93-anne ought to be in better circumstances , that a little trouble in [the right place]1939-the right place might do it , and to fear that delay might be even weakening [her]93-anne claims , was hard to bear .

It was on this point that [she]93-anne had hoped to engage [Anne]93-anne 's good offices with [Mr Elliot]102-mr elliot . [She]93-anne had previously , in the anticipation of [their]1940-their marriage , been very apprehensive of losing [[her]93-anne friend]546-her friend by it ; but on being assured that [he]102-mr elliot could have made no attempt of that nature , since [he]102-mr elliot did not even know [her]93-anne to be in [Bath]10-bath , it immediately occurred , that something might be done in [her]93-anne favour by the influence of [the woman [he]102-mr elliot loved]1942-the woman he loved , and [she]93-anne had been hastily preparing to interest [Anne]93-anne 's feelings , as far as the observances due to [Mr Elliot]102-mr elliot 's character would allow , when [Anne]93-anne 's refutation of the supposed engagement changed the face of everything ; and while it took from [her]93-anne the new - formed hope of succeeding in the object of [her]93-anne first anxiety , left [her]93-anne at least the comfort of telling the whole story [her]93-anne own way .

After listening to this full description of [Mr Elliot]102-mr elliot , [Anne]93-anne could not but express some surprise at [Mrs Smith]182-mrs smith 's having spoken of [him]102-mr elliot so favourably in the beginning of [their]1943-their conversation . " [She]182-mrs smith had seemed to recommend and praise [him]102-mr elliot ! "[93-anne]

" [[My]182-mrs smith dear]2319-my dear , "[182-mrs smith] was [Mrs Smith]182-mrs smith 's reply , " there was nothing else to be done . [I]182-mrs smith considered [your]2319-my dear marrying [him]102-mr elliot as certain , though [he]102-mr elliot might not yet have made the offer , and [I]182-mrs smith could no more speak the truth of [him]102-mr elliot , than if [he]102-mr elliot had been [[your]2319-my dear husband]2456-your husband . [My]182-mrs smith heart bled for [you]2319-my dear , as [I]182-mrs smith talked of happiness ; and yet [he]102-mr elliot is sensible , [he]102-mr elliot is agreeable , and with [such a woman as [you]2319-my dear]3289-such a woman as you , it was not absolutely hopeless . [He]102-mr elliot was very unkind to [[his]102-mr elliot first wife]3290-his first wife . [They]3291-they were wretched together . But [she]3290-his first wife was too ignorant and giddy for respect , and [he]102-mr elliot had never loved [her]3290-his first wife . [I]182-mrs smith was willing to hope that [you]2319-my dear must fare better . "[182-mrs smith]

[Anne]93-anne could just acknowledge within [herself]93-anne such a possibility of having been induced to marry [him]1944-him , as made [her]93-anne shudder at the idea of the misery which must have followed . It was just possible that [she]93-anne might have been persuaded by [Lady Russell]101-lady russell ! And under such a supposition , which would have been most miserable , when time had disclosed all , too late ?

It was very desirable that [Lady Russell]101-lady russell should be no longer deceived ; and one of the concluding arrangements of this important conference , which carried [them]1945-them through the greater part of the morning , was , that [Anne]93-anne had full liberty to communicate to [[her]93-anne friend]546-her friend everything relative to [Mrs Smith]182-mrs smith , in which [his]1944-him conduct was involved .

Chapter 22

[Anne]93-anne went [home]285-home to think over all that [she]93-anne had heard . In one point , [her]93-anne feelings were relieved by this knowledge of [Mr Elliot]102-mr elliot . There was no longer anything of tenderness due to [him]1944-him . [He]1944-him stood as opposed to [Captain Wentworth]117-captain wentworth , in all [his]1944-him own unwelcome obtrusiveness ; and the evil of [his]1944-him attentions last night , the irremediable mischief [he]1944-him might have done , was considered with sensations unqualified , unperplexed . Pity for [him]1944-him was all over . But this was the only point of relief . In every other respect , in looking around [her]93-anne , or penetrating forward , [she]93-anne saw more to distrust and to apprehend . [She]93-anne was concerned for the disappointment and pain [Lady Russell]101-lady russell would be feeling ; for the mortifications which must be hanging over [[her]93-anne father]274-her father and [sister]268-sister , and had all the distress of foreseeing many evils , without knowing how to avert any one of them . [She]93-anne was most thankful for [her]93-anne own knowledge of [him]1944-him . [She]93-anne had never considered [herself]93-anne as entitled to reward for not slighting [an old friend]676-an old friend like [Mrs Smith]182-mrs smith , but here was a reward indeed springing from it ! [Mrs Smith]182-mrs smith had been able to tell [her]93-anne what [no one else]2859-no one else could have done . Could the knowledge have been extended through [[her]93-anne family]2573-her family ? But this was a vain idea . [She]93-anne must talk to [Lady Russell]101-lady russell , tell [her]101-lady russell , consult with [her]101-lady russell , and having done [her]93-anne best , wait the event with as much composure as possible ; and after all , [her]93-anne greatest want of composure would be in that quarter of the mind which could not be opened to [Lady Russell]101-lady russell ; in that flow of anxieties and fears which must be all to [herself]93-anne .

[She]93-anne found , on reaching [home]285-home , that [she]93-anne had , as [she]93-anne intended , escaped seeing [Mr Elliot]102-mr elliot ; that [he]102-mr elliot had called and paid [them]1954-them a long morning visit ; but hardly had [she]93-anne congratulated [herself]93-anne , and felt safe , when [she]93-anne heard that [he]102-mr elliot was coming again in the evening .

" [I]91-elizabeth had not the smallest intention of asking [him]102-mr elliot , "[91-elizabeth] said [Elizabeth]91-elizabeth , with affected carelessness , " but [he]102-mr elliot gave so many hints ; so [Mrs Clay]105-mrs clay says , at least . "[91-elizabeth]

" Indeed , [I]102-mr elliot do say it . [I]102-mr elliot never saw [anybody]2413-anybody in [my]102-mr elliot life spell harder for an invitation . [Poor man]3293-poor man ! [I]102-mr elliot was really in pain for [him]102-mr elliot ; for [[your]105-mrs clay hard - hearted sister]3294-your hard - hearted sister , [Miss Anne]93-anne , seems bent on cruelty . "[102-mr elliot]

" Oh ! "[91-elizabeth] cried [Elizabeth]91-elizabeth , " [I]91-elizabeth have been rather too much used to the game to be soon overcome by [a gentleman]374-a gentleman 's hints . However , when [I]91-elizabeth found how excessively [he]102-mr elliot was regretting that [he]102-mr elliot should miss [[my]91-elizabeth father]2247-my father this morning , [I]91-elizabeth gave way immediately , for [I]91-elizabeth would never really omit an opportunity of bringing [him]102-mr elliot and [Sir Walter]90-sir walter together . [They]3297-they appear to so much advantage in company with [each other]489-each other . [Each]3299-each behaving so pleasantly . [Mr Elliot]102-mr elliot looking up with so much respect . "[91-elizabeth]

" Quite delightful ! "[105-mrs clay] cried [Mrs Clay]105-mrs clay , not daring , however , to turn [her]105-mrs clay eyes towards [Anne]93-anne . " Exactly like [father]267-father and [son]3301-son ! [Dear Miss Elliot]211-dear miss elliot , may [I]105-mrs clay not say [father]267-father and [son]3301-son ? "[105-mrs clay]

" Oh ! [I]91-elizabeth lay no embargo on any body 's words . If [you]211-dear miss elliot will have such ideas ! But , upon [my]91-elizabeth word , [I]91-elizabeth am scarcely sensible of [his]102-mr elliot attentions being beyond those of [other men]1903-other men . "[91-elizabeth]

" [[My]105-mrs clay dear]2319-my dear [Miss Elliot]93-anne ! "[105-mrs clay] exclaimed [Mrs Clay]105-mrs clay , lifting [her]105-mrs clay hands and eyes , and sinking all the rest of [her]105-mrs clay astonishment in a convenient silence .

" Well , [[my]91-elizabeth dear]2319-my dear [Penelope]113-penelope , [you]113-penelope need not be so alarmed about [him]102-mr elliot . [I]91-elizabeth did invite [him]102-mr elliot , [you]113-penelope know . [I]91-elizabeth sent [him]102-mr elliot away with smiles . When [I]91-elizabeth found [he]102-mr elliot was really going to [[his]102-mr elliot friends]361-his friends at [Thornberry Park]83-thornberry park for the whole day to - morrow , [I]91-elizabeth had compassion on [him]102-mr elliot . "[91-elizabeth]

[Anne]93-anne admired the good acting of [the friend]1955-the friend , in being able to shew such pleasure as [she]93-anne did , in the expectation and in the actual arrival of [the very person whose presence must really be interfering with [her]93-anne prime object]1956-the very person whose presence must really be interfering with her prime object . It was impossible but that [Mrs Clay]105-mrs clay must hate the sight of [Mr Elliot]102-mr elliot ; and yet [she]105-mrs clay could assume a most obliging , placid look , and appear quite satisfied with the curtailed license of devoting [herself]105-mrs clay only half as much to [Sir Walter]90-sir walter as [she]105-mrs clay would have done otherwise .

To [Anne]93-anne [herself]93-anne it was most distressing to see [Mr Elliot]102-mr elliot enter [the room]406-the room ; and quite painful to have [him]102-mr elliot approach and speak to [her]93-anne . [She]93-anne had been used before to feel that [he]102-mr elliot could not be always quite sincere , but now [she]93-anne saw insincerity in everything . [His]102-mr elliot attentive deference to [[her]93-anne father]274-her father , contrasted with [his]102-mr elliot former language , was odious ; and when [she]93-anne thought of [his]102-mr elliot cruel conduct towards [Mrs Smith]182-mrs smith , [she]93-anne could hardly bear the sight of [his]102-mr elliot present smiles and mildness , or the sound of [his]102-mr elliot artificial good sentiments .

[She]93-anne meant to avoid any such alteration of manners as might provoke a remonstrance on [his]102-mr elliot side . It was a great object to [her]93-anne to escape all enquiry or eclat ; but it was [her]93-anne intention to be as decidedly cool to [him]102-mr elliot as might be compatible with [their]1959-their relationship ; and to retrace , as quietly as [she]93-anne could , the few steps of unnecessary intimacy [she]93-anne had been gradually led along . [She]93-anne was accordingly more guarded , and more cool , than [she]93-anne had been the night before .

[He]102-mr elliot wanted to animate [her]93-anne curiosity again as to how and where [he]102-mr elliot could have heard [her]93-anne formerly praised ; wanted very much to be gratified by more solicitation ; but the charm was broken : [he]102-mr elliot found that the heat and animation of [a public room]1960-a public room was necessary to kindle [[his]102-mr elliot modest cousin]1961-his modest cousin 's vanity ; [he]102-mr elliot found , at least , that it was not to be done now , by any of those attempts which [he]102-mr elliot could hazard among the too - commanding claims of [the others]359-the others . [He]102-mr elliot little surmised that it was a subject acting now exactly against [his]102-mr elliot interest , bringing immediately to [her]93-anne thoughts all those parts of [his]102-mr elliot conduct which were least excusable .

[She]93-anne had some satisfaction in finding that [he]102-mr elliot was really going out of [Bath]10-bath the next morning , going early , and that [he]102-mr elliot would be gone the greater part of two days . [He]102-mr elliot was invited again to [Camden Place]60-camden place the very evening of [his]102-mr elliot return ; but from Thursday to Saturday evening [his]102-mr elliot absence was certain . It was bad enough that [a Mrs Clay]1963-a mrs clay should be always before [her]93-anne ; but that [a deeper hypocrite]1964-a deeper hypocrite should be added to [[their]1965-their party]1270-their party , seemed the destruction of everything like peace and comfort . It was so humiliating to reflect on the constant deception practised on [[her]93-anne father]274-her father and [Elizabeth]91-elizabeth ; to consider the various sources of mortification preparing for [them]1965-their ! [Mrs Clay]105-mrs clay 's selfishness was not so complicate nor so revolting as [his]102-mr elliot ; and [Anne]93-anne would have compounded for the marriage at once , with all its evils , to be clear of [Mr Elliot]102-mr elliot 's subtleties in endeavouring to prevent it .

On Friday morning [she]105-mrs clay meant to go very early to [Lady Russell]101-lady russell , and accomplish the necessary communication ; and [she]105-mrs clay would have gone directly after breakfast , but that [Mrs Clay]105-mrs clay was also going out on some obliging purpose of saving [[her]105-mrs clay sister]476-her sister trouble , which determined [her]105-mrs clay to wait till [she]105-mrs clay might be safe from [such a companion]1969-such a companion . [She]91-elizabeth saw [Mrs Clay]105-mrs clay fairly off , therefore , before [she]105-mrs clay began to talk of spending the morning in [Rivers Street]62-rivers street .

" Very well , "[91-elizabeth] said [Elizabeth]91-elizabeth , " [I]91-elizabeth have nothing to send but [[my]91-elizabeth love]2445-my love . Oh ! [you]3309-you may as well take back that tiresome book [she]101-lady russell would lend [me]91-elizabeth , and pretend [I]91-elizabeth have read it through . [I]91-elizabeth really can not be plaguing [myself]91-elizabeth for ever with all the new poems and states of [the nation]453-the nation that come out . [Lady Russell]101-lady russell quite bores one with [her]101-lady russell new publications . [You]3309-you need not tell [her]101-lady russell so , but [I]91-elizabeth thought [her]101-lady russell dress hideous the other night . [I]91-elizabeth used to think [she]101-lady russell had some taste in dress , but [I]91-elizabeth was ashamed of [her]101-lady russell at the concert . Something so formal and _ arrang _ in [her]101-lady russell air ! and [she]101-lady russell sits so upright ! [[My]91-elizabeth best love]3311-my best love , of course . "[91-elizabeth]

" And [mine]90-sir walter , "[90-sir walter] added [Sir Walter]90-sir walter . " Kindest regards . And [you]3309-you may say , that [I]90-sir walter mean to call upon [her]101-lady russell soon . Make a civil message ; but [I]90-sir walter shall only leave [my]90-sir walter card . Morning visits are never fair by [women]2486-women at [her]101-lady russell time of life , who make [themselves]2486-women up so little . If [she]101-lady russell would only wear rouge [she]101-lady russell would not be afraid of being seen ; but last time [I]90-sir walter called , [I]90-sir walter observed the blinds were let down immediately . "[90-sir walter]

While [[her]1970-her father]274-her father spoke , there was a knock at the door . Who could it be ? [Anne]93-anne , remembering the preconcerted visits , at all hours , of [Mr Elliot]102-mr elliot , would have expected [him]102-mr elliot , but for [his]102-mr elliot known engagement seven miles off . After the usual period of suspense , the usual sounds of approach were heard , and " [Mr]3313-mr and [Mrs Charles Musgrove]96-charles "[1973-their] were ushered into [the room]406-the room .

Surprise was the strongest emotion raised by [their]1973-their appearance ; but [Anne]93-anne was really glad to see [them]1973-their ; and [the others]359-the others were not so sorry but that [they]359-the others could put on a decent air of welcome ; and as soon as it became clear that these , [[their]1973-their nearest relations]1975-their nearest relations , were not arrived with any views of accommodation in [that house]445-that house , [Sir Walter]90-sir walter and [Elizabeth]91-elizabeth were able to rise in cordiality , and do the honours of it very well . [They]1973-their were come to [Bath]10-bath for a few days with [Mrs Musgrove]96-charles , and were at [the White Hart]84-the white hart . So much was pretty soon understood ; but till [Sir Walter]90-sir walter and [Elizabeth]91-elizabeth were walking [Mary]94-mary into [the other drawing - room]1977-the other drawing - room , and regaling [themselves]1973-their with [her]94-mary admiration , [Anne]93-anne could not draw upon [Charles]96-charles 's brain for a regular history of [their]1973-their coming , or an explanation of some smiling hints of particular business , which had been ostentatiously dropped by [Mary]94-mary , as well as of some apparent confusion as to whom [their]1973-their party consisted of .

[She]93-anne then found that it consisted of [Mrs Musgrove]96-charles , [Henrietta]123-henrietta , and [Captain Harville]153-captain harville , beside [[their]1973-their two selves]1978-their two selves . [He]153-captain harville gave [her]93-anne a very plain , intelligible account of the whole ; a narration in which [she]93-anne saw a great deal of most characteristic proceeding . The scheme had received its first impulse by [Captain Harville]153-captain harville 's wanting to come to [Bath]10-bath on business . [He]153-captain harville had begun to talk of it a week ago ; and by way of doing something , as shooting was over , [Charles]96-charles had proposed coming with [him]153-captain harville , and [Mrs Harville]140-mrs harville had seemed to like the idea of it very much , as an advantage to [[her]140-mrs harville husband]2315-her husband ; but [Mary]94-mary could not bear to be left , and had made [herself]94-mary so unhappy about it , that for a day or two everything seemed to be in suspense , or at an end . But then , it had been taken up by [[his]153-captain harville father]2282-his father and [mother]473-mother . [[His]153-captain harville mother]1982-his mother had [some old friends in [Bath]10-bath whom [she]1982-his mother wanted to see]1983-some old friends in bath whom she wanted to see ; it was thought a good opportunity for [Henrietta]123-henrietta to come and buy wedding - clothes for [herself]1982-his mother and [[her]1982-his mother sister]476-her sister ; and , in short , it ended in being [[his]153-captain harville mother]1982-his mother 's party , that everything might be comfortable and easy to [Captain Harville]153-captain harville ; and [he]153-captain harville and [Mary]94-mary were included in it by way of general convenience . [They]1986-they had arrived late the night before . [Mrs Harville]140-mrs harville , [[her]140-mrs harville children]239-her children , and [Captain Benwick]155-captain benwick , remained with [Mr Musgrove]120-mrs musgrove and [Louisa]124-louisa at [Uppercross]4-uppercross .

[Anne]93-anne 's only surprise was , that affairs should be in forwardness enough for [Henrietta]123-henrietta 's wedding - clothes to be talked of . [She]93-anne had imagined such difficulties of fortune to exist there as must prevent the marriage from being near at hand ; but [she]93-anne learned from [Charles]96-charles that , very recently , ( since [Mary]94-mary 's last letter to [herself]94-mary ) , [Charles Hayter]95-charles had been applied to by [a friend]1363-a friend to hold a living for [a youth who could not possibly claim it under many years]1989-a youth who could not possibly claim it under many years ; and that on the strength of [his]95-charles present income , with almost a certainty of something more permanent long before the term in question , [the two families]565-the two families had consented to [the young people]585-the young people 's wishes , and that [their]565-the two families marriage was likely to take place in a few months , quite as soon as [Louisa]124-louisa 's . " And a very good living it was , "[95-charles] [Charles]95-charles added : " only five - and - twenty miles from [Uppercross]4-uppercross , and in [a very fine country]3314-a very fine country : [fine part of [Dorsetshire]85-dorsetshire]3315-fine part of dorsetshire . In the centre of [some of the best preserves in [the kingdom]3317-the kingdom]3316-some of the best preserves in the kingdom , surrounded by [three great proprietors]3318-three great proprietors , [each more careful and jealous than the other]3319-each more careful and jealous than the other ; and to two of the three at least , [Charles Hayter]95-charles might get a special recommendation . Not that [he]95-charles will value it as [he]95-charles ought , "[95-charles] [he]95-charles observed , " [Charles]95-charles is too cool about sporting . That 's the worst of [him]95-charles . "[95-charles]

" [I]93-anne am extremely glad , indeed , "[93-anne] cried [Anne]93-anne , " particularly glad that this should happen ; and that of [two sisters , who both deserve equally well , and who have always been such good friends]3320-two sisters , who both deserve equally well , and who have always been such good friends , the pleasant prospect of one should not be dimming those of [the other]254-the other -- that [they]3320-two sisters , who both deserve equally well , and who have always been such good friends should be so equal in [their]3320-two sisters , who both deserve equally well , and who have always been such good friends prosperity and comfort . [I]93-anne hope [[your]93-anne father]2212-your father and [mother]473-mother are quite happy with regard to both . "[93-anne]

" Oh ! yes . [[My]95-charles father]2247-my father would be well pleased if [the gentlemen]516-the gentlemen were richer , but [he]2247-my father has no other fault to find . Money , [you]93-anne know , coming down with money -- [two daughters]3326-two daughters at once -- it can not be a very agreeable operation , and it streightens [him]2247-my father as to many things . However , [I]95-charles do not mean to say [they]3320-two sisters , who both deserve equally well , and who have always been such good friends have not a right to it . It is very fit [they]3320-two sisters , who both deserve equally well , and who have always been such good friends should have [daughters]3327-daughters ' shares ; and [I]95-charles am sure [he]2247-my father has always been [a very kind , liberal father to [me]95-charles]3328-a very kind , liberal father to me . [Mary]94-mary does not above half like [Henrietta]123-henrietta 's match . [She]94-mary never did , [you]93-anne know . But [she]94-mary does not do [him]2247-my father justice , nor think enough about [Winthrop]44-winthrop . [I]95-charles can not make [her]94-mary attend to the value of [the property]3329-the property . It is a very fair match , as times go ; and [I]95-charles have liked [Charles Hayter]95-charles all [my]95-charles life , and [I]95-charles shall not leave off now . "[95-charles]

" [Such excellent parents as [Mr]3331-mr and [Mrs Musgrove]96-charles]3330-such excellent parents as mr and mrs musgrove , "[93-anne] exclaimed [Anne]93-anne , " should be happy in [[their]3330-such excellent parents as mr and mrs musgrove children]588-their children 's marriages . [They]3330-such excellent parents as mr and mrs musgrove do everything to confer happiness , [I]93-anne am sure . What a blessing to [young people]3333-young people to be in such hands ! [[Your]93-anne father]2212-your father and [mother]473-mother seem so totally free from all those ambitious feelings which have led to so much misconduct and misery , both in young and old . [I]93-anne hope [you]93-anne think [Louisa]124-louisa perfectly recovered now ? "[93-anne]

[He]1992-i answered rather hesitatingly , " Yes , [I]1992-i believe [I]1992-i do ; very much recovered ; but [she]124-louisa is altered ; there is no running or jumping about , no laughing or dancing ; it is quite different . If [one]252-one happens only to shut the door a little hard , [she]124-louisa starts and wriggles like a young dab - chick in the water ; and [Benwick]155-captain benwick sits at [her]124-louisa elbow , reading verses , or whispering to [her]124-louisa , all day long . "[1992-i]

[Anne]93-anne could not help laughing . " That can not be much to [your]1992-i taste , [I]93-anne know , "[93-anne] said [she]93-anne ; " but [I]93-anne do believe [him]155-captain benwick to be [an excellent young man]1136-an excellent young man . "[93-anne]

" To be sure [he]155-captain benwick is . [Nobody]2242-nobody doubts it ; and [I]1992-i hope [you]1992-i do not think [I]1992-i am so illiberal as to want [every man]3136-every man to have the same objects and pleasures as [myself]1992-i . [I]1992-i have a great value for [Benwick]155-captain benwick ; and when one can but get [him]155-captain benwick to talk , [he]155-captain benwick has plenty to say . [His]155-captain benwick reading has done [him]155-captain benwick no harm , for [he]155-captain benwick has fought as well as read . [He]155-captain benwick is [a brave fellow]3340-a brave fellow . [I]1992-i got more acquainted with [him]155-captain benwick last Monday than ever [I]1992-i did before . [We]1993-they had a famous set - to at rat - hunting all the morning in [[[my]1992-i father]2247-my father 's great barns]3342-my father 's great barns ; and [he]155-captain benwick played [his]155-captain benwick part so well that [I]1992-i have liked [him]155-captain benwick the better ever since . "[1992-i]

Here [they]1993-they were interrupted by the absolute necessity of [Charles]95-charles 's following [the others]359-the others to admire mirrors and china ; but [Anne]93-anne had heard enough to understand the present state of [Uppercross]4-uppercross , and rejoice in its happiness ; and though [she]93-anne sighed as [she]93-anne rejoiced , [her]93-anne sigh had none of the ill - will of envy in it . [She]93-anne would certainly have risen to [their]1993-they blessings if [she]93-anne could , but [she]93-anne did not want to lessen [theirs]1993-they .

The visit passed off altogether in high good humour . [Mary]94-mary was in excellent spirits , enjoying the gaiety and the change , and so well satisfied with the journey in [[her]94-mary mother - in - law]1995-her mother - in - law 's carriage with four horses , and with [her]94-mary own complete independence of [Camden Place]60-camden place , that [she]94-mary was exactly in a temper to admire everything as [she]94-mary ought , and enter most readily into all the superiorities of [the house]310-the house , as [they]1993-they were detailed to [her]94-mary . [She]94-mary had no demands on [[her]94-mary father]274-her father or [sister]268-sister , and [her]94-mary consequence was just enough increased by [[their]1993-they handsome drawing - rooms]1999-their handsome drawing - rooms .

[Elizabeth]91-elizabeth was , for a short time , suffering a good deal . [She]91-elizabeth felt that [Mrs Musgrove]96-charles and [all [her]91-elizabeth party]2000-all her party ought to be asked to dine with [them]1993-they ; but [she]91-elizabeth could not bear to have the difference of style , the reduction of [servants]2224-servants , which a dinner must betray , witnessed by [those who had been always so inferior to [the Elliots of [Kellynch]6-kellynch]2003-the elliots of kellynch]2002-those who had been always so inferior to the elliots of kellynch . It was a struggle between propriety and vanity ; but vanity got the better , and then [Elizabeth]91-elizabeth was happy again . These were [her]91-elizabeth internal persuasions : " Old fashioned notions ; country hospitality ; [we]3343-we do not profess to give dinners ; [few people in Bath]3344-few people in bath do ; [Lady Alicia]196-lady alicia never does ; did not even ask [[[her]196-lady alicia own sister]509-her own sister 's family]3346-her own sister 's family , though [they]1993-they were here a month : and [I]91-elizabeth dare say it would be very inconvenient to [Mrs Musgrove]96-charles ; put [her]96-charles quite out of [her]96-charles way . [I]91-elizabeth am sure [she]96-charles would rather not come ; [she]96-charles can not feel easy with [us]3343-we . [I]91-elizabeth will ask [them]1993-they all for an evening ; that will be much better ; that will be a novelty and a treat . [They]1993-they have not seen [two such drawing rooms]3347-two such drawing rooms before . [They]1993-they will be delighted to come to - morrow evening . It shall be a regular party , small , but most elegant . "[91-elizabeth] And this satisfied [Elizabeth]91-elizabeth : and when the invitation was given to [the two present]2004-the two present , and promised for the absent , [Mary]94-mary was as completely satisfied . [She]94-mary was particularly asked to meet [Mr Elliot]102-mr elliot , and be introduced to [Lady Dalrymple]180-lady dalrymple and [Miss Carteret]177-miss carteret , who were fortunately already engaged to come ; and [she]94-mary could not have received a more gratifying attention . [Miss Elliot]93-anne was to have the honour of calling on [Mrs Musgrove]96-charles in the course of the morning ; and [Anne]93-anne walked off with [Charles]96-charles and [Mary]94-mary , to go and see [her]94-mary and [Henrietta]123-henrietta directly .

[Her]93-anne plan of sitting with [Lady Russell]101-lady russell must give way for the present . [They]2005-they all three called in [Rivers Street]62-rivers street for a couple of minutes ; but [Anne]93-anne convinced [herself]93-anne that a day 's delay of the intended communication could be of no consequence , and hastened forward to [the White Hart]84-the white hart , to see again [the friends]2006-the friends and [companions of the last autumn]2007-companions of the last autumn , with an eagerness of good - will which many associations contributed to form .

[They]2005-they found [Mrs Musgrove]96-charles and [[her]96-charles daughter]1625-her daughter within , and by [themselves]2005-they , and [Anne]93-anne had the kindest welcome from each . [Henrietta]123-henrietta was exactly in that state of recently - improved views , of fresh - formed happiness , which made [her]123-henrietta full of regard and interest for [[everybody]651-everybody [she]123-henrietta had ever liked before at all]2010-everybody she had ever liked before at all ; and [Mrs Musgrove]96-charles 's real affection had been won by [her]123-henrietta usefulness when [they]2005-they were in distress . It was a heartiness , and a warmth , and a sincerity which [Anne]93-anne delighted in the more , from the sad want of such blessings at [home]285-home . [She]123-henrietta was entreated to give [them]2005-they as much of [her]123-henrietta time as possible , invited for every day and all day long , or rather claimed as part of [the family]312-the family ; and , in return , [she]123-henrietta naturally fell into all [her]123-henrietta wonted ways of attention and assistance , and on [Charles]96-charles 's leaving [them]2005-they together , was listening to [Mrs Musgrove]96-charles 's history of [Louisa]124-louisa , and to [Henrietta]123-henrietta 's of [herself]123-henrietta , giving opinions on business , and recommendations to [shops]2013-shops ; with intervals of every help which [Mary]94-mary required , from altering [her]94-mary ribbon to settling [her]94-mary accounts ; from finding [her]94-mary keys , and assorting [her]94-mary trinkets , to trying to convince [her]94-mary that [she]94-mary was not ill - used by [anybody]2413-anybody ; which [Mary]94-mary , well amused as [she]94-mary generally was , in [her]94-mary station at a window overlooking the entrance to [the Pump Room]2015-the pump room , could not but have [her]94-mary moments of imagining .

A morning of thorough confusion was to be expected . A large party in [an hotel]2016-an hotel ensured a quick - changing , unsettled scene . One five minutes brought a note , the next a parcel ; and [Anne]93-anne had not been [there]377-there half an hour , when [[their]2018-their dining - room]1225-their dining - room , spacious as [it]1225-their dining - room was , seemed more than half filled : [a party of [steady old friends]2021-steady old friends]2020-a party of steady old friends were seated around [Mrs Musgrove]96-charles , and [Charles]96-charles came back with [Captains Harville]212-captains harville and [Wentworth]115-mr wentworth . The appearance of [the latter]834-the latter could not be more than the surprise of the moment . It was impossible for [her]93-anne to have forgotten to feel that this arrival of [[their]2018-their common friends]2023-their common friends must be soon bringing [them]2018-their together again . [Their]2018-their last meeting had been most important in opening [his]2024-his feelings ; [she]93-anne had derived from it a delightful conviction ; but [she]93-anne feared from [his]2024-his looks , that the same unfortunate persuasion , which had hastened [him]2024-his away from [the Concert Room]1868-the concert room , still governed . [He]2024-his did not seem to want to be near enough for conversation .

[She]93-anne tried to be calm , and leave things to take their course , and tried to dwell much on this argument of rational dependence:--"Surely , if there be constant attachment on each side , [our]2018-their hearts must understand each other ere long . [We]2018-their are not [boy]3348-boy and [girl]3349-girl , to be captiously irritable , misled by every moment 's inadvertence , and wantonly playing with [our]2018-their own happiness . "[93-anne] And yet , a few minutes afterwards , [she]93-anne felt as if [their]2018-their being in company with [each other]489-each other , under [their]2018-their present circumstances , could only be exposing [them]2018-their to inadvertencies and misconstructions of the most mischievous kind .

" [Anne]93-anne , "[94-mary] cried [Mary]94-mary , still at [her]94-mary window , " there is [Mrs Clay]105-mrs clay , [I]94-mary am sure , standing under the colonnade , and [a gentleman with [her]105-mrs clay]3350-a gentleman with her . [I]94-mary saw [them]2018-their turn the corner from [Bath Street]87-bath street just now . [They]2018-their seemed deep in talk . Who is it ? Come , and tell [me]94-mary . Good heavens ! [I]94-mary recollect . It is [Mr Elliot]102-mr elliot [himself]102-mr elliot . "[94-mary]

" No , "[93-anne] cried [Anne]93-anne , quickly , " it can not be [Mr Elliot]102-mr elliot , [I]93-anne assure [you]94-mary . [He]102-mr elliot was to leave [Bath]10-bath at nine this morning , and does not come back till to - morrow . "[93-anne]

As [she]93-anne spoke , [she]93-anne felt that [Captain Wentworth]117-captain wentworth was looking at [her]93-anne , the consciousness of which vexed and embarrassed [her]93-anne , and made [her]93-anne regret that [she]93-anne had said so much , simple as it was .

[Mary]94-mary , resenting that [she]94-mary should be supposed not to know [[her]94-mary own cousin]2027-her own cousin , began talking very warmly about [the family features]2028-the family features , and protesting still more positively that it was [Mr Elliot]102-mr elliot , calling again upon [Anne]93-anne to come and look for [herself]93-anne , but [Anne]93-anne did not mean to stir , and tried to be cool and unconcerned . [Her]93-anne distress returned , however , on perceiving smiles and intelligent glances pass between [two or three of [the lady visitors]2030-the lady visitors]2029-two or three of the lady visitors , as if [they]2029-two or three of the lady visitors believed [themselves]2029-two or three of the lady visitors quite in the secret . It was evident that the report concerning [her]93-anne had spread , and a short pause succeeded , which seemed to ensure that it would now spread farther .

" Do come , [Anne]93-anne , "[94-mary] cried [Mary]94-mary , " come and look [yourself]93-anne . [You]93-anne will be too late if [you]93-anne do not make haste . [They]2029-two or three of the lady visitors are parting ; [they]2029-two or three of the lady visitors are shaking hands . [He]102-mr elliot is turning away . Not know [Mr Elliot]102-mr elliot , indeed ! [You]93-anne seem to have forgot all about [Lyme]48-lyme . "[94-mary]

To pacify [Mary]94-mary , and perhaps screen [her]93-anne own embarrassment , [Anne]93-anne did move quietly to the window . [She]93-anne was just in time to ascertain that it really was [Mr Elliot]102-mr elliot , which [she]93-anne had never believed , before [he]102-mr elliot disappeared on one side , as [Mrs Clay]105-mrs clay walked quickly off on the other ; and checking the surprise which [she]93-anne could not but feel at such an appearance of friendly conference between [two persons of totally opposite interest]2031-two persons of totally opposite interest , [she]93-anne calmly said , " Yes , it is [Mr Elliot]102-mr elliot , certainly . [He]102-mr elliot has changed [his]102-mr elliot hour of going , [I]93-anne suppose , that is all , or [I]93-anne may be mistaken , [I]93-anne might not attend ; "[93-anne] and walked back to [her]93-anne chair , recomposed , and with the comfortable hope of having acquitted [herself]93-anne well .

[The visitors]2032-the visitors took [their]2032-the visitors leave ; and [Charles]96-charles , having civilly seen [them]2032-the visitors off , and then made a face at [them]2032-the visitors , and abused [them]2032-the visitors for coming , began with--

" Well , [mother]473-mother , [I]2032-the visitors have done something for [you]473-mother that [you]473-mother will like . [Mrs Musgrove]96-charles was good humouredly beginning to express [her]96-charles perfect readiness for the play , if [Henrietta]123-henrietta and all [the others]359-the others liked it , when [Mary]94-mary eagerly interrupted [her]96-charles by exclaiming--

" Good heavens , [Charles]96-charles ! how can [you]96-charles think of such a thing ? Take a box for to - morrow night ! Have [you]96-charles forgot that [we]3354-we are engaged to [Camden Place]60-camden place to - morrow night ? and that [we]3354-we were most particularly asked to meet [Lady Dalrymple]180-lady dalrymple and [[her]180-lady dalrymple daughter]1625-her daughter , and [Mr Elliot]102-mr elliot , and [all the principal family connexions]3357-all the principal family connexions , on purpose to be introduced to [them]3357-all the principal family connexions ? " [Phoo]214-phoo ! phoo ! "[96-charles] replied [Charles]96-charles , " what 's an evening party ? Never worth remembering . [[Your]96-charles father]2212-your father might have asked [us]3354-we to dinner , [I]96-charles think , if [he]2212-your father had wanted to see [us]3354-we . [You]96-charles may do as [you]96-charles like , but [I]96-charles shall go to the play . "[96-charles]

" Oh ! [Charles]96-charles , [I]96-charles declare it will be too abominable if [you]96-charles do , when [you]96-charles promised to go . "[96-charles]

" No , [I]96-charles did not promise . [I]96-charles only smirked and bowed , and said the word ' happy . ' There was no promise . "[96-charles]

" But [you]96-charles must go , [Charles]96-charles . It would be unpardonable to fail . [We]3354-we were asked on purpose to be introduced . There was always such a great connexion between [the Dalrymples]178-the dalrymples and [ourselves]3354-we . Nothing ever happened on either side that was not announced immediately . [We]3354-we are quite near relations , [you]96-charles know ; and [Mr Elliot]102-mr elliot too , whom [you]96-charles ought so particularly to be acquainted with ! "[96-charles]

" Do n't talk to [me]96-charles about [heirs]3363-heirs and [representatives]3364-representatives , "[96-charles] cried [Charles]96-charles . " [I]96-charles am [not one of those who neglect the reigning power to bow to the rising sun .
