"[96-charles] The careless expression was life to [Anne]93-anne , who saw that [Captain Wentworth]117-captain wentworth was all attention , looking and listening with [his]117-captain wentworth whole soul ; and that the last words brought [his]117-captain wentworth enquiring eyes from [Charles]96-charles to [herself]96-charles .

[Charles]96-charles and [Mary]94-mary still talked on in the same style ; [he]117-captain wentworth , half serious and half jesting , maintaining the scheme for the play , and [she]96-charles , invariably serious , most warmly opposing it , and not omitting to make it known that , however determined to go to [Camden Place]60-camden place [herself]96-charles , [she]96-charles should not think [herself]96-charles very well used , if [they]2034-we went to the play without [her]96-charles . [Mrs Musgrove]96-charles interposed .

" [We]2034-we had better put it off . [Charles]96-charles , [you]96-charles had much better go back and change the box for Tuesday . It would be a pity to be divided , and [we]2034-we should be losing [Miss Anne]93-anne , too , if there is a party at [[her]93-anne father]274-her father 's ; and [I]96-charles am sure neither [Henrietta]123-henrietta nor [I]96-charles should care at all for the play , if [Miss Anne]93-anne could not be with [us]2034-we . "[96-charles]

[Anne]93-anne felt truly obliged to [her]96-charles for such kindness ; and quite as much so for the opportunity it gave [her]93-anne of decidedly saying--

" If it depended only on [my]93-anne inclination , [ma'am]2584-ma'am , the party at [home]285-home ( excepting on [Mary]94-mary 's account ) would not be the smallest impediment . [I]93-anne have no pleasure in the sort of meeting , and should be too happy to change it for a play , and with [you]93-anne . But , it had better not be attempted , perhaps . "[93-anne] [She]93-anne had spoken it ; but [she]93-anne trembled when it was done , conscious that [her]93-anne words were listened to , and daring not even to try to observe their effect .

It was soon generally agreed that Tuesday should be the day ; [Charles]96-charles only reserving the advantage of still teasing [[his]2035-his wife]222-his wife , by persisting that [he]2035-his would go to the play to - morrow if [nobody else]358-nobody else would .

[Captain Wentworth]117-captain wentworth left [his]117-captain wentworth seat , and walked to [the fire - place]2038-the fire - place ; probably for the sake of walking away from [it]2038-the fire - place soon afterwards , and taking [a station]2039-a station , with less bare - faced design , by [Anne]93-anne .

" [You]93-anne have not been long enough in [Bath]10-bath , "[117-captain wentworth] said [he]117-captain wentworth , " to enjoy the evening parties of [the place]418-the place . "[117-captain wentworth]

" Oh ! no . The usual character of [them]3372-them has nothing for [me]117-captain wentworth . [I]117-captain wentworth am [no card - player]3373-no card - player . "[117-captain wentworth]

" [You]93-anne were not formerly , [I]117-captain wentworth know . [You]93-anne did not use to like cards ; but time makes many changes . "[117-captain wentworth]

" [I]93-anne am not yet so much changed , "[93-anne] cried [Anne]93-anne , and stopped , fearing [she]93-anne hardly knew what misconstruction . After waiting a few moments [he]117-captain wentworth said , and as if it were the result of immediate feeling , " It is a period , indeed ! Eight years and a half is a period . "[117-captain wentworth]

Whether [he]117-captain wentworth would have proceeded farther was left to [Anne]93-anne 's imagination to ponder over in a calmer hour ; for while still hearing the sounds [he]117-captain wentworth had uttered , [she]93-anne was startled to other subjects by [Henrietta]123-henrietta , eager to make use of the present leisure for getting out , and calling on [[her]123-henrietta companions]1056-her companions to lose no time , lest [somebody else]3056-somebody else should come in .

[They]1056-her companions were obliged to move . [Anne]93-anne talked of being perfectly ready , and tried to look it ; but [she]93-anne felt that could [Henrietta]123-henrietta have known the regret and reluctance of [her]123-henrietta heart in quitting that chair , in preparing to quit [the room]406-the room , [she]93-anne would have found , in all [her]93-anne own sensations for [[her]93-anne cousin]2558-her cousin , in the very security of [his]117-captain wentworth affection , wherewith to pity [her]93-anne .

[Their]1056-her companions preparations , however , were stopped short . Alarming sounds were heard ; [other visitors]2044-other visitors approached , and the door was thrown open for [Sir Walter]90-sir walter and [Miss Elliot]93-anne , whose entrance seemed to give a general chill . [Anne]93-anne felt an instant oppression , and wherever [she]93-anne looked saw symptoms of the same . The comfort , the freedom , the gaiety of [the room]406-the room was over , hushed into cold composure , determined silence , or insipid talk , to meet the heartless elegance of [[her]93-anne father]274-her father and [sister]268-sister . How mortifying to feel that it was so !

[Her]93-anne jealous eye was satisfied in one particular . [Captain Wentworth]117-captain wentworth was acknowledged again by [each]3299-each , by [Elizabeth]91-elizabeth more graciously than before . [She]91-elizabeth even addressed [him]117-captain wentworth once , and looked at [him]117-captain wentworth more than once . [Elizabeth]91-elizabeth was , in fact , revolving a great measure . [The sequel]2049-the sequel explained it . After the waste of a few minutes in saying the proper nothings , [she]91-elizabeth began to give the invitation which was to comprise all the remaining dues of [the Musgroves]121-the miss musgroves . " To - morrow evening , to meet [a few friends]3374-a few friends : no formal party . "[91-elizabeth] It was all said very gracefully , and the cards with which [she]91-elizabeth had provided [herself]91-elizabeth , the " [Miss Elliot]93-anne at [home]285-home , "[91-elizabeth] were laid on the table , with a courteous , comprehensive smile to all , and one smile and one card more decidedly for [Captain Wentworth]117-captain wentworth . The truth was , that [Elizabeth]91-elizabeth had been long enough in [Bath]10-bath to understand the importance of [a man of such an air and appearance]2050-a man of such an air and appearance as [his]117-captain wentworth . The past was nothing . The present was that [Captain Wentworth]117-captain wentworth would move about well in [[her]91-elizabeth drawing - room]2051-her drawing - room . The card was pointedly given , and [Sir Walter]90-sir walter and [Elizabeth]91-elizabeth arose and disappeared .

The interruption had been short , though severe , and ease and animation returned to most of those [they]2052-they left as the door shut [them]2052-they out , but not to [Anne]93-anne . [She]93-anne could think only of the invitation [she]93-anne had with such astonishment witnessed , and of the manner in which it had been received ; a manner of doubtful meaning , of surprise rather than gratification , of polite acknowledgement rather than acceptance . [She]93-anne knew [him]117-captain wentworth ; [she]93-anne saw disdain in [his]117-captain wentworth eye , and could not venture to believe that [he]117-captain wentworth had determined to accept such an offering , as an atonement for all the insolence of the past . [Her]93-anne spirits sank . [He]117-captain wentworth held the card in [his]117-captain wentworth hand after [they]2052-they were gone , as if deeply considering it .

" Only think of [Elizabeth]91-elizabeth 's including [everybody]651-everybody ! "[94-mary] whispered [Mary]94-mary very audibly . " [I]94-mary do not wonder [Captain Wentworth]117-captain wentworth is delighted ! [You]93-anne see [he]117-captain wentworth can not put the card out of [his]117-captain wentworth hand . "[94-mary]

[Anne]93-anne caught [his]117-captain wentworth eye , saw [his]117-captain wentworth cheeks glow , and [his]117-captain wentworth mouth form itself into a momentary expression of contempt , and turned away , that [she]93-anne might neither see nor hear more to vex [her]93-anne .

[The party]542-the party separated . [The gentlemen]516-the gentlemen had [their]516-the gentlemen own pursuits , [the ladies]1179-the ladies proceeded on [their]1179-the ladies own business , and [they]1179-the ladies met no more while [Anne]93-anne belonged to [them]1179-the ladies . [She]93-anne was earnestly begged to return and dine , and give [them]1179-the ladies all the rest of the day , but [her]93-anne spirits had been so long exerted that at present [she]93-anne felt unequal to more , and fit only for [home]285-home , where [she]93-anne might be sure of being as silent as [she]93-anne chose .

Promising to be with [them]1179-the ladies the whole of the following morning , therefore , [she]93-anne closed the fatigues of the present by a toilsome walk to [Camden Place]60-camden place , there to spend the evening chiefly in listening to the busy arrangements of [Elizabeth]91-elizabeth and [Mrs Clay]105-mrs clay for the morrow 's party , the frequent enumeration of [the persons invited]2057-the persons invited , and the continually improving detail of all the embellishments which were to make it the most completely elegant of [its]2058-its kind in [Bath]10-bath , while harassing [herself]93-anne with the never - ending question , of whether [Captain Wentworth]117-captain wentworth would come or not ? [They]1179-the ladies were reckoning [him]117-captain wentworth as certain , but with [her]93-anne it was a gnawing solicitude never appeased for five minutes together . [She]93-anne generally thought [he]117-captain wentworth would come , because [she]93-anne generally thought [he]117-captain wentworth ought ; but it was a case which [she]93-anne could not so shape into any positive act of duty or discretion , as inevitably to defy the suggestions of very opposite feelings .

[She]93-anne only roused [herself]93-anne from the broodings of this restless agitation , to let [Mrs Clay]105-mrs clay know that [she]93-anne had been seen with [Mr Elliot]102-mr elliot three hours after [his]117-captain wentworth being supposed to be out of [Bath]10-bath , for having watched in vain for some intimation of the interview from [the lady]1007-the lady [herself]1007-the lady , [she]93-anne determined to mention it , and it seemed to [her]93-anne there was guilt in [Mrs Clay]105-mrs clay 's face as [she]93-anne listened . It was transient : cleared away in an instant ; but [Anne]93-anne could imagine [she]93-anne read there the consciousness of having , by some complication of mutual trick , or some overbearing authority of [his]117-captain wentworth , been obliged to attend ( perhaps for half an hour ) to [his]117-captain wentworth lectures and restrictions on [her]1007-the lady designs on [Sir Walter]90-sir walter . [She]93-anne exclaimed , however , with a very tolerable imitation of nature:--

" Oh ! dear ! very true . Only think , [Miss Elliot]93-anne , to [my]93-anne great surprise [I]93-anne met with [Mr Elliot]102-mr elliot in [Bath Street]87-bath street . [I]93-anne was never more astonished . [He]102-mr elliot turned back and walked with [me]93-anne to [the Pump Yard]3377-the pump yard . [He]102-mr elliot had been prevented setting off for [Thornberry]215-thornberry , but [I]93-anne really forget by what ; for [I]93-anne was in a hurry , and could not much attend , and [I]93-anne can only answer for [his]102-mr elliot being determined not to be delayed in [his]102-mr elliot return . [He]102-mr elliot wanted to know how early [he]102-mr elliot might be admitted to - morrow . [He]102-mr elliot was full of ' to - morrow , ' and it is very evident that [I]93-anne have been full of it too , ever since [I]93-anne entered [the house]310-the house , and learnt the extension of [your]3379-your plan and all that had happened , or [my]93-anne seeing [him]102-mr elliot could never have gone so entirely out of [my]93-anne head . "[93-anne]

Chapter 23

One day only had passed since [Anne]93-anne 's conversation with [Mrs Smith]182-mrs smith ; but a keener interest had succeeded , and [she]93-anne was now so little touched by [Mr Elliot]102-mr elliot 's conduct , except by its effects in one quarter , that it became a matter of course the next morning , still to defer [her]93-anne explanatory visit in [Rivers Street]62-rivers street . [She]93-anne had promised to be with [the Musgroves]121-the miss musgroves from breakfast to dinner . [Her]93-anne faith was plighted , and [Mr Elliot]102-mr elliot 's character , like [the Sultaness Scheherazade]216-the sultaness scheherazade 's head , must live another day .

[She]93-anne could not keep [her]93-anne appointment punctually , however ; the weather was unfavourable , and [she]93-anne had grieved over the rain on [[her]93-anne friends]238-her friends ' account , and felt it very much on [her]93-anne own , before [she]93-anne was able to attempt the walk . When [she]93-anne reached [the White Hart]84-the white hart , and made [her]93-anne way to [the proper apartment]2061-the proper apartment , [she]93-anne found [herself]93-anne neither arriving quite in time , nor [the first to arrive]2062-the first to arrive . The party before [her]93-anne were , [Mrs Musgrove]96-charles , talking to [Mrs Croft]112-mrs croft , and [Captain Harville]153-captain harville to [Captain Wentworth]117-captain wentworth ; and [she]93-anne immediately heard that [Mary]94-mary and [Henrietta]123-henrietta , too impatient to wait , had gone out the moment it had cleared , but would be back again soon , and that the strictest injunctions had been left with [Mrs Musgrove]96-charles to keep [her]93-anne [there]377-there till [they]2064-they returned . [She]93-anne had only to submit , sit down , be outwardly composed , and feel [herself]93-anne plunged at once in all the agitations which [she]93-anne had merely laid [her]93-anne account of tasting a little before the morning closed . There was no delay , no waste of time . [She]93-anne was deep in the happiness of such misery , or the misery of such happiness , instantly . Two minutes after [her]93-anne entering [the room]406-the room , [Captain Wentworth]117-captain wentworth said--

" [We]3380-we will write the letter [we]3380-we were talking of , [Harville]153-captain harville , now , if [you]153-captain harville will give [me]117-captain wentworth materials . "[117-captain wentworth]

Materials were at hand , on a separate table ; [he]117-captain wentworth went to it , and nearly turning [his]117-captain wentworth back to [them]2066-them all , was engrossed by writing .

[Mrs Musgrove]96-charles was giving [Mrs Croft]112-mrs croft the history of [[her]96-charles eldest daughter]2067-her eldest daughter 's engagement , and just in that inconvenient tone of voice which was perfectly audible while it pretended to be a whisper . [Anne]93-anne felt that [she]93-anne did not belong to the conversation , and yet , as [Captain Harville]153-captain harville seemed thoughtful and not disposed to talk , [she]93-anne could not avoid hearing many undesirable particulars ; such as , " how [Mr Musgrove]120-mrs musgrove and [[my]93-anne brother]2424-my brother [Hayter]95-charles had met again and again to talk it over ; what [[my]93-anne brother]2424-my brother [Hayter]95-charles had said one day , and what [Mr Musgrove]120-mrs musgrove had proposed the next , and what had occurred to [[my]93-anne sister]2379-my sister [Hayter]95-charles , and what [the young people]585-the young people had wished , and what [I]93-anne said at first [I]93-anne never could consent to , but was afterwards persuaded to think might do very well , "[93-anne] and a great deal in the same style of open - hearted communication : minutiae which , even with every advantage of taste and delicacy , which [good Mrs Musgrove]120-mrs musgrove could not give , could be properly interesting only to [the principals]2068-the principals . [Mrs Croft]112-mrs croft was attending with great good - humour , and whenever [she]112-mrs croft spoke at all , it was very sensibly . [Anne]93-anne hoped [the gentlemen]516-the gentlemen might each be too much self - occupied to hear .

" And so , [ma'am]2584-ma'am , all these thing considered , "[120-mrs musgrove] said [Mrs Musgrove]120-mrs musgrove , in [her]112-mrs croft powerful whisper , " though [we]3386-we could have wished it different , yet , altogether , [we]3386-we did not think it fair to stand out any longer , for [Charles Hayter]95-charles was quite wild about it , and [Henrietta]123-henrietta was pretty near as bad ; and so [we]3386-we thought [they]3386-we had better marry at once , and make the best of it , as [many others]3387-many others have done before [them]3386-we . At any rate , said [I]120-mrs musgrove , it will be better than a long engagement . "[120-mrs musgrove]

" That is precisely what [I]112-mrs croft was going to observe , "[112-mrs croft] cried [Mrs Croft]112-mrs croft . " [I]112-mrs croft would rather have [young people]3333-young people settle on a small income at once , and have to struggle with a few difficulties together , than be involved in a long engagement . [I]112-mrs croft always think that no mutual-- "[112-mrs croft]

" Oh ! dear [Mrs Croft]112-mrs croft , "[120-mrs musgrove] cried [Mrs Musgrove]120-mrs musgrove , unable to let [her]112-mrs croft finish [her]112-mrs croft speech , " there is nothing [I]120-mrs musgrove so abominate for [young people]3333-young people as a long engagement . It is what [I]120-mrs musgrove always protested against for [[my]120-mrs musgrove children]2967-my children . It is all very well , [I]120-mrs musgrove used to say , for [young people]3333-young people to be engaged , if there is a certainty of [their]3333-young people being able to marry in six months , or even in twelve ; but a long engagement-- "[120-mrs musgrove]

" Yes , [dear ma'am]3392-dear ma'am , "[112-mrs croft] said [Mrs Croft]112-mrs croft , " or an uncertain engagement , an engagement which may be long . To begin without knowing that at such a time there will be the means of marrying , [I]112-mrs croft hold to be very unsafe and unwise , and what [I]112-mrs croft think [all parents]3393-all parents should prevent as far as [they]3393-all parents can . "[112-mrs croft]

[Anne]93-anne found an unexpected interest here . [She]93-anne felt its application to [herself]93-anne , felt it in a nervous thrill all over [her]93-anne ; and at the same moment that [her]93-anne eyes instinctively glanced towards the distant table , [Captain Wentworth]117-captain wentworth 's pen ceased to move , [his]117-captain wentworth head was raised , pausing , listening , and [he]117-captain wentworth turned round the next instant to give a look , one quick , conscious look at [her]93-anne .

[The two ladies]1343-the two ladies continued to talk , to re - urge the same admitted truths , and enforce [them]1343-the two ladies with such examples of the ill effect of a contrary practice as had fallen within [their]1343-the two ladies observation , but [Anne]93-anne heard nothing distinctly ; it was only a buzz of words in [her]93-anne ear , [her]93-anne mind was in confusion .

[Captain Harville , who had in truth been hearing none of it , now left [his]117-captain wentworth seat]153-captain harville , and moved to a window , and [Anne]93-anne seeming to watch [him]117-captain wentworth , though it was from thorough absence of mind , became gradually sensible that [he]117-captain wentworth was inviting [her]93-anne to join [him]117-captain wentworth where [he]117-captain wentworth stood . [He]117-captain wentworth looked at [her]93-anne with a smile , and a little motion of the head , which expressed , " Come to [me]117-captain wentworth , [I]117-captain wentworth have something to say ; "[117-captain wentworth] and the unaffected , easy kindness of manner which denoted the feelings of [an older acquaintance]2071-an older acquaintance than [he]117-captain wentworth really was , strongly enforced the invitation . [She]93-anne roused [herself]93-anne and went to [him]117-captain wentworth . The window at which [he]117-captain wentworth stood was at the other end of [the room]406-the room from where [the two ladies]1343-the two ladies were sitting , and though nearer to [[Captain Wentworth]117-captain wentworth 's table]2074-captain wentworth 's table , not very near . As [she]93-anne joined [him]117-captain wentworth , [Captain Harville]153-captain harville 's countenance re - assumed the serious , thoughtful expression which seemed its natural character .

" Look here , "[117-captain wentworth] said [he]117-captain wentworth , unfolding a parcel in [his]117-captain wentworth hand , and displaying a small miniature painting , " do [you]93-anne know who that is ? "[117-captain wentworth]

" Certainly : [Captain Benwick]155-captain benwick . "[93-anne]

" Yes , and [you]93-anne may guess who it is for . But , "[117-captain wentworth] ( in a deep tone , ) " it was not done for [her]93-anne . [Miss Elliot]93-anne , do [you]93-anne remember [our]3394-our walking together at [Lyme]48-lyme , and grieving for [him]117-captain wentworth ? [I]117-captain wentworth little thought then -- but no matter . This was drawn at [the Cape]3395-the cape . [He]117-captain wentworth met with [a clever young German artist at [the Cape]3395-the cape]3396-a clever young german artist at the cape , and in compliance with a promise to [[my]117-captain wentworth poor sister]3398-my poor sister , sat to [him]117-captain wentworth , and was bringing it [home]285-home for [her]93-anne ; and [I]117-captain wentworth have now the charge of getting it properly set for another ! It was a commission to [me]117-captain wentworth ! But who else was there to employ ? [I]117-captain wentworth hope [I]117-captain wentworth can allow for [him]117-captain wentworth . [I]117-captain wentworth am not sorry , indeed , to make it over to another . [He]117-captain wentworth undertakes it ; "[117-captain wentworth] ( looking towards [Captain Wentworth]117-captain wentworth , ) " [he]117-captain wentworth is writing about it now . "[117-captain wentworth] And with a quivering lip [he]117-captain wentworth wound up the whole by adding , " [Poor Fanny]217-poor fanny ! [she]217-poor fanny would not have forgotten [him]117-captain wentworth so soon ! "[117-captain wentworth]

" No , "[93-anne] replied [Anne]93-anne , in a low , feeling voice . " That [I]93-anne can easily believe . "[93-anne]

" It was not in [her]217-poor fanny nature . [She]217-poor fanny doted on [him]117-captain wentworth . "[117-captain wentworth]

" It would not be the nature of [any woman who truly loved]3400-any woman who truly loved . "[93-anne]

[Captain Harville]153-captain harville smiled , as much as to say , " Do [you]93-anne claim that for [your]93-anne sex ? "[153-captain harville] and [she]93-anne answered the question , smiling also , " Yes . [We]3401-our certainly do not forget [you]117-captain wentworth as soon as [you]117-captain wentworth forget [us]3401-our . It is , perhaps , [our]3401-our fate rather than [our]3401-our merit . [We]3401-our can not help [ourselves]3401-our . [We]3401-our live at [home]285-home , quiet , confined , and [our]3401-our feelings prey upon [us]3401-our . [You]117-captain wentworth are forced on exertion . [You]117-captain wentworth have always a profession , pursuits , business of some sort or other , to take [you]117-captain wentworth back into [the world]237-the world immediately , and continual occupation and change soon weaken impressions . "[93-anne]

" Granting [your]93-anne assertion that [the world]237-the world does all this so soon for [men]2274-men ( which , however , [I]117-captain wentworth do not think [I]117-captain wentworth shall grant ) , it does not apply to [Benwick]155-captain benwick . [He]155-captain benwick has not been forced upon any exertion . The peace turned [him]155-captain benwick on [shore]686-shore at the very moment , and [he]155-captain benwick has been living with [us]3401-our , in [[our]3401-our little family circle]3407-our little family circle , ever since . "[117-captain wentworth]

" True , "[93-anne] said [Anne]93-anne , " very true ; [I]93-anne did not recollect ; but what shall [we]3401-our say now , [Captain Harville]153-captain harville ? If the change be not from outward circumstances , it must be from within ; it must be nature , [man]1144-man 's nature , which has done the business for [Captain Benwick]155-captain benwick . "[93-anne]

" No , no , it is not [man]1144-man 's nature . [I]117-captain wentworth will not allow it to be more [man]1144-man 's nature than [woman]1145-woman 's to be inconstant and forget those [they]1145-woman do love , or have loved . [I]117-captain wentworth believe the reverse . [I]117-captain wentworth believe in a true analogy between [our]3401-our bodily frames and [our]3401-our mental ; and that as [our]3401-our bodies are the strongest , so are [our]3401-our feelings ; capable of bearing most rough usage , and riding out the heaviest weather . "[117-captain wentworth]

" [Your]3412-your feelings may be the strongest , "[93-anne] replied [Anne]93-anne , " but the same spirit of analogy will authorise [me]93-anne to assert that [ours]3401-our are the most tender . [Man]1144-man is more robust than [woman]1145-woman , but [he]1144-man is not longer lived ; which exactly explains [my]93-anne view of the nature of [their]1145-woman attachments . Nay , it would be too hard upon [you]3412-your , if it were otherwise . [You]3412-your have difficulties , and privations , and dangers enough to struggle with . [You]3412-your are always labouring and toiling , exposed to every risk and hardship . [[Your]3412-your home]3415-your home , [country]3416-country , [friends]3417-friends , all quitted . Neither time , nor health , nor life , to be called [your]3412-your own . It would be hard , indeed "[93-anne] ( with a faltering voice ) , " if [woman]1145-woman 's feelings were to be added to all this . "[93-anne]

" [We]2075-i shall never agree upon this question , "[153-captain harville] [Captain Harville]153-captain harville was beginning to say , when a slight noise called [their]2075-i attention to [Captain Wentworth]117-captain wentworth 's hitherto perfectly quiet division of [the room]406-the room . It was nothing more than that [his]117-captain wentworth pen had fallen down ; but [Anne]93-anne was startled at finding [him]117-captain wentworth nearer than [she]93-anne had supposed , and half inclined to suspect that the pen had only fallen because [he]117-captain wentworth had been occupied by [them]2075-i , striving to catch sounds , which yet [she]93-anne did not think [he]117-captain wentworth could have caught .

" Have [you]93-anne finished [your]93-anne letter ? "[153-captain harville] said [Captain Harville]153-captain harville .

" Not quite , a few lines more . [I]2075-i shall have done in five minutes . "[2075-i]

" There is no hurry on [my]2075-i side . [I]2075-i am only ready whenever [you]93-anne are . [I]2075-i am in very good anchorage here , "[2075-i] ( smiling at [Anne]93-anne , ) " well supplied , and want for nothing . No hurry for a signal at all . Well , [Miss Elliot]93-anne , "[117-captain wentworth] ( lowering [his]117-captain wentworth voice , ) " as [I]117-captain wentworth was saying [we]3419-we shall never agree , [I]117-captain wentworth suppose , upon this point . [No man]3420-no man and [woman]1145-woman , would , probably . But let [me]117-captain wentworth observe that all histories are against [you]93-anne -- all stories , prose and verse . If [I]117-captain wentworth had such a memory as [Benwick]155-captain benwick , [I]117-captain wentworth could bring [you]93-anne fifty quotations in a moment on [my]117-captain wentworth side the argument , and [I]117-captain wentworth do not think [I]117-captain wentworth ever opened a book in [my]117-captain wentworth life which had not something to say upon [woman]1145-woman 's inconstancy . Songs and proverbs , all talk of [woman]1145-woman 's fickleness . But perhaps [you]93-anne will say , these were all written by [men]2274-men . "[117-captain wentworth]

" Perhaps [I]2075-i shall . Yes , yes , if [you]93-anne please , no reference to examples in books . [Men]2274-men have had every advantage of [us]3426-we in telling [their]2274-men own story . Education has been [theirs]2274-men in so much higher a degree ; the pen has been in [their]2274-men hands . [I]2075-i will not allow books to prove anything . "[2075-i]

" But how shall [we]3426-we prove anything ? "[117-captain wentworth]

" [We]3426-we never shall . [We]3426-we never can expect to prove any thing upon such a point . It is a difference of opinion which does not admit of proof . [We]3426-we each begin , probably , with a little bias towards [our]3426-we own sex ; and upon that bias build every circumstance in favour of it which has occurred within [our]3426-we own circle ; many of which circumstances ( perhaps those very cases which strike [us]3426-we the most ) may be precisely such as can not be brought forward without betraying a confidence , or in some respect saying what should not be said . "[2075-i]

" Ah ! "[153-captain harville] cried [Captain Harville]153-captain harville , in a tone of strong feeling , " if [I]153-captain harville could but make [you]93-anne comprehend what [a man]2277-a man suffers when [he]2277-a man takes a last look at [[his]2277-a man wife]222-his wife and [children]433-children , and watches [the boat that [he]2277-a man has sent [them]2274-men off in]3430-the boat that he has sent them off in , as long as it is in sight , and then turns away and says , ' [God]141-god knows whether [we]3426-we ever meet again ! ' And then , if [I]153-captain harville could convey to [you]93-anne the glow of [his]2277-a man soul when [he]2277-a man does see [them]2274-men again ; when , coming back after [a twelvemonth]3431-a twelvemonth 's absence , perhaps , and obliged to put into another port , [he]2277-a man calculates how soon it be possible to get [them]2274-men there , pretending to deceive [himself]2277-a man , and saying , ' [They]2274-men can not be here till such a day , ' but all the while hoping for [them]2274-men twelve hours sooner , and seeing [them]2274-men arrive at last , as if [Heaven]136-heaven had given [them]2274-men wings , by many hours sooner still ! If [I]153-captain harville could explain to [you]93-anne all this , and all that [a man]2277-a man can bear and do , and glories to do , for the sake of these treasures of [his]2277-a man existence ! [I]153-captain harville speak , [you]93-anne know , only of [such men as have hearts]3433-such men as have hearts ! "[153-captain harville] pressing [his]2077-his own with emotion .

" Oh ! "[93-anne] cried [Anne]93-anne eagerly , " [I]93-anne hope [I]93-anne do justice to all that is felt by [you]93-anne , and by those who resemble [you]93-anne . God forbid that [I]93-anne should undervalue the warm and faithful feelings of any of [my]93-anne fellow - creatures ! [I]93-anne should deserve utter contempt if [I]93-anne dared to suppose that true attachment and constancy were known only by [woman]1145-woman . No , [I]93-anne believe [you]93-anne capable of everything great and good in [your]93-anne married lives . [I]93-anne believe [you]93-anne equal to every important exertion , and to every domestic forbearance , so long as -- if [I]93-anne may be allowed the expression -- so long as [you]93-anne have an object . [I]93-anne mean while [the woman [you]93-anne love]3435-the woman you love lives , and lives for [you]93-anne . All the privilege [I]93-anne claim for [my]93-anne own sex ( it is not a very enviable one ; [you]93-anne need not covet it ) , is that of loving longest , when existence or when hope is gone . "[93-anne]

[She]2078-her could not immediately have uttered another sentence ; [her]2078-her heart was too full , [her]2078-her breath too much oppressed .

" [You]2078-her are [a good soul]3436-a good soul , "[153-captain harville] cried [Captain Harville]153-captain harville , putting [his]153-captain harville hand on [her]2078-her arm , quite affectionately . " There is no quarrelling with [you]2078-her . And when [I]153-captain harville think of [Benwick]155-captain benwick , [my]153-captain harville tongue is tied . "[153-captain harville]

[Their]2079-we attention was called towards [the others]359-the others . [Mrs Croft]112-mrs croft was taking leave .

" Here , [Frederick]117-captain wentworth , [you]117-captain wentworth and [I]112-mrs croft part [company]3437-company , [I]112-mrs croft believe , "[112-mrs croft] said [she]112-mrs croft . " [I]112-mrs croft am going [home]285-home , and [you]117-captain wentworth have an engagement with [[your]117-captain wentworth friend]2735-your friend .
