"[112-mrs croft]

[Captain Wentworth]117-captain wentworth was folding up a letter in great haste , and either could not or would not answer fully .

" Yes , "[117-captain wentworth] said [he]117-captain wentworth , " very true ; here [we]2079-we separate , but [Harville]153-captain harville and [I]117-captain wentworth shall soon be after [you]117-captain wentworth ; that is , [Harville]153-captain harville , if [you]117-captain wentworth are ready , [I]117-captain wentworth am in half a minute . [I]117-captain wentworth know [you]117-captain wentworth will not be sorry to be off . [I]117-captain wentworth shall be at [your]117-captain wentworth service in half a minute . "[117-captain wentworth]

[Mrs Croft]112-mrs croft left [them]2081-them , and [Captain Wentworth]117-captain wentworth , having sealed [his]117-captain wentworth letter with great rapidity , was indeed ready , and had even a hurried , agitated air , which [shewed]2082-shewed impatience to be gone . [Anne]93-anne knew not how to understand it . [She]93-anne had the kindest " Good morning , God bless [you]117-captain wentworth ! "[93-anne] from [Captain Harville]153-captain harville , but from [him]153-captain harville not a word , nor a look ! [He]153-captain harville had passed out of [the room]406-the room without a look !

[She]93-anne had only time , however , to move closer to the table where [he]153-captain harville had been writing , when footsteps were heard returning ; the door opened , it was [himself]153-captain harville . [He]153-captain harville begged [their]2081-them pardon , but [he]153-captain harville had forgotten [his]153-captain harville gloves , and instantly crossing [the room]406-the room to the writing table , [he]153-captain harville drew out a letter from under the scattered paper , placed it before [Anne]93-anne with eyes of glowing entreaty fixed on [her]93-anne for a time , and hastily collecting [his]153-captain harville gloves , was again out of [the room]406-the room , almost before [Mrs Musgrove]120-mrs musgrove was aware of [his]153-captain harville being in it : the work of an instant !

The revolution which one instant had made in [Anne]93-anne , was almost beyond expression . The letter , with a direction hardly legible , to " [Miss A. E.--]218-miss a. e.-- , "[153-captain harville] was evidently the one which [he]153-captain harville had been folding so hastily . While supposed to be writing only to [Captain Benwick]155-captain benwick , [he]153-captain harville had been also addressing [her]93-anne ! On the contents of that letter depended all which [this world]2086-this world could do for [her]93-anne . Anything was possible , anything might be defied rather than suspense . [Mrs Musgrove]120-mrs musgrove had little arrangements of [her]93-anne own at [her]93-anne own table ; to [their]2087-their protection [she]93-anne must trust , and sinking into the chair which [he]153-captain harville had occupied , succeeding to the very spot where [he]153-captain harville had leaned and written , [her]93-anne eyes devoured the following words :

" [I]153-captain harville can listen no longer in silence . [I]153-captain harville must speak to [you]3441-you by such means as are within [my]153-captain harville reach . [You]3441-you pierce [my]153-captain harville soul . [I]153-captain harville am half agony , half hope . Tell [me]153-captain harville not that [I]153-captain harville am too late , that such precious feelings are gone for ever . [I]153-captain harville offer [myself]153-captain harville to [you]3441-you again with a heart even more [your]3441-you own than when [you]3441-you almost broke it , eight years and a half ago . Dare not say [that man]2705-that man forgets sooner than [woman]1145-woman , that [his]2705-that man love has an earlier death . [I]153-captain harville have loved none but [you]3441-you . Unjust [I]153-captain harville may have been , weak and resentful [I]153-captain harville have been , but never inconstant . [You]3441-you alone have brought [me]153-captain harville to [Bath]10-bath . For [you]3441-you alone , [I]153-captain harville think and plan . Have [you]3441-you not seen this ? Can [you]3441-you fail to have understood [my]153-captain harville wishes ? [I]153-captain harville had not waited even these ten days , could [I]153-captain harville have read [your]3441-you feelings , as [I]153-captain harville think [you]3441-you must have penetrated [mine]153-captain harville . [I]153-captain harville can hardly write . [I]153-captain harville am every instant hearing something which overpowers [me]153-captain harville . [You]3441-you sink [your]3441-you voice , but [I]153-captain harville can distinguish the tones of that voice when they would be lost on [others]391-others . Too good , [too excellent creature]3445-too excellent creature ! [You]3441-you do [us]3446-us justice , indeed . [You]3441-you do believe that there is true attachment and constancy among [men]2274-men . Believe it to be most fervent , most undeviating , in F. W. "[153-captain harville]

" [I]153-captain harville must go , uncertain of [my]153-captain harville fate ; but [I]153-captain harville shall return hither , or follow [[your]3441-you party]3076-your party , as soon as possible . A word , a look , will be enough to decide whether [I]153-captain harville enter [[[your]3441-you father]2212-your father 's house]3450-your father 's house this evening or never . "[153-captain harville]

Such a letter was not to be soon recovered from . Half an hour 's solitude and reflection might have tranquillized [her]2088-she ; but the ten minutes only which now passed before [she]2088-she was interrupted , with all the restraints of [her]2088-she situation , could do nothing towards tranquillity . Every moment rather brought fresh agitation . It was overpowering happiness . And before [she]2088-she was beyond the first stage of full sensation , [Charles]95-charles , [Mary]94-mary , and [Henrietta]123-henrietta all came in .

The absolute necessity of seeming like [herself]2088-she produced then an immediate struggle ; but after a while [she]2088-she could do no more . [She]2088-she began not to understand a word [they]2089-they said , and was obliged to plead indisposition and excuse [herself]2088-she . [They]2089-they could then see that [she]2088-she looked very ill , were shocked and concerned , and would not stir without [her]2088-she for [the world]237-the world . This was dreadful . Would [they]2089-they only have gone away , and left [her]2088-she in the quiet possession of [that room]1891-that room it would have been [her]2088-she cure ; but to have [them]2089-they all standing or waiting around [her]2088-she was distracting , and in desperation , [she]2088-she said [she]2088-she would go [home]285-home .

" By all means , [[my]120-mrs musgrove dear]2319-my dear , "[120-mrs musgrove] cried [Mrs Musgrove]120-mrs musgrove , " go [home]285-home directly , and take care of [yourself]2319-my dear , that [you]2319-my dear may be fit for the evening . [I]120-mrs musgrove wish [Sarah]168-sarah thither was here to doctor [you]2319-my dear , but [I]120-mrs musgrove am [no doctor]3453-no doctor [myself]120-mrs musgrove . [Charles]95-charles , ring and order a chair . [She]168-sarah thither must not walk . "[120-mrs musgrove]

But the chair would never do . Worse than all ! To lose the possibility of speaking two words to [Captain Wentworth]117-captain wentworth in the course of [her]2088-she quiet , solitary progress up [the town]1093-the town ( and [she]2088-she felt almost certain of meeting [him]117-captain wentworth ) could not be borne . The chair was earnestly protested against , and [Mrs Musgrove]120-mrs musgrove , who thought only of one sort of illness , having assured [herself]120-mrs musgrove with some anxiety , that there had been no fall in the case ; that [Anne]93-anne had not at any time lately slipped down , and got a blow on [her]93-anne head ; that [she]93-anne was perfectly convinced of having had no fall ; could part with [her]93-anne cheerfully , and depend on finding [her]93-anne better at night .

Anxious to omit no possible precaution , [Anne]93-anne struggled , and said--

" [I]93-anne am afraid , [ma'am]2584-ma'am , that it is not perfectly understood . Pray be so good as to mention to [the other gentlemen]3455-the other gentlemen that [we]3456-we hope to see [your]2584-ma'am whole party this evening . [I]93-anne am afraid there had been some mistake ; and [I]93-anne wish [you]2584-ma'am particularly to assure [Captain Harville]153-captain harville and [Captain Wentworth]117-captain wentworth , that [we]3456-we hope to see [them]3457-them both . "[93-anne]

" Oh ! [[my]93-anne dear]2319-my dear , it is quite understood , [I]93-anne give [you]2319-my dear [my]93-anne word . [Captain Harville]153-captain harville has no thought but of going . "[93-anne]

" Do [you]2584-ma'am think so ? But [I]93-anne am afraid ; and [I]93-anne should be so very sorry . Will [you]2584-ma'am promise [me]93-anne to mention it , when [you]2584-ma'am see [them]3457-them again ? [You]2584-ma'am will see [them]3457-them both this morning , [I]93-anne dare say . Do promise [me]93-anne . "[93-anne]

" To be sure [I]93-anne will , if [you]2584-ma'am wish it . [Charles]95-charles , if [you]2584-ma'am see [Captain Harville]153-captain harville anywhere , remember to give [Miss Anne]93-anne 's message . But indeed , [[my]93-anne dear]2319-my dear , [you]2584-ma'am need not be uneasy . [Captain Harville]153-captain harville holds [himself]153-captain harville quite engaged , [I]93-anne 'll answer for it ; and [Captain Wentworth]117-captain wentworth the same , [I]93-anne dare say . "[93-anne]

[Anne]93-anne could do no more ; but [her]93-anne heart prophesied some mischance to damp the perfection of [her]93-anne felicity . It could not be very lasting , however . Even if [he]2094-he did not come to [Camden Place]60-camden place [himself]2094-he , it would be in [her]93-anne power to send an intelligible sentence by [Captain Harville]153-captain harville . Another momentary vexation occurred . [Charles]95-charles , in [his]95-charles real concern and good nature , would go [home]285-home with [her]93-anne ; there was no preventing [him]2094-he . This was almost cruel . But [she]93-anne could not be long ungrateful ; [he]2094-he was sacrificing an engagement at [a gunsmith]2096-a gunsmith 's , to be of use to [her]93-anne ; and [she]93-anne set off with [him]2094-he , with no feeling but gratitude apparent .

[They]2097-they were on [Union Street]79-union street , when a quicker step behind , a something of familiar sound , gave [her]93-anne two moments ' preparation for the sight of [Captain Wentworth]117-captain wentworth . [He]2094-he joined [them]2097-they ; but , as if irresolute whether to join or to pass on , said nothing , only looked . [Anne]93-anne could command [herself]93-anne enough to receive that look , and not repulsively . The cheeks which had been pale now glowed , and the movements which had hesitated were decided . [He]2094-he walked by [her]93-anne side . [Presently]2098-presently , struck by a sudden thought , [Charles]95-charles said--

" [Captain Wentworth]117-captain wentworth , which way are [you]117-captain wentworth going ? Only to [Gay Street]74-gay street , or farther up [the town]1093-the town ? "[95-charles]

" [I]117-captain wentworth hardly know , "[117-captain wentworth] replied [Captain Wentworth]117-captain wentworth , surprised .

" Are [you]117-captain wentworth going as high as [Belmont]77-belmont ? Are [you]117-captain wentworth going near [Camden Place]60-camden place ? Because , if [you]117-captain wentworth are , [I]95-charles shall have no scruple in asking [you]117-captain wentworth to take [my]95-charles place , and give [Anne]93-anne [your]117-captain wentworth arm to [[her]93-anne father]274-her father 's door . [She]93-anne is rather done for this morning , and must not go so far without help , and [I]95-charles ought to be at [[that fellow]3462-that fellow 's in [the Market Place]3464-the market place]3463-that fellow 's in the market place . [He]117-captain wentworth promised [me]95-charles the sight of a capital gun [he]117-captain wentworth is just going to send off ; said [he]117-captain wentworth would keep it unpacked to the last possible moment , that [I]95-charles might see it ; and if [I]95-charles do not turn back now , [I]95-charles have no chance . By [his]117-captain wentworth description , a good deal like the second size double - barrel of [mine]95-charles , which [you]95-charles shot with one day round [Winthrop]44-winthrop . "[95-charles]

There could not be an objection . There could be only the most proper alacrity , a most obliging compliance for public view ; and smiles reined in and spirits dancing in private rapture . In half a minute [Charles]95-charles was at the bottom of [Union Street]79-union street again , and the other two proceeding together : and soon words enough had passed between [them]2099-they to decide [their]2099-they direction towards [the comparatively quiet and retired gravel walk]2100-the comparatively quiet and retired gravel walk , where the power of conversation would make the present hour a blessing indeed , and prepare it for all the immortality which the happiest recollections of [their]2099-they own future lives could bestow . There [they]2099-they exchanged again those feelings and those promises which had once before seemed to secure everything , but which had been followed by so many , many years of division and estrangement . There [they]2099-they returned again into the past , more exquisitely happy , perhaps , in [their]2099-they re - union , than when it had been first projected ; more tender , more tried , more fixed in a knowledge of each other 's character , truth , and attachment ; more equal to act , more justified in acting . And there , as [they]2099-they slowly paced the gradual ascent , heedless of [every group around [them]2099-they]2101-every group around them , seeing [neither sauntering politicians]2102-neither sauntering politicians , [bustling housekeepers]2103-bustling housekeepers , [flirting girls]2104-flirting girls , nor [nursery - maids]2105-nursery - maids and [children]433-children , [they]2099-they could indulge in those retrospections and acknowledgements , and especially in those explanations of what had directly preceded the present moment , which were so poignant and so ceaseless in interest . All the little variations of the last week were gone through ; and of yesterday and today there could scarcely be an end .

[She]2107-her had not mistaken [him]95-charles . Jealousy of [Mr Elliot]102-mr elliot had been the retarding weight , the doubt , the torment . That had begun to operate in the very hour of first meeting [her]2107-her in [Bath]10-bath ; that had returned , after a short suspension , to ruin the concert ; and that had influenced [him]95-charles in everything [he]95-charles had said and done , or omitted to say and do , in the last four - and - twenty hours . It had been gradually yielding to the better hopes which [her]2107-her looks , or words , or actions occasionally encouraged ; it had been vanquished at last by those sentiments and those tones which had reached [him]95-charles while [she]2107-her talked with [Captain Harville]153-captain harville ; and under the irresistible governance of which [he]95-charles had seized a sheet of paper , and poured out [his]95-charles feelings .

Of what [he]95-charles had then written , nothing was to be retracted or qualified . [He]95-charles persisted in having loved none but [her]2107-her . [She]2107-her had never been supplanted . [He]95-charles never even believed [himself]95-charles to see [her]2107-her equal . Thus much indeed [he]95-charles was obliged to acknowledge : that [he]95-charles had been constant unconsciously , nay unintentionally ; that [he]95-charles had meant to forget [her]2107-her , and believed it to be done . [He]95-charles had imagined [himself]95-charles indifferent , when [he]95-charles had only been angry ; and [he]95-charles had been unjust to [her]2107-her merits , because [he]95-charles had been [a sufferer]2108-a sufferer from [them]2109-them . [Her]2107-her character was now fixed on [his]95-charles mind as perfection itself , maintaining the loveliest medium of fortitude and gentleness ; but [he]95-charles was obliged to acknowledge that only at [Uppercross]4-uppercross had [he]95-charles learnt to do [her]2107-her justice , and only at [Lyme]48-lyme had [he]95-charles begun to understand [himself]95-charles . At [Lyme]48-lyme , [he]95-charles had received lessons of more than one sort . The passing admiration of [Mr Elliot]102-mr elliot had at least roused [him]95-charles , and the scenes on [the Cobb]49-the cobb and at [[Captain Harville]153-captain harville 's]2110-captain harville 's had fixed [her]2107-her superiority .

In [his]95-charles preceding attempts to attach [himself]95-charles to [Louisa Musgrove]124-louisa ( the attempts of angry pride ) , [he]95-charles protested that [he]95-charles had for ever felt it to be impossible ; that [he]95-charles had not cared , could not care , for [Louisa]124-louisa ; though till that day , till the leisure for reflection which followed it , [he]95-charles had not understood the perfect excellence of the mind with which [Louisa]124-louisa 's could so ill bear a comparison , or the perfect unrivalled hold it possessed over [his]95-charles own . There , [he]95-charles had learnt to distinguish between the steadiness of principle and the obstinacy of self - will , between the darings of heedlessness and the resolution of a collected mind . There [he]95-charles had seen everything to exalt in [his]95-charles estimation [the woman [he]95-charles had lost]2111-the woman he had lost ; and there begun to deplore the pride , the folly , the madness of resentment , which had kept [him]95-charles from trying to regain [her]124-louisa when thrown in [his]95-charles way .

From that period [his]95-charles penance had become severe . [He]95-charles had no sooner been free from the horror and remorse attending the first few days of [Louisa]124-louisa 's accident , no sooner begun to feel [himself]95-charles alive again , than [he]95-charles had begun to feel [himself]95-charles , though alive , not at liberty .

" [I]95-charles found , "[95-charles] said [he]95-charles , " that [I]95-charles was considered by [Harville]153-captain harville [an engaged man]3465-an engaged man ! That neither [Harville]153-captain harville nor [[his]153-captain harville wife]222-his wife entertained a doubt of [our]3467-our mutual attachment . [I]95-charles was startled and shocked . To a degree , [I]95-charles could contradict this instantly ; but , when [I]95-charles began to reflect that [others]391-others might have felt the same -- [[her]124-louisa own family]295-her own family , nay , perhaps [herself]124-louisa -- [I]95-charles was no longer at [my]95-charles own disposal . [I]95-charles was [hers]124-louisa in honour if [she]124-louisa wished it . [I]95-charles had been unguarded . [I]95-charles had not thought seriously on this subject before . [I]95-charles had not considered that [my]95-charles excessive intimacy must have its danger of ill consequence in many ways ; and that [I]95-charles had no right to be trying whether [I]95-charles could attach [myself]95-charles to [either of [the girls]655-the girls]3470-either of the girls , at the risk of raising even an unpleasant report , were there no other ill effects . [I]95-charles had been grossly wrong , and must abide the consequences . "[95-charles]

[He]2112-i found too late , in short , that [he]2112-i had entangled [himself]2112-i ; and that precisely as [he]2112-i became fully satisfied of [his]2112-i not caring for [Louisa]124-louisa at all , [he]2112-i must regard [himself]2112-i as bound to [her]124-louisa , if [her]124-louisa sentiments for [him]2112-i were what [the Harvilles]154-the harvilles supposed . It determined [him]2112-i to leave [Lyme]48-lyme , and await [her]124-louisa complete recovery elsewhere . [He]2112-i would gladly weaken , by any fair means , whatever feelings or speculations concerning [him]2112-i might exist ; and [he]2112-i went , therefore , to [[his]2112-i brother]1496-his brother 's , meaning after a while to return to [Kellynch]6-kellynch , and act as circumstances might require .

" [I]2112-i was six weeks with [Edward]128-edward , "[2112-i] said [he]2112-i , " and saw [him]128-edward happy . [I]2112-i could have no other pleasure . [I]2112-i deserved none . [He]128-edward enquired after [you]93-anne very particularly ; asked even if [you]93-anne were personally altered , little suspecting that to [my]2112-i eye [you]93-anne could never alter . "[2112-i]

[Anne]93-anne smiled , and let it pass . It was too pleasing a blunder for a reproach . It is something for [a woman]258-a woman to be assured , in [her]258-a woman eight - and - twentieth year , that [she]258-a woman has not lost one charm of earlier youth ; but the value of such homage was inexpressibly increased to [Anne]93-anne , by comparing it with former words , and feeling it to be the result , not the cause of a revival of [his]2112-i warm attachment .

[He]2112-i had remained in [Shropshire]43-shropshire , lamenting the blindness of [his]2112-i own pride , and the blunders of [his]2112-i own calculations , till at once released from [Louisa]124-louisa by the astonishing and felicitous intelligence of [her]124-louisa engagement with [Benwick]155-captain benwick .

" Here , "[2112-i] said [he]2112-i , " ended the worst of [my]2112-i state ; for now [I]2112-i could at least put [myself]2112-i in the way of happiness ; [I]2112-i could exert [myself]2112-i ; [I]2112-i could do something . But to be waiting so long in inaction , and waiting only for evil , had been dreadful . Within the first five minutes [I]2112-i said , ' [I]2112-i will be at [Bath]10-bath on Wednesday , ' and [I]2112-i was . Was it unpardonable to think it worth [my]2112-i while to come ? and to arrive with some degree of hope ? [You]3472-you were single . It was possible that [you]3472-you might retain the feelings of the past , as [I]2112-i did ; and [one encouragement]3473-one encouragement happened to be [mine]2112-i . [I]2112-i could never doubt that [you]3472-you would be loved and sought by [others]391-others , but [I]2112-i knew to a certainty that [you]3472-you had refused [one man]2790-one man , at least , of better pretensions than [myself]2112-i ; and [I]2112-i could not help often saying , ' Was this for [me]2112-i ? ' "[2112-i]

[Their]2115-their first meeting in [Milsom Street]76-milsom street afforded much to be said , but the concert still more . That evening seemed to be made up of exquisite moments . The moment of [her]2116-her stepping forward in [the Octagon Room]1849-the octagon room to speak to [him]2118-me : the moment of [Mr Elliot]102-mr elliot 's appearing and tearing [her]2116-her away , and one or two subsequent moments , marked by returning hope or increasing despondency , were dwelt on with energy .

" To see [you]3472-you , "[2118-me] cried [he]2118-me , " in the midst of [those who could not be [[my]2118-me well - wishers]3477-my well - wishers ; to see [[your]3472-you cousin]2732-your cousin close by [you]3472-you , conversing and smiling , and feel all the horrible eligibilities and proprieties of the match ! To consider it as the certain wish of [every being who could hope to influence [you]3472-you]3479-every being who could hope to influence you ! Even if [your]3472-you own feelings were reluctant or indifferent , to consider what powerful supports would be [his]2118-me]3476-those who could not be my well - wishers ; to see your cousin close by you , conversing and smiling , and feel all the horrible eligibilities and proprieties of the match ! to consider it as the certain wish of every being who could hope to influence you ! even if your own feelings were reluctant or indifferent , to consider what powerful supports would be his ! Was it not enough to make the fool of [me]2118-me which [I]2118-me appeared ? How could [I]2118-me look on without agony ? Was not the very sight of [the friend who sat behind [you]3472-you]3480-the friend who sat behind you , was not the recollection of what had been , the knowledge of [her]3480-the friend who sat behind you influence , the indelible , immoveable impression of what persuasion had once done -- was it not all against [me]2118-me ? "[2118-me]

" [You]2118-me should have distinguished , "[93-anne] replied [Anne]93-anne . " [You]2118-me should not have suspected [me]93-anne now ; the case is so different , and [my]93-anne age is so different . If [I]93-anne was wrong in yielding to persuasion once , remember that it was to persuasion exerted on the side of safety , not of risk . When [I]93-anne yielded , [I]93-anne thought it was to duty , but no duty could be called in aid here . In marrying [a man indifferent to [me]93-anne]3481-a man indifferent to me , all risk would have been incurred , and all duty violated . "[93-anne]

" Perhaps [I]2119-i ought to have reasoned thus , "[2119-i] [he]2119-i replied , " but [I]2119-i could not . [I]2119-i could not derive benefit from the late knowledge [I]2119-i had acquired of [your]3472-you character . [I]2119-i could not bring it into play ; it was overwhelmed , buried , lost in those earlier feelings which [I]2119-i had been smarting under year after year . [I]2119-i could think of [you]3472-you only as [one who had yielded , who had given [me]2119-i up , who had been influenced by [any one]1355-any one rather than by [me]2119-i]3482-one who had yielded , who had given me up , who had been influenced by any one rather than by me . [I]2119-i saw [you]3472-you with [the very person who had guided [you]3472-you in that year of misery]3484-the very person who had guided you in that year of misery . [I]2119-i had no reason to believe [her]3484-the very person who had guided you in that year of misery of less authority now . The force of habit was to be added . "[2119-i]

" [I]93-anne should have thought , "[93-anne] said [Anne]93-anne , " that [my]93-anne manner to [yourself]3472-you might have spared [you]3472-you much or all of this . "[93-anne]

" No , no ! [your]3472-you manner might be only the ease which [your]3472-you engagement to [another man]1768-another man would give . [I]2121-any one in that house left [you]3472-you in this belief ; and yet , [I]2121-any one in that house was determined to see [you]3472-you again . [My]2121-any one in that house spirits rallied with the morning , and [I]2121-any one in that house felt that [I]2121-any one in that house had still a motive for remaining [here]2340-here . "[2121-any one in that house]

At last [Anne]93-anne was at [home]285-home again , and happier than [any one in [that house]445-that house]2121-any one in that house could have conceived . All the surprise and suspense , and every other painful part of the morning dissipated by this conversation , [she]93-anne re - entered [the house]310-the house so happy as to be obliged to find an alloy in some momentary apprehensions of its being impossible to last . An interval of meditation , serious and grateful , was the best corrective of everything dangerous in such high - wrought felicity ; and [she]93-anne went to [[her]93-anne room]2124-her room , and grew steadfast and fearless in the thankfulness of [her]93-anne enjoyment .

The evening came , [the drawing - rooms]2125-the drawing - rooms were lighted up , [the company]1910-the company assembled . It was but a card party , it was but a mixture of [those who had never met before]2127-those who had never met before , and [those who met too often]2128-those who met too often ; a commonplace business , too numerous for intimacy , too small for variety ; but [Anne]93-anne had never found an evening shorter . Glowing and lovely in sensibility and happiness , and more generally admired than [she]93-anne thought about or cared for , [she]93-anne had cheerful or forbearing feelings for every creature around [her]93-anne . [Mr Elliot]102-mr elliot was [there]377-there ; [she]93-anne avoided , but [she]93-anne could pity [him]102-mr elliot . [The Wallises]80-the wallises , [she]93-anne had amusement in understanding [them]80-the wallises . [Lady Dalrymple]180-lady dalrymple and [Miss Carteret]177-miss carteret -- [they]2130-they would soon be [innoxious cousins to [her]93-anne]2131-innoxious cousins to her . [She]93-anne cared not for [Mrs Clay]105-mrs clay , and had nothing to blush for in the public manners of [[her]93-anne father]274-her father and [sister]268-sister . With [the Musgroves]121-the miss musgroves , there was [the happy chat of perfect ease]2134-the happy chat of perfect ease ; with [Captain Harville]153-captain harville , the kind - hearted intercourse of [brother]2135-brother and [sister]268-sister ; with [Lady Russell]101-lady russell , attempts at conversation , which a delicious consciousness cut short ; with [Admiral]111-admiral croft and [Mrs Croft]112-mrs croft , everything of peculiar cordiality and fervent interest , which the same consciousness sought to conceal ; and with [Captain Wentworth]117-captain wentworth , some moments of communications continually occurring , and always the hope of more , and always the knowledge of [his]117-captain wentworth being there .

It was in one of these short meetings , each apparently occupied in admiring a fine display of greenhouse plants , that [she]93-anne said--

" [I]93-anne have been thinking over the past , and trying impartially to judge of the right and wrong , [I]93-anne mean with regard to [myself]93-anne ; and [I]93-anne must believe that [I]93-anne was right , much as [I]93-anne suffered from it , that [I]93-anne was perfectly right in being guided by [the friend whom [you]3488-you will love better than [you]3488-you do now]3487-the friend whom you will love better than you do now . To [me]93-anne , [she]3487-the friend whom you will love better than you do now was in the place of [a parent]3489-a parent . Do not mistake [me]93-anne , however . [I]93-anne am not saying that [she]3487-the friend whom you will love better than you do now did not err in [her]3487-the friend whom you will love better than you do now advice . It was , perhaps , one of those cases in which advice is good or bad only as the event decides ; and for [myself]93-anne , [I]93-anne certainly never should , in any circumstance of tolerable similarity , give such advice . But [I]93-anne mean , that [I]93-anne was right in submitting to [her]3487-the friend whom you will love better than you do now , and that if [I]93-anne had done otherwise , [I]93-anne should have suffered more in continuing the engagement than [I]93-anne did even in giving it up , because [I]93-anne should have suffered in [my]93-anne conscience . [I]93-anne have now , as far as such a sentiment is allowable in human nature , nothing to reproach [myself]93-anne with ; and if [I]93-anne mistake not , a strong sense of duty is no bad part of [a woman]258-a woman 's portion . "[93-anne]

[He]2137-i looked at [her]2138-you , looked at [Lady Russell]101-lady russell , and looking again at [her]2138-you , replied , as if in cool deliberation--

" Not yet . But there are hopes of [her]3487-the friend whom you will love better than you do now being forgiven in time . [I]2137-i trust to being in charity with [her]3487-the friend whom you will love better than you do now soon . But [I]2137-i too have been thinking over the past , and a question has suggested itself , whether there may not have been one person more [[my]2137-i enemy]3491-my enemy even than [that lady]3492-that lady ? [[My]2137-i own self]3493-my own self . Tell [me]2137-i if , when [I]2137-i returned to [England]17-england in the year eight , with a few thousand pounds , and was posted into [the Laconia]23-the laconia , if [I]2137-i had then written to [you]2138-you , would [you]2138-you have answered [my]2137-i letter ? Would [you]2138-you , in short , have renewed the engagement then ? "[2137-i]

" Would [I]2138-you ! "[2138-you] was all [her]2138-you answer ; but the accent was decisive enough .

" [Good God]141-god ! "[2139-i] [he]2139-i cried , " [you]2138-you would ! It is not that [I]2139-i did not think of it , or desire it , as what could alone crown all [my]2139-i other success ; but [I]2139-i was proud , too proud to ask again . [I]2139-i did not understand [you]2138-you . [I]2139-i shut [my]2139-i eyes , and would not understand [you]2138-you , or do [you]2138-you justice . This is a recollection which ought to make [me]2139-i forgive every one sooner than [myself]2139-i . Six years of separation and suffering might have been spared . It is a sort of pain , too , which is new to [me]2139-i . [I]2139-i have been used to the gratification of believing [myself]2139-i to earn every blessing that [I]2139-i enjoyed . [I]2139-i have valued [myself]2139-i on honourable toils and just rewards . Like [other great men under reverses]3494-other great men under reverses , "[2139-i] [he]2139-i added , with a smile . " [I]2139-i must endeavour to subdue [my]2139-i mind to [my]2139-i fortune . [I]2139-i must learn to brook being happier than [I]2139-i deserve . "[2139-i]

Chapter 24

Who can be in doubt of what followed ? When [any two young people]2140-any two young people take it into [their]2140-any two young people heads to marry , [they]2140-any two young people are pretty sure by perseverance to carry [their]2140-any two young people point , be [they]2140-any two young people ever so poor , or ever so imprudent , or ever so little likely to be necessary to [each other]489-each other 's ultimate comfort . This may be bad morality to conclude with , but [I]10-bath believe it to be truth ; and if such parties succeed , how should [a Captain Wentworth]117-captain wentworth and [an Anne Elliot , with the advantage of maturity of mind , consciousness of right]2142-an anne elliot , with the advantage of maturity of mind , consciousness of right , and one independent fortune between [them]2142-an anne elliot , with the advantage of maturity of mind , consciousness of right , fail of bearing down every opposition ? [They]2142-an anne elliot , with the advantage of maturity of mind , consciousness of right might in fact , have borne down a great deal more than [they]2142-an anne elliot , with the advantage of maturity of mind , consciousness of right met with , for there was little to distress [them]2142-an anne elliot , with the advantage of maturity of mind , consciousness of right beyond the want of graciousness and warmth . [Sir Walter]90-sir walter made no objection , and [Elizabeth]91-elizabeth did nothing worse than look cold and unconcerned . [Captain Wentworth]117-captain wentworth , with five - and - twenty thousand pounds , and as high in [his]117-captain wentworth profession as merit and activity could place [him]117-captain wentworth , was no longer [nobody]2242-nobody . [He]117-captain wentworth was now esteemed quite worthy to address [the daughter of [a foolish , spendthrift baronet , who had not had principle or sense enough to maintain [himself]117-captain wentworth in the situation in which [Providence]118-providence had placed [him]117-captain wentworth]2145-a foolish , spendthrift baronet , who had not had principle or sense enough to maintain himself in the situation in which providence had placed him , and who could give [[his]117-captain wentworth daughter]329-his daughter at present but a small part of the share of ten thousand pounds which must be [hers]329-his daughter hereafter .

[Sir Walter]90-sir walter , indeed , though [he]90-sir walter had no affection for [Anne]93-anne , and no vanity flattered , to make [him]90-sir walter really happy on the occasion , was very far from thinking it a bad match for [her]93-anne]2144-the daughter of a foolish , spendthrift baronet , who had not had principle or sense enough to maintain himself in the situation in which providence had placed him , and who could give his daughter at present but a small part of the share of ten thousand pounds which must be hers hereafter . sir walter , indeed , though he had no affection for anne , and no vanity flattered , to make him really happy on the occasion , was very far from thinking it a bad match for her . On the contrary , when [he]90-sir walter saw more of [Captain Wentworth]117-captain wentworth , saw [him]117-captain wentworth repeatedly by daylight , and eyed [him]117-captain wentworth well , [he]90-sir walter was very much struck by [his]90-sir walter personal claims , and felt that [his]90-sir walter superiority of appearance might be not unfairly balanced against [her]93-anne superiority of rank ; and all this , assisted by [his]90-sir walter well - sounding name , enabled [Sir Walter]90-sir walter at last to prepare [his]90-sir walter pen , with a very good grace , for the insertion of the marriage in the volume of honour .

[The only one among them , whose opposition of feeling could excite any serious anxiety]2147-the only one among them , whose opposition of feeling could excite any serious anxiety was [Lady Russell]101-lady russell . [Anne]93-anne knew that [Lady Russell]101-lady russell must be suffering some pain in understanding and relinquishing [Mr Elliot]102-mr elliot , and be making some struggles to become truly acquainted with , and do justice to [Captain Wentworth]117-captain wentworth . This however was what [Lady Russell]101-lady russell had now to do . [She]101-lady russell must learn to feel that [she]101-lady russell had been mistaken with regard to both ; that [she]101-lady russell had been unfairly influenced by appearances in each ; that because [Captain Wentworth]117-captain wentworth 's manners had not suited [her]101-lady russell own ideas , [she]101-lady russell had been too quick in suspecting them to indicate a character of dangerous impetuosity ; and that because [Mr Elliot]102-mr elliot 's manners had precisely pleased [her]101-lady russell in [their]2148-their propriety and correctness , [their]2148-their general politeness and suavity , [she]101-lady russell had been too quick in receiving [them]2148-their as the certain result of the most correct opinions and well - regulated mind . There was nothing less for [Lady Russell]101-lady russell to do , than to admit that [she]101-lady russell had been pretty completely wrong , and to take up a new set of opinions and of hopes .

There is a quickness of perception in some , a nicety in the discernment of character , a natural penetration , in short , which no experience in [others]391-others can equal , and [Lady Russell]101-lady russell had been less gifted in this part of understanding than [[her]101-lady russell young friend]385-her young friend . But [she]101-lady russell was [a very good woman]2151-a very good woman , and if [her]101-lady russell second object was to be sensible and well - judging , [her]101-lady russell first was to see [Anne]93-anne happy . [She]101-lady russell loved [Anne]93-anne better than [she]101-lady russell loved [her]101-lady russell own abilities ; and when the awkwardness of the beginning was over , found little hardship in attaching [herself]101-lady russell as [a mother to the man who was securing the happiness of [[her]101-lady russell other child]2153-her other child]2152-a mother to the man who was securing the happiness of her other child .

Of all [the family]312-the family , [Mary]94-mary was probably [the one most immediately gratified by the circumstance]2155-the one most immediately gratified by the circumstance . It was creditable to have [a sister]403-a sister married , and [she]94-mary might flatter [herself]94-mary with having been greatly instrumental to the connexion , by keeping [Anne]93-anne with [her]94-mary in the autumn ; and as [[her]94-mary own sister]509-her own sister must be better than [[[her]94-mary husband]2315-her husband 's sisters]2159-her husband 's sisters , it was very agreeable that [Captain Wentworth]117-captain wentworth should be [a richer man than either [Captain Benwick]155-captain benwick or [Charles Hayter]95-charles]2160-a richer man than either captain benwick or charles hayter . [She]94-mary had something to suffer , perhaps , when [they]2161-they came into contact again , in seeing [Anne]93-anne restored to the rights of seniority , and [the mistress of [a very pretty landaulette]2163-a very pretty landaulette]2162-the mistress of a very pretty landaulette ; but [she]94-mary had a future to look forward to , of powerful consolation . [Anne]93-anne had [no Uppercross Hall]88-no uppercross hall before [her]93-anne , [no landed estate]2164-no landed estate , no headship of [a family]439-a family ; and if [they]2161-they could but keep [Captain Wentworth]117-captain wentworth from being made [a baronet]349-a baronet , [she]94-mary would not change situations with [Anne]93-anne .

It would be well for [the eldest sister]2167-the eldest sister if [she]2167-the eldest sister were equally satisfied with [her]2167-the eldest sister situation , for a change is not very probable there . [She]94-mary had soon the mortification of seeing [Mr Elliot]102-mr elliot withdraw , and [no one of proper condition]2168-no one of proper condition has since presented [himself]102-mr elliot to raise even the unfounded hopes which sunk with [him]102-mr elliot .

The news of [[his]102-mr elliot cousin]914-his cousin [Anne]93-anne 's engagement burst on [Mr Elliot]102-mr elliot most unexpectedly . It deranged [his]102-mr elliot best plan of domestic happiness , [his]102-mr elliot best hope of keeping [Sir Walter]90-sir walter single by the watchfulness which [a son - in - law]2170-a son - in - law 's rights would have given . But , though discomfited and disappointed , [he]102-mr elliot could still do something for [his]102-mr elliot own interest and [his]102-mr elliot own enjoyment . [He]102-mr elliot soon quitted [Bath]10-bath ; and on [Mrs Clay]105-mrs clay 's quitting it soon afterwards , and being next heard of as established under [his]102-mr elliot protection in [London]7-london , it was evident how double a game [he]102-mr elliot had been playing , and how determined [he]102-mr elliot was to save [himself]102-mr elliot from being cut out by [one artful woman]2171-one artful woman , at least .

[Mrs Clay]105-mrs clay 's affections had overpowered [her]105-mrs clay interest , and [she]105-mrs clay had sacrificed , for [the young man]311-the young man 's sake , the possibility of scheming longer for [Sir Walter]90-sir walter . [She]105-mrs clay has abilities , however , as well as affections ; and it is now a doubtful point whether [his]90-sir walter cunning , or hers , may finally carry the day ; whether , after preventing [her]105-mrs clay from being [the wife of [Sir Walter]90-sir walter]2173-the wife of sir walter , [he]90-sir walter may not be wheedled and caressed at last into making [her]105-mrs clay [the wife of [Sir William]208-sir william]2174-the wife of sir william .

It can not be doubted that [Sir Walter]90-sir walter and [Elizabeth]91-elizabeth were shocked and mortified by the loss of [[their]2175-their companion]2176-their companion , and the discovery of [their]2175-their deception in [her]105-mrs clay . [They]2175-their had [[their]2175-their great cousins]2177-their great cousins , to be sure , to resort to for comfort ; but [they]2175-their must long feel that to flatter and follow [others]391-others , without being flattered and followed in turn , is but a state of half enjoyment .

[Anne]93-anne , satisfied at a very early period of [Lady Russell]101-lady russell 's meaning to love [Captain Wentworth]117-captain wentworth as [she]93-anne ought , had no other alloy to the happiness of [her]93-anne prospects than what arose from the consciousness of having no relations to bestow on [him]117-captain wentworth which [a man of sense]2179-a man of sense could value . There [she]93-anne felt [her]93-anne own inferiority very keenly . The disproportion in [their]2175-their fortune was nothing ; it did not give [her]93-anne a moment 's regret ; but to have [no family]2180-no family to receive and estimate [him]117-captain wentworth properly , nothing of respectability , of harmony , of good will to offer in return for all the worth and all the prompt welcome which met [her]93-anne in [[his]117-captain wentworth brothers]1391-his brothers and [sisters]888-sisters , was a source of as lively pain as [her]93-anne mind could well be sensible of under circumstances of otherwise strong felicity . [She]93-anne had but [two friends in [the world]237-the world]2183-two friends in the world to add to [his]117-captain wentworth list , [Lady Russell]101-lady russell and [Mrs Smith]182-mrs smith . To those , however , [he]117-captain wentworth was very well disposed to attach [himself]117-captain wentworth . [Lady Russell]101-lady russell , in spite of all [her]101-lady russell former transgressions , [he]117-captain wentworth could now value from [his]117-captain wentworth heart . While [he]117-captain wentworth was not obliged to say that [he]117-captain wentworth believed [her]101-lady russell to have been right in originally dividing [them]2185-their , [he]117-captain wentworth was ready to say almost everything else in [her]101-lady russell favour , and as for [Mrs Smith]182-mrs smith , [she]101-lady russell had claims of various kinds to recommend [her]101-lady russell quickly and permanently .

[Her]101-lady russell recent good offices by [Anne]93-anne had been enough in [themselves]2185-their , and [their]2185-their marriage , instead of depriving [her]93-anne of [one friend]2186-one friend , secured [her]93-anne two . [She]101-lady russell was [[their]2185-their earliest visitor in [their]2185-their settled life]2187-their earliest visitor in their settled life ; and [Captain Wentworth]117-captain wentworth , by putting [her]101-lady russell in the way of recovering [[[her]101-lady russell husband]2315-her husband 's property in [the West Indies]1934-the west indies]2189-her husband 's property in the west indies , by writing for [her]101-lady russell , acting for [her]101-lady russell , and seeing [her]101-lady russell through all the petty difficulties of the case with the activity and exertion of [a fearless man]2191-a fearless man and [a determined friend]2192-a determined friend , fully requited the services which [she]101-lady russell had rendered , or ever meant to render , to [[his]2315-her husband wife]222-his wife .

[Mrs Smith]182-mrs smith 's enjoyments were not spoiled by this improvement of income , with some improvement of health , and the acquisition of [such friends]2194-such friends to be often with , for [her]182-mrs smith cheerfulness and mental alacrity did not fail [her]182-mrs smith ; and while these prime supplies of good remained , [she]182-mrs smith might have bid defiance even to greater accessions of worldly prosperity . [She]182-mrs smith might have been absolutely rich and perfectly healthy , and yet be happy . [Her]182-mrs smith spring of felicity was in the glow of [her]182-mrs smith spirits , as [[her]182-mrs smith friend]546-her friend [Anne]93-anne 's was in the warmth of [her]182-mrs smith heart . [Anne]93-anne was tenderness itself , and [she]182-mrs smith had the full worth of it in [Captain Wentworth]117-captain wentworth 's affection . [His]2315-her husband profession was all that could ever make [[her]182-mrs smith friends]238-her friends wish that tenderness less , the dread of a future war all that could dim [her]182-mrs smith sunshine . [She]182-mrs smith gloried in being [[a sailor]2248-a sailor 's wife]2198-a sailor 's wife , but [she]182-mrs smith must pay the tax of quick alarm for belonging to that profession which is , if possible , more distinguished in its domestic virtues than in its national importance .

Finis
